descriptions.overview: Enjoy quick gas grilling during the week and slow charcoal cooking on the weekends with the all-in-one Char-Griller DUO 5050 grill. The Char-Griller DUO provides 1,260-sq-in of BBQ grilling and smoking space. Both sides feature 438-sq-in cooking area, porcelain coated cast and iron grates. The gas side features dual smoke stacks for even heating, 3 burners with 40,800 BTU output, electronic ignition, and a 12,000 BTU side burner. The charcoal side features 438-sq-in cooking area, warming rack, adjustable fire grate with easy dump ash pan and a double lined bottom. For Texas smoking add The Side Firebox (item 11236).
list: Char-Griller DUO dual-function combo grill offers the benefit of gas and charcoal grilling on the same cart for convenience, fun and flavor all-in-one

3 durable stainless steel burners deliver a total of 40,800 maximum BTUs to grill ribs, chicken or burgers simultaneously, and the 12,000-BTU side burner offers extra cooking space for side dishes or sauces
Porcelain-coated cast-iron cooking grates maintain consistent temperatures, prevent food from sticking and are easy to clean for a hassle-free grilling experience
384-sq in warming racks provide additional space for cooking corn-on-the-cob, kabobs, toasting buns or keeping foods heated until serving time
Electronic ignition provides quick, reliable startups with the push of a button
Side burner with a flip-down cover converts to a fixed side shelf, offering increased surface space for food prep, utensils or dishes
2 built-in temperature gauges allow you to easily monitor heat levels to prevent overcooking, and the dual smokestacks help create even heat across the cooking surface, so food cooks at the same rate
Adjustable charcoal tray offers added heat control, and the removable ash catcher allows for a trouble-free cleanup
Grill converts to a Texas-style smoker when you attach the Char-Griller side firebox (sold separately)

reviews.title: "Grilling or Smoking all Good!"
reviews.text: 5 years ago I bought the Side Fire Box and used it for our grill (just the wife and I). 16 months ago, I purchased the Char-Griller Duo and attached the side fire box. For thirteen months, we grilled steaks, chicken, burgers, kabobs and enjoyed it very much (especially the charcoal side). A few months ago, I finally got he courage to smoke meat and it could not have worked better! Steaks, chicken, ribs, stuffed jalepenos (bacon wrapped)... could not be more pleased with the results!
reviews.author: KevinJD

reviews.title: "Price increases?"
reviews.text: I bought this grill in 2011-2012, It rusted out once when a hail storm detroyed my cover.  I've since rebuilt it and removed most all of the rust and repainted.  Replaced any defective parts.  Still works fine.  I do reccomend lining the interior with heavy duty aluminum foil to protect. I replaced the cover and also use a tarp over that for double layer protection.  Nothing messing with it now.  I would say that when I bought this grill it was on sale for $199 and has since gone up to $299 and now $329.  I've seen it go on sale for $269 and for $249 but never has it gone back down to $199.  FYI Home Depot has the newer model of this unit from Char Griller in the low $200's.  I'm not sure why Lowes continues to raise the price on this unit which came out in 2011.  Their cost has not gone up, but the margin they are making on the item has.
reviews.author: cypher1299

reviews.title: "It's Good... But it could be GREAT..."
reviews.text: Over all it is a Very Good Grill bringing the best of both worlds together... Sadly as many have written about.. The Wheels and the Lower frame are "Poor" quality... and no matter how you assemble it.. at best it is shaky... I have the side fire box attached.. the spacers that come with that... are a little to long.. so the fire box sits at an awkward upward angle.. and since you have to move it from that side .. it makes moving it a pain in the ...... always feels like the Box will rip off... and the screws stripped out the same day I built it.. I will have to redesign the mounting add a support bar and use full length screws... all of which could of of been avoided... if it was built the right way from the factory... I like the way it smokes and cooks... a little tricky regulating the temps.. but with some further Mods..(Charcoal side) all will be OK... Still BIG BANG for the BUCK... and the factory cover works just fine with the Side fire box...It was a House Warming - Christmas Present from my Mom.... Thanks again Mom......:)
reviews.author: The "Wizard"

reviews.title: "Duo™ 5050 Gas & Charcoal Grill w/Side Fire Box"
reviews.text: Ok to start with, I have read almost every review of this product from every source possible and there are some great points made and some that are just silly. Step by step and how I overcame some of the issue that seem to be real and the silly things as well.Packaging – This is a very heavy grill in a single box. It weighs in at approximately 168lbs. The first unit I got from Lowes had damage on the edge. Damage was not noticed until I got home and started taking it apart. The damage was were the top and bottom shell set and had crushed the edges of both parts. Lowes replaced it without issue. Fit and Form – This unit is made with some fairly heavy steel but they will still flex and bend until completely mounted and secured. I would suggest a Dead Blow hammer to help correct this fitment issues. Smoke leakage –When installing the fire box I found that the 2 standoffs were too long, causing a major gap between the box and the body. I cut a 1/4” off them leveling the fire box and closing the gap. I also used 2000 deg. RTV gasket seal between the box and body.  Leakage around the door and cover was also a big issue. I fixed this by adding self-stick gasket used in the EGG smokers and Fireplaces. Rust – This is one of the more silly things. I live in the desert so rain isn't a big deal, common since says metal rust. Take precautions, cure the unit, sand off small rust spots before they become an issue, paint the outside with High Temp Engine Paint or Stove Paint, cover it up with a good grill cover, don't store it out in the rain and take care of it like for it. Overall- This is a nice grill setup, it's a great price compared to some of the professional grills costing in the Thousands, it pretty well made and most importantly it works. My total cost for the extras I used was less than $20.00 bucks and I feel they were well worth it and with proper care and cleaning think this grill will last many years.
reviews.author: wmlipe

reviews.title: "Money waste, Rust Bucket, Pain!"
reviews.text: Had for less than a year. Rusted all over, and always used cover and cleaned and dried. Taken care of for nothing. Went up in flames! Hose from ignitor to tank burnt up. Not worth the money! Very unhappy with purchase. Warranty covers nothing.

reviews.title: "All around perfect item"
reviews.text: I live the convenience of having a combo with the side burner. Plenty of space to fix enough food for a lot of people. I will soon be purchasing the side firebox. My previous grill was also a chargrilled that I have had for nearly 12 years. But it was strictly charcoal with the side box. Great quality products and great value. I've enclosed two pics of each one. I still have my original.
reviews.author: CharlesBoyer

reviews.title: "Look No More!"
reviews.text: This is the best grill I have owned! I have had everything to trailer cookers, smokers, patio grills etc. DO add the firebox if you like to smoke meat low n slow. I have 2 of these and one of them is over 13 yrs, old. The key is keep them out of the rain. Love it especially for Whole Brisket. Slow cooked for over 13 hrs without any hot spotsAdd the Afterburner (online) to your firebox and smoke with gas. You will never know you didn't use hard wood.
reviews.author: SumpinsCookin

reviews.title: "BUYER BEWARE !!"
reviews.text: After less than six months, this product was covered in rust and now looks horrible. The company said the metal was heated to a temperature that exceeded the manufacturers warranty causing the metal to weaken and rust. I only used the original burners included, so I guess I should have only cooked on the low or medium setting. The manual never said anything about that. I think they used cheap, inexpensive metal to make this unit. Also, one of the "cast iron" grates came snapped in two. I guess that was made cheaply as well. BUYER BEWARE !!
reviews.author: Jimmy

reviews.title: "Looks good, rating is for package and handling."
reviews.text: I want to give this a 3.5/5. If it weren't for the handling, I would have given this a 4/5. However, for the price, looks great and seems to work like before. I had one of these a few years ago before moving states. Previous one was definitely a 4.5/5, maybe a 5/5. It was an amazing grill for what it was made of and the effort it took to assemble it. This one, the directions were pretty straight forward and updated, but could be simplified or clarified in many parts still. Just pay attention to the pictures and my advice, take it easy and slow. From a fabrication stand point, the actual hardware is cheap, but what do you expect. The material is a little thin, but the whole unit probably weighs in at around 160 lbs without packaging... so what do you expect. My main concern was with how everything came out of the box. Don't get me wrong, assembled and currently sitting I like this grill a lot, however, I deal a lot with Lowe's and the parts were definitely mishandled somewhere. Some of the items were hard to line up and still have major gaps for the cooking area. I'll have to bend it back and fix those areas before use. Lots of scuff marks, almost like it fell off the truck or something. But I did ask for an unassembled unit so I could fit it in my vehicle to take home, so what do I really expect.... Anyways... here's some pictures of it fully assembled. Probably took me roughly 3 hours watching TV, drinking some brewskis, and taking my time to follow the directions to make sure I didn't miss directives. Would recommend this grill and would buy again.
reviews.author: Stephen

reviews.title: "What a grilling BBQ machine!"
reviews.text: I waited after reading all the reviews. Didn't want to jump right out and be wrong. I love my grill. Put it together with my son on Father's Day. Took a while but so worth it. Not flimsy heavy and when tight handle moves this in and out of garage sturdy! I am a Charcoal grilling smoker. It is nice and big example to full racks of spare ribs with plenty of room left over. I inderect smoke at least weekly. So great. Use side burner to light the charcoal starter. So perfect for that. Use gas very little for a quick burger at lunch or hot dogs. One Note char griller sent me a new grilling grate no issue due to it cracked when opened. Great Experience. Love it! Added a foil layer around lid opening to seal smoke in. Cheap mod there! Take care of it! Will treat you perfectly!
reviews.author: 88crabs

reviews.title: "Completely corroded and rusted out"
reviews.text: Had this grill for a little over a year. Kept it protected and it rusted out completely the grates rusted first the brackets that hold the heat shield rusted completely off. It's pretty bad considering the price. I would never recommend this grill to anyone
reviews.author: Bart

reviews.title: "Happy so far.."
reviews.text: I've had this duo grill with the smoke box for approx 2 months. Have smoked ribs and a pork butt. All have come out excellent. There are hot spots when smoking on the charcoal side. Food needs to be on the far left side of the grill as the heat from the smoke box is too intense for the food thats close to it. Makes it hard to fill the grill up because you need to rotate away from the smoke box side. Opening up and switching food around loses heat. The thermostat isn't worth a hill of beans, but none of the dial types are. You must use a good probe thermometer when smoking anyway. The gas side works GREAT. Very happy. 3 burners are plenty for my husband and myself. The side burner is excellent for starting charcoal in a chimney starter. Great job designing that! I had Lowes assemble and deliver. IT WAS FREE Whoop Whoop. That's the only way to go. I too have had grease drip off the hood down the back when the hood is opened. Should fix that design flaw. I also ordered a very long Arkansas Razorbacks BBQ mat from Lowes online to help save my concrete patio. Make sure you get a cover and use it. I fear rust will be the biggest con I will have. So far,so good...
reviews.author: CoraApple

reviews.title: "Dream Grill"
reviews.text: The ONLY thing that would make this grill better is if it were stainless steel, but I'd imagine the cost would be prohibitive. The value far exceeds the need for anything sleek and flashy. We assembled it with no hassles and in a reasonable amount of time. I've used it 5 or 6 times in less than two weeks and could not be happier with operation and clean up. It is very heavy and difficult to move on any uneven surfaces, but so stable when in place. We looked at this for about six months before finally pulling the trigger and regret waiting that long!
reviews.author: HappyHome

reviews.title: "Trio BBQ gas charcoal and smoker"
reviews.text:
Awesome BBQ ease of use and cooking for the evenings we want a quick meal. The charcoal grill works well even for a slow cook for a roast for 5 hours. Make a full ring with your coal, if smoking wet your chips and spread on top. Light one side and your off. Temperature control was a breeze for the coal, the gas sometimes is finicky. 
Tip make sure you shim the barrels to drain to the centre. Grease tray works best if gravity is in its favour.
Adding a wood stove rope seal is beneficial around the lower barrel, top lid sits over the edge of the lower and when smoking/slow cooking you will have condensing grease from the lid drip down. BBQ mat or a drip sheet of plywood a good add on for underneath BBQ 

Downfall is Lowes does not carry the char grill portable charcoal/side smoker
reviews.author: Steve 6048

reviews.title: "Best Father's Day Gift Ever"
reviews.text: I bought this as a Father's Day gift for my husband, he loves to grill and smoke food. He likes to cook on charcoal but in a when in hurry we use gas. This fit the bill for all. He loves it. Lowes put it together for free so that was an awesome bonus and we got a free cover and bag of charcoal. It really keeps the heat and gets hot quick. I can't wait to buy the attachment smoker box. The grill has plenty of room to cook a lot of food at once and it seems quite sturdy and durable. We grill even in Michigan winters, just shovel of the deck so it will get a lot of use.
reviews.author: agouldt

reviews.title: "Rusted in < 1year"
reviews.text: I was very excited to buy this grill with the option of gas and charcoal in one grill. All was great till about 6 months after I bought it. I started noticing a little rust on top around the smoke stacks on the gas side. Then taking a closer look, I noticed the top grill rack starting to rust as well. Over the next 5 months, the rust just kept coming. As I was grilling today, I noticed little flakes of rust on my corn on the cob. That's it, had enough. Time to buy a new grill. I'm very disappointed, cause I didn't plan on spending $299 for a one year use of a grill. I will definitely make sure I read all the reviews before buying my next grill.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Chargriller Duo Rust Out"
reviews.text: This is an item that looks great in the store, but fails to stand up to the elements even when covered by a grill cover. Thed Chargriller DUO has rusted out in many areas. The gas side grates lasted less than 18-months, the heat deflectors wore out in less than 2-years and now the entire barrell bottom has rused out on the gas side. The charcoal side is showing the same problems but a little slower rate. I purchased the optional smoker and it is showing some of the same rust issues. In the photo I uploaded notice the slant of the Gas side of the grill, this due to the barrell rusting out. I also will let you know that I cleaned my griull each season and tried High Temp Black Grill paint after removing the visible rust each spring to na avail. This is the Yugo of grills.
reviews.author: DLV11

reviews.title: "Falling apart"
reviews.text: Great concept but poorly constructed.  After just 4 years in Florida the grill has just about completely fallen apart. In year 3 I sanded a bunch of the rust off and re painted it which only bought me another year. The side burner has fallen through the bottom and the gas part has rusted through the back. The charcoal side is still ok except for the chimney has come apart.
reviews.author: Mrc

reviews.title: "Great versatile grill-packaging sucked!"
reviews.text: When I got the grill home and opened up the box to assemble I found the package holding all the nuts, bolts, washer and related small hardware had busted open and I spent the first 90 minutes unpacking parts and digging out hardware from packing. After that the assembly was pretty straightforward but if you opt for buying the separate table top grill to attach as a smoke box, (as I did), skip ahead to the back few pages that discuss mounting the smoke box so you don't inadvertently install parts that you'll need to remove later.Tried out the grill today by smoking a whole brisket for 12 hours and it worked flawlessly! Other than learning how much Mesquite wood to put in the smoke box to keep that 225 degree sweet spot after a couple of hours I had the hang of it and we were off and running!The whole point of buying this unit is getting the versatility of having a gas grill, charcoal grill & an offset smoker in one affordable unit.So far I'm very pleased and would definitely recommend.
reviews.author: groy1889

reviews.title: "Loving my Grill"
reviews.text: This Grill is just perfect. Not only that it's gas but it's also charcoal.  Are you good so enjoy the flavor of the best of both worlds.  I can also add a smoker to it. The cleanup is easy and it makes our cooking life better.
reviews.author: Hilda

reviews.title: "From Duo to Texas Trio"
reviews.text: While vacationing in Florida, another store was selling the Texas Trio version of this unit (with side box smoker) for $449. US. We almost bought it when we discovered Lowe's Canada had the Duo on sale for $381. Cdn. We bought it, Lowe's assembled it, and I picked it up yesterday! Yehaw! We did buy the accessory side box and suitable cover at the store in Okeechobee FL as Lowe's in Canada doesn't offer or carry these items. No matter; I now have my full Texas Trio. And our Lowe's carries an excellent array/selection of accessory BBQ products to equip and enable me to become a genuine, bonefide, southern BBQ griller n' smoker...y'all.
reviews.author: AREM

reviews.title: "Heavy Duty Unit"
reviews.text: We got this unit about 16 mos ago. It lives under a covered patio in Tn. First thing I did was to replace the plastic wheels with 10" rubber pneumatic ones from HFT-$4ea and a new thicker and longer axle; next, I converted it to natural gas. Had to disassemble the inlet manifold and drill out the jets to 1/16". It works terrific! Have only used the charcoal side perhaps 3x, tho I thought we would use that side far more. Hard to argue with the 'right now' aspect of the gas side. Its a very heavy unit, and seems quite sturdy. At $250, it seems a very good value/ I would buy it again.I need to investigate to see if it will accommodate a rotisserie get up.
reviews.author: Plaindriver

reviews.title: "Will not last more than a year"
reviews.text: I bought this grill with high hopes. I really liked the idea of an all-in-one grill. I even purchased the smoker add-on. I have gone through two cover due to the fact that they do not hold up to the elements...UV damage and are not waterproof. No, I can't figure out the point of them either. The grill cooks too hot on the lowest setting but after 7-8 months you will not have to worry about that because it will have rusted out. Mine rusted from outside in and inside out. The ignitor has not worked for months and now the whole inside has rust through. Do not listen to folks that add their review after their first burger. It will NOT last.
reviews.author: CBlouisiana

reviews.title: "Perfect!"
reviews.text: My husband couldn't decide whether he wanted a gas or charcoal grill. With his 30th birthday coming up, I had to make a decision fast! Out of all of the choices out there, I couldn't have gotten more lucky with the Duo grill. My husband, and our guests at his party, were blown away! Since the then, we've used our grill at least once, if not twice, a week. The gas is great when we are in a hurry, but the charcoal side gives us the option to do slower and smokier flavors. The side burner is an incredible addition. One night, we cooked our entire meal with the grill! Meat, vegetables and rice cooking all at the same time can't get any easier.
reviews.author: T

reviews.title: "Top Notch Grill"
reviews.text: I received this grill as an early fathers day gift 2 weeks ago from my wife and kids. The next day I purchased the side box. I have used both the gas and charcoal sides and have smoked 200 pounds of ribs and pulled pork for a charity event. I could not be anymore pleased with the grill. Even temps and easy to clean. Like any metal, clean it and protect it and it will last a very long time. I will say in any charcoal grill, never use lighter fluid or self lighting charcoal, they contain petroleum products that will stick to the metal and cause rust. The cover they have for the grill doesnt fit with the side box. I bought an extra large good quailty motorcycle cover ( one that is water proof not water resistant) that fits the grill and side box perfect. A very happy BBQer.
reviews.author: Flash

reviews.title: "Amazing Grill - Second Time Buyer"
reviews.text: I just purchased this grill for the second time. I am an avid smoker and griller "year round" so my grill is out on the deck 24/7. I was so pleased with it the first time, I "had" to have it again when it was replacement time. After getting spoiled with its duo abilities and sq. inches of cooking space, and its durability I couldn't settle for less. Friends and family are envious of this grill and are never disappointed on the food that comes off from it. I hope that Char Griller continues to make this grill for a very long time, because I am recommending it any time I can. What was even more amazing was that it was still the same price that I paid 5 years ago! Nice!!!
reviews.author: Annie

reviews.title: "Really Happy"
reviews.text: I have been shopping for a grill that would suit every need I have from quick meals to long smoked items. This grill has it all. A gas side that is completely separate from the charcoal side, as well as an add-on firebox that can be used for smoking, which I added. For the price it is and for home use it is an excellent choice. I would not recommended it for any commercial applications as it is not meant for that. The design also allows for repairs to be done fairly easily in the future that make this a lasting product as well. I had no troubles putting it together, however it takes longer than the 45 minutes that they say, which is fine, because I had fun doing it. It is a very heavy grill, with the firebox attached, so I'm not too worried about anyone making off with it. If they did, they would have some trouble. For the do-it-yourself-er, it can be modified to suit any need as the construction is almost all heavy gauge rolled sheet steel with heavy tack and seam welding. All in all, I am extremely happy with the grill. And for those that care, I am a native Texan who's dad taught him well. Note: bullhorns are an option I added.
reviews.author: budp

reviews.title: "Amazing combo"
reviews.text: I have had this grill for about 4 or five years I'm sure they have changed something but besides that I love the control of the the 3 burners and I put a side fire box on mine and have smoked some amazing brisket and pork shoulder the on negative is the cheaply made side burner witch no longer even exist on mine lol but yes amazing grill but for your sake get the side fire box so it's also a smoker!!
reviews.author: Jon

reviews.title: "Meh... It does what it says, but..."
reviews.text: This grill has 0 thrills. It lasted about 2 years before it completely rusted out, and yes, I bought and used the cover kit. This year the center grate fell in because the rear support rusted away and the left side flame deflector rusted out and fell in too.I liked the option of using the side box to add smoke to the charcoal grilled food, but the layout isn't really all that good for smoking a brisket or any poultry. Plus there are a thousand places for air to enter which pretty much makes controlling the temperature impossible. So good for grilling but not for smoking.This will likely be my last CharGriller, and probably my last CharBroil product. They just don't last long enough to warrant their price tag.
reviews.author: DissatisfiedInStMarys

reviews.title: "great purchase"
reviews.text: Gas grilling is very easy anyone can do it . Now when you want to step out of your comfort zone and really start grilling and smoking this is a great product, the price is good and the possibilities are endless for experimentation with smoke. Never the less you can always use the gas side if you do not like the charcoal side or use it if u are cooking a lot of food along with the charcoal side .Keep it clean use a cover and take care of it as u would any purchase and it will take care of you . Having a lot of fun with this grill cooking more outside and spending a lot of quality time with the family OUTSIDE!
reviews.author: DEXTER

reviews.title: "Poor Quality.  Prone to Rust.  Likely to Warp."
reviews.text: I would not recommend this product.  It is my opinion that this product is cheaply made and of inferior quality.My experience is that the charcoal side warped after 1 use.   It warped so badly that the grates would not stay in place.   I filed a warranty claim but it was denied.  The stated reason for the denial was the fire I built must have been too hot.  The fire I built was with standard charcoal briquettes.    I had to take a hammer and beat the grill back into shape .The grill is also very prone to rust.  I have had to spray paint the grill to cover the rust.  I have kept the grill covered with the grill cover that is an accessory for this product.  The grill cover has faded from black to light gray.I do like the this grill is both gas and charcoal.  I have the side-fire box accessory that allows for smoking items with indirect heat.  I have enjoyed this accessory.    In summary I feel there are better made products on the market.  If you do purchase this product, I recommend that you have two accessories  (1) a hammer to beat it back into shape and (2) a can of black spray paint to cover the rust.
reviews.author: GrillGuy

reviews.title: "Worst rust bucket I have ever owned"
reviews.text: Loved it for the first6months after that the plates over the burners rotted out always kept the grill covered and out of the weather treated as suggested with the oil 4 times a year after1 year the bottom of the gas section rusted out and fell off would not recommend this grill to anyone unless you keep it in your kitchen and even then I doubt it would last
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Most Regretful Purchase of 2012"
reviews.text: How to not experience Buyers Remorse? Research, scrutinize warranties and heed bad reviews. It's common knowledge that bad reviews do not and will never make it to the top of the review pile. So did deep people.My first mistake was an impulse buy, boy I really wanted the best of both grilling worlds and I want it now. My neighbors were jealous and my the end of 2012 summer the whole block had one. This grill was my baby and I maintained it like it was my religion. Within a year the thermometer broke and I noticed rust, wire brushed it off and coated with heat resistant paint then oiled it up. Year and half, burner covers started to look frail and rust was back. Year 2, legs are completely rusted out, burner covers crumbled from rust and I'm left with a hunk of junk that is literally on its last leg. Both neighbors who still live on my block experienced the same issues.Contacted Char Griller - they only honor 1 year warranty and rust is not included. Only manufactures defects. I consider selling low quality parts at high quality pricing a manufactures defect. Parts I need cost $55-$75 and they have the nerve to charge $25 for shipping. At least make the parts affordable to those who trusted your company. $400 for 2.5 years, plus the time I spent Experience it, is not my idea of money well spent.You've been warned.
reviews.author: NFFN

reviews.title: "keep it inside"
reviews.text: Being in the great north west we get a fair amount of rain. Being that I have had several units I can see this one will not hold up to being left outside/covered area. Went together witout to much trouble. The unit appeards to be covered in some kind of coating that is not mentioned in the manual about cleaning off. I let it burn off. The side burner is in a recess that fits the charcoal chimminy great, you can use the burner to lite charcoal. the lid for the side burner needs support in the front, it just rests on the burner isolator. The way you install and connect the propane bottle is not friendly. the hoses and the cross brace make it a fight to connect the bottle.
reviews.author: Chief

reviews.title: "Rusty barrel"
reviews.text: I bought this grill almost two years ago for father's day.  I have had to change the heat deflectors out because they rusted away.  I was going to change out the deflectors and the barrel came apart. It had rusted completely through.  I called Lowes and was told that since I didn't purchase the extended warranty they could do nothing for me.  They transferred me to the Char-Griller service line.  They said there was only a one year warranty and they could do nothing for me.The grill worked fine when it was new.  If you expect this grill to last for a few years forget it.  If you buy this grill I would recommend that you purchase the three or five year warranty.  You will need it.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I bought this to replace a cheap gas grill, because I really like charcoal but gas is much more convenient sometimes. Just follow the directions on how to keep it from rusting. It's really that easy. I am disappointed in the cover. It faded to a dull gray in after a few weeks in the sun. It looks bad, but seems to work well and protect the grill. I've had this for almost a year now and still use it 2-3 times per month. No issues with the grates either. I followed the directions about preventing rust inside and out....no problems at all. I also saw the the price as an online price but it was honored in store as "price match" great buy.
reviews.author: USNCPO

reviews.title: "Awful Quality Outweighs the Features"
reviews.text: I can only guess the five star reviews are fairly new owners because I LOVED it for months. But this is the absolute worst quality grill I have ever owned and you should not buy one. Rust began after just a few months. Grates are literally disintegrating in every use and cost a fortune to replace. Not kidding, the grates and entire grill are disintegrating! I even use a matching grill cover. One smoke stack is rusting completely off and I haven't had this grill even 2 years. I have had really cheap grills last twice as long. I read bad reviews about the quality but was so intrigued by this grill. I should have listened.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Best grill I have owned"
reviews.text: I bought this grill on sale last year for about $200 to take the place of two clunky grills taking up space on my deck (gas and charcoal). I also got the side smoker box for about $50. This has been the best grill I have owned. I can fire up the propane side for a quick steak or, if I want to spend an afternoon grilling with friends, I can use the charcoal side and do some nice barbeque on the deck. I have been impressed with the quality of this grill and highly recommend it. Make sure that you buy the cover for a few bucks more to protect it and it may be the last grill you will have to buy. It is money well spent.
reviews.author: bjack

reviews.title: "Good Grill"
reviews.text: I had owned this grill for many years 6 or 7 not real sure. I have to say it was best grill I ever owned. Bought at Lowes so long ago it was and Im just guessing but if I remember right $200 dollars. I will be honest and say 80 % of the time I left it out side with out covering it. Now I cant even use it because rust has gotten so bad. I will probably replace with same grill but the price has gotten so high Im not sure. Its a bonus having both gas and charcoal. Found Receipt. Wrong on price and time owned. Buy one you will be happy. Would push in garage when done with it though
reviews.author: Bhal99

reviews.title: "Good.....But....."
reviews.text: I bought my grill in Jan of 2009. It works great. I also bought the custom cover and it wouldn't stay on, even with the lightest of winds. It finally blew away. That was dissappointing. What was more disappointing was that even with the cover on, my grill had already lost it's color and was starting to rust. That was by summer of 2010. The rust has gotten so bad, I'm thinking about buying a new grill, but one that's more durable and weather proof. Grills are supposed to be outside and you want them to continue to look and function like when you first bought it for more than 1.5 years. If I wanted an indoor grill, I would buy another George Forman (and that aint grilling!).
reviews.author: mr1906

reviews.title: "Duo grill"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill over 2 years ago and I love it. I grill about 3-5 times a week. I use each side about 50/50. I have kept the grill covered when not in use...although I turned up the heat one time after taking the food off to "cook off the junk" and forgot about it for about an hour....peeled some of the paint off the top, but it still works like a charm. The only disappintment is that when you use charcoal, you can't seal up the grill so the briquettes are there for another use, like in a weber type of grill...but I did see that when I purchased this, so it wasn't an unknown. I would recommend this grill to anyone who uses both charcoal and gas....
reviews.author: Scottinsouthbend

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Duo"
reviews.text: The grill seems well made. I've only used it a couple of times but it heats up quickly and evenly. I was afraid the fixed draft stacks on top of the gas grill would result in flare ups but so far that hasn't been a problem. The charcoal grill is easy to adjust and regulate both height of coals and burn rate. It has plenty of room for indirect grilling. The thermometers do need calibrating. One reads about 30° high, the other is nearly 100° high compared to an instant read digital infrared thermometer aimed under the lid at the grill thermometer elements.Unfortunately the quality construction and double grill make the Duo heavy and hard to move so I rated it good instead of excellent on features and design. Due to the weight, it really needs four wheels; probably pneumatic. Also, the open shelf on the bottom is pretty much useless. An enclosed cabinet for storage of cleaning tools, etc. would be more practical. The gas lines are too short for easy connection. There are no pictures showing the recommended orientation of the tank and the lines come pre-attached from the regulator to the grill and single burner. The regulator won't fit under the leg cross brace so the only way to connect the tank without a severe bend in the line is to remove the hose from the burner control and route it around the leg. Still, once assembled it seems like a solid grill and compared to others in the same price range, a good value. I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.author: Ctlman

reviews.title: "dont waste your money"
reviews.text: It was heavy and hard to put together and move. After the assembly we had a few good months of grilling and smoking and it worked just fine. It has been kept on our covered patio at all times. UNFORTUNATELY the grates and the gas grill heat shileds crumbled away and began chipping. My best friend has the same grill with the same problems. NO warranty with this product and i dont recommend you wasting your money. Spend a little more and get a better BRAND!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.author: ProfessionalChef

reviews.title: "Arrived in terrible condition"
reviews.text: after taking all the parts out of the box, EVERYTHING was covered in this caramel colored sticky goop...it took 2 days and a whole can of goo-gone and comet to scrub everything down so it was not so sticky (and it smelled god-aweful too). After all that rust stains began to appear everywhere...very cheap!the instructions were also terrible...parts were mis-identified, and I ran out of several hardware parts before it was finished! The last 20 bolts went in without washers as was shown in the instructions because there weren't enough included.If I could give it a "0" I would but 1 is the lowest.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "No regrets!"
reviews.text: I have always been a slave to the convenince of gas, however I have always the flavor a good charcol grill can impart. After having seen this grill for the first time a couple years ago I knew I had to have one.I've had the grill for a month now and I'm grilling more than ever. The greatest feature of this grill isnt even really advertised. Buy a charcol chimney, fill with charcol and place over the side burner and 10 minutes later your charcoal is ready...Brilliant!....now I can grill with charcoal all the time and it only takes 10 minutes to have the coals ready!I am absolutley thrilled with this grill and will be adding the cover and somker box shortly.
reviews.author: Bgruis

reviews.title: "7 Years and time for a new one"
reviews.text: 7 years and it's time to replace it. The grill has been awesome. I mainly used the charcoal side but it was nice to have the propane section to keep things warm. Not to mention it made quick grilling easy for the Mrs. No heavy charcoal bags and clean up was a snap.The secret to keeping the grill was great seasoning and some light maintenance every other year or so. I used a high heat paint to keep it looking good and made sure to keep the inside well oiled. Added the smoker to the side and it's produced some delicious smoked brisket, turkey, ribs and chickens. Not even a second thought on getting anything else to replace this grill.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "was time for a new grill."
reviews.text: ok our last grill was a cheep little wal mart gas grill we got  for under $80, it lasted around 4 years give or take and even though we kept it covered after a few years it rusted out.  My wife insisted on a gas grill, me, i prefer charcoal, and wanted a smoker type grill. so i figured this would be a good compromise, got the add on smoker box also. assembly was around 3 hours which is roughly normal from what i have read,  good solid unit when all nuts and bolts are tightened up.  controlling the heat is easy once you get used to it. does leak smoke but that can be fixed with heat sealant and fire tape. I've used it to smoke several meals now and my wife loved it all. easy to clean up, as far as all the complaints about rusting and such,  yes, its cast iron so if it isnt properly cleaned up  and wiped down with oil after each use it will rust. I let it cool to the touch, use dawn dish soap and a scrub pad to clean it, then allow it to dry, then i spray it with veggie oil and wipe down every inch of it, i dont bother covering it do to keeping it in the garge, ( garage never smelled better. lol). the guys at the Elizabethtown ky store were awsome as usual with tips from assembly to cleaning.  got it on sale for memorial day and it was the best money i spent in a long time. love this grill. !!!!!!!!! would of given 5 stars except for the loss of smoke and heat wich is a simple fix.
reviews.author: jeff

reviews.title: "Recommended with a Caveat"
reviews.text: We just bought this grill for the second time. We bought another one because the support structure was rusted on the one we had, which was about three years old. Given the rust situation, you may wonder why we bought another one. We like the set-up with charcoal and gas. The lids are heavy and the grill part held up well. We're going to try to make the support structure last longer by putting the legs on wood supports that drain well and regularly treating the legs and undercarriage with material to stop rust. We really wish the support structure was as well made as the grill, but we still love the grill.
reviews.author: BoandPam

reviews.title: "Best value on a grill"
reviews.text: Awesome grill. I researched grills for a long time before deciding on this one. I do most of my cooking with charcoal (use natural lump wood) but it is nice to have a full size gas grill on the other side for big meals. The side fire box and a chimney starter for the charcoal are a must buy. I had never smoked meat before buying this grill but getting started was easy. The results were delicious. There are many different books and websites to help with smoking. Construction is better than the average grill and is sturdy with lots of storage. Assembly time, including side fire box, was 1-1/2 hours. I highly recommend getting the custom cover and properly "seasoning" the grill as directed. Buy this grill!!
reviews.author: Rymaster

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUT THIS"
reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS GRILL 2 1/2 YEARS AGO. IT WAS FINE THE FIRST YEAR AND THEN IT STARTING RUSTING AND ALL METAL FINISH WAS TERRIBLE.ALWAYS KEPT IT CLEAN AND COVERED THIS YEAR I WAS CLEANING IT AFTER THE WINTER AND THE ENTIRE BACK OF THE GAS GRILL WAS RUSTED OUT, NOT MADE VERY WELL AND THE FINISH IS TERRIBLE TO HAVE RUSTED SO BADLY
reviews.author: RICHM

reviews.title: "I honestly don't know what the fuss is all about."
reviews.text: First I would say stop wasting your money on cloth grill covers. They are useless! Put your grill on a covered porch or build a small structure over your grilling area. Steel will rust! Buy a new Caddilac, look under it in a few months, guess what you'll find, RUST! Best advice I can give is keep your grill greased and expect to paint the outside every season with a $7.00 can of high heat paint. Would you think it's cheaper to buy a new grill? It's all about maintainance. I bought this grill 2 yrs. ago and I love it! For my excellent ribeyes I fire up the gas side to sear them on both sides and then I offset cook them over KINGSFORD charcoal to perfection. I'm not picking on anybody but nothing lasts forever. With care and proper maintainance this grill will make you a backyard grilling guru. Just LOVE it! PEACE & BBQ
reviews.author: Grillerandchiller

reviews.title: "Great Buy for the Price!"
reviews.text: I bought this grill and added the side fire box this summer. Have used the heck out of this thing. The gas grill is effective and get up over 800F with all burners lit. The side burner works great to light the charcoal and the smoker with attached offset side box holds a steady temperature with little to no work. I can hold a 225F temp for 3 to 4 hours with one load of charcoal and some wood. I saw this is now a black Friday special for $199.00 That is an incredible deal! I paid $300 including the firebox.1 tip. if you are using the firebox for smoking. Turn the coal pan in the charcoal frill side of the unit upside down. This will help the smoke travel the full lenght of the grill and more evenly distribute the heat.
reviews.author: Seahawk1a

reviews.title: "Good, but not great"
reviews.text: Grill rusts easy and grates/heat plates didn't last more than one season. Overall, it's a pretty good grill. I really like the ability to have both charcoal and gas. I also purchased the smoker box as well and that's a nice feature to have. Don't even bother with purchasing the custom grill cover for it. It won't last very long. I'm now on my second one after the first one faded and all but disintegrated. The second one has faded just as fast and likely won't make it to the winter without dry rotting.
reviews.author: Jeremy34

reviews.title: "Charcoal and Smoker OK"
reviews.text: I bought it about two years ago and also added the third barrel -- the smoker attachment.Materials and engineering are pretty low quality. The side burner no longer works. It rusted and I had to disassemble and repaint with heat resistant paint.The gas grill will probably be dead in one or two more years and I will take out that half, replace with a plank and use it as a side table for the charcoal/smoker.The charcoal/smoker grill is good. Indirect and smoking work very well and if I were to buy again I'd buy only the smallest model (not duo) that has the two-barrel charcoal/smoker.For gas grilling, look at better quality: Weber or Holland, for example.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Good Grill For The Price"
reviews.text: I bought this unit a year ago because it was cheap and had the features that I wanted. I live in Florida where summer rains and high humidity can make short work of anything made of steel. It is imperitive that you coat the grill inside and out with a heavy cooking oil and fire it up for a few hours before you use it. This is a fairly high maintenance grill, but it will last for several years if you keep it clean, oiled, and covered. I added a firebox, but, as is, the heat distrubution in the grill is terrible. I made a baffle of 1/4" steel that makes this grill distribute heat and smoke perfectly. I added wheels to the other legs and braced the firebox and put an X brace between the legs in the back to prevent it from racking. With these modifications I can do virtually anything that any grill can do, regardless of the price. I do almost all my cooking with charcoal but it's nice to have the gas grill for those times when it is convenient. The ability to adjust the height of the charcoal is an imperitive feature, in my opinion. I would like the charcoal grill lid to have a tighter fit but I stuff strips of old towels under the outer edges when I smoke. I would also like the steel used in the charcoal grill to be a heavier gauge to help retaing heat.I am more than pleased with this unit, because it can do everything that I need, but it is not for everyone. If you're not willing to season it with oil, keep it clean, keep it out of the rain, then don't buy it because it will not last.I have very little rust, even after a year of it sitting in the weather all the time. I use the cover made for it. The cover is faded from the intense Florida sun, but no holes or tears yet. I have not had any problems with any part of the grill even after a year of extensive use.
reviews.author: GrillingTime

reviews.title: "Great Value"
reviews.text: I've used this grill all summer now. The gas side is easy and quick to use. The temp is easy to control and I can keep it as low as about 200 deg. up to around 450+ for searing. The charcoal side is great for steaks or for slow cooking/smoking a pork roast. The grill is fairly easy to clean and the grates easy to keep clean. I've read a lot of reviews complaining of rust, and so far I haven't seen any, but you have to season the grill as directed in the manual. I'm sure as time goes on, it will start to rust somewhere. I've owned expensive stainless steel grills costing a lot more than this one, and they have all rusted. If this one does rust out in 5 years, I'll just buy another one. I like it that much. All in all, This is a great grill for the money!
reviews.author: firefighter727

reviews.title: "Gas or charcoal, its always an option"
reviews.text: When looking at grills, I couldn't decide on gas or charcoal.  Well the Char-Griller made that a pretty easy decision since you get both.  At the price point, the model 5050 is sturdy, looks great, very functional and allows you to add the smoker box feature at a later point, which is something I plan on doing.  Check out our video review at the link below.  I highly recommend this grill.
reviews.author: PRA7Reviews

reviews.title: "First Impressions"
reviews.text: I just purchased this grill the past weekend replacing my previous gas, charcoal and smoker. Wanted some more room so I thought maybe an all-in-one was the way to go. I have only cooked on the gas side twice and the charcoal side once but here are my first impressions.Pro'sSpace saverSeems to be decent constructionLove the removable charcoal grate. Just remove and dump ashesLove that you can adjust the charcoal to cooking grate space. You can adjust the charcoal to very close to sear your meat and then move it back down.Very roomy racks on both sides.Temp gauge on both sides.The high of the side burner is very hot and brings water to a boil in a flash.ConsTerrible design where propane tank sits. The hole the tank sits in is too small. I put my tank in it and it takes two of us to snatch it out because it gets stuck. Also, the crossbar between the two legs is at the same height as the regulator so I can't screw it into the tank. I had to set the tank on the outside of the frame.Can't keep the the gas side down below 400 degrees unless you use only one burner.The low on the side burner too hot. Can't simmer something but this has been my experience on the last couple of grills I have owned.Overall I like the grill but only time will tell. I cook on it at least 4 times a week and really wanted a Weber but at this point that was too much money.
reviews.author: LuvGrillin

reviews.title: "Versatile"
reviews.text: I like this grill for the versatility. Having the option of doing a quick cook on the gas side or taking some time and grilling over charcoal. On the gas side I have found that it burns very hot and the burners don't have any real ability to regulate the temperature. Low burns at about 425-450 degrees and high is around 600 plus degrees. If you want to grill those ribs slow and low you may need to get creative or look elsewhere. I'm interested in adding the smoker box attachment to the charcoal side for this very reason. Unfortunately that adds another $75 to the $299 price tag. I wish the upper grill rack was also ceramic coated as it gets used a lot.
reviews.author: sunset76

reviews.title: "Great surprise.!"
reviews.text: This is a very good grill! It is nice to have the ability to charcoal, plus the convenience of gas. The grill is well put together and a very good value. Although the frame is plenty sturdy, it would be a bit wobbley to move around a lot. I will generally have it in one place, so that isn't a problem.Out of the box, it took me about 2 hours to assemble. The instructions were detailed and very easy to follow.Haven't used charcoal yet, but the gas grill works great! Overall this product has exceeded my expectations.What a great surprise!
reviews.author: LynnhoodWood

reviews.title: "Only Lasted 21 months"
reviews.text: Bought this grill during Christmas season 2010. Easy to assemble, but some parts were damaged. Also purchased the grill cover which faded very quickly. Grates wore out after the first year and I replaced them through the company website. The charcoal box worked great while it lasted. Handles cracked after about the first year due to the heat from the grill. If you live near the ocean, realize this grill will not last more than two years. Went to clean the gas side today and the flare breaks fell apart when I began to brush them off. The brackets were rusted through. The upper warming grate rusted out very quickly also. The paint from the charcoal side box cover flaked off when I made a high temperature fire for some thick steaks.
reviews.author: MountPgman

reviews.title: "Over two years and still ticking"
reviews.text: I bought this Grill over 2 years ago. I use it almost every day. We live within 15 minutes of the Gulf Coast and it holds up well. I did purchase the custom made cover and I have touched up some of the rust with rustoleum paint but all in all it holds up well, Sometimes I love to slow cook with alot of smoke and sometimes I love to fast cook with the grill on high got the best of both worlds. I probably use it 5 out of the 7 days of the week. I even cook breakfast on it on the weekends. Love the outdoor living and the gulf breeze in the mourning and evenings.
reviews.author: RJ3rd

reviews.title: "Rust bucket"
reviews.text: Stay away from this, unless youwant to clean and repaint every year. Not for the PNW area.Not easy to clean, and rust is a nightmare. The first year was fine, and kept all clean at all times, and did follow manufacturer instructions. By the second year, I had to dismantle it completly, sand off the rust and repaint a lot.. Was just a waste of time.After a couple uses, the grease will stick to it, and as you try to remove, so will the paint or caoting that might have.Great concept, but it fails. Going for a stainless steel.
reviews.author: Nwphil

reviews.title: "3- burner gas and charcoal grill"
reviews.text: To start, I bought this grill about 3 months ago. The directions for putting the grill together, were basic, straight forward,and really easy to put together. One thing, had one screw to strip out, but I had an extra nut and bolt at home. The second thing, the propane holder was a little small or I have the wrong propane tank, again no problem, I filed the hole and now the tank does not get stuck.Now for the negative reviews I read about the temperature, I have no problem achieving the 300-400 degrees using both the propane and charcoal sides. To give you a heads up, our first steaks off the propane side were blackened and well done, this being the grill cooking on low. Needless to say we like our steaks medium rare.I would highly recommend this grill for cooking on both sides.
reviews.author: ajwinga

reviews.title: "Rusted Under a Year with Maintenance by the book"
reviews.text: Have been grilling for some time now and this is the first grill I have ever had that has rusted in just over 6 months of use. I did exactly what the manual says to do for cleaning and maintenance and always covered it when not in use. The cover dry rotted after 7 months even after scotch garding it to lengthen the life. Extremely disappointed cause it actually cooked everything great until it rusted itself out. It took four months dealing with thier customer service before they finally told me to take it back to Lowes and the store would get an RA and I would get a refund. Lowes customer service was excelent! Char Griller on the other hand was rather slow on response.
reviews.author: Sparks

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I have purchased a lot of grills over the years most of them charcoal. This is a great grill for the money.I used the gas side several times and I read some of the other reviews about the heat going up past 400. But gas is like charcoal you have to control it by turning off burners. I only used 1 burner and did indirect heat and maintained the heat right where I wanted it 300 degrees. I did assemble this myself and it was really easy. It took me about 1 hr and 45 min to complete. I would recommend this to anyone. I'm planning to fire up the charcoal side this weekend and cook some chicken halves or Boston butt. I love the convenience of have the gas to throw some hamburgers & hotdogs on.A must buy if you love to grill!!
reviews.author: JCHop

reviews.title: "Disappointment"
reviews.text: I was excited with what I thought was a great idea in a grill configuration. Gas and Charcoal. Wonderful! Not so fast. I have had this grill for 1.5 years. The drip shields over each burner have rusted completely through. They burners have in turn rusted. I was so disappointed at the fact it has been susceptible to rusting in a short time. And, I have purchased two grill covers that are about $50 each. While it is outside and sits on the deck, it has constantly been covered whenever not in use. Still, it has rusted and that means it will need to be replaced. I have looked into purchasing parts from the maker, but if I have to replace all the burners, shields and other rusted parts I may as well buy a new grill.
reviews.author: Toomuchtrouble

reviews.title: "Just What I was Looking For!"
reviews.text: I looked for months for a combo grill and was blessed to find this one at Lowes. It is great for the price. I have been using it for only a month but am most pleased. As with all outside equipment, a great cover is necessary. Based on the reviews here, I did not buy the one that is custom fit for this grill. I got another one in store and it is great. Bad rains and winds here and it is holding steady! I love the storage compartment under the grill, the instance lighter feature is so convenient, and the side burner is cool as well! Another plus is the grill racks and gas burners are in 3 sections not one whole piece so you can easily grill on one side for 2 people or on all 3 racks for 20 people. So it's easy to just clean up the rack that you use. If you want a combo at a lower price, go for this one!
reviews.author: Cooking RN

reviews.text: After 3 months this grill looks 20 years old.  The paint is peeling and rust is everywhere.  When I contacted the company they said we used too high heat.  This is definitely not true.  Was happy with the grill but very disappointed that the company didn't stand behind their product.
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I've had this grill more than three years old. I've used both sides of this grill so many time. With its large grilling areas I was able to cook larger portions on both sides, great for BBQ cooking. I always had it covered until the cover fell apart the for the past year and a half it was exposed to the weather. But it really held up well with very little rust. The warming racks didn't hold up as well as the cooking grates. I'm getting a new grill (same one) now. I could have gotten a few years out of it but we had a grease fire that burned off the paint. But my experience has been a very positive one.
reviews.author: NickB

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: I love the grill, the only problems I have found is on the charcoal side. I am having a problem with the grease dripping from around the screws in the bottom. Also on the gas side, the bottom of the grill is to close to the top of the gas tang (approx: 1" from the valve).
reviews.author: BubbaG

reviews.title: "Wonderful Birthday Gift"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill as a birthday present for my significant other. After our first grill met its maker, I decided it was time for a new one. This grill has the best of both worlds. There are three grates per side which make it easier to clean and use. The grill is heavy duty and cooks food evenly.I ordered the grill via telephone since I did not see anywhere I could select the option online to have it assembled for free. The representative let me know that it would be assembled for free and ready to pick up within 20 mins. The store also called me to confirm everything. One week after I purchased this grill at full price it went on sale for the 4th of July. Lowes gave me a credit with no hassle which we used on the grill cover. Great service!
reviews.author: wheaties

reviews.title: "love it"
reviews.text: i have owned my grill for abit over a year now and hae only used the charcoal side of it with the smoker fire box. I have had propane grills and don't really like the taste of the food therefor i use the charcoal side with wood chips and man what a taste. I have read reviews of rusting out and bad cover...well mine hasn't rusted out as of yet and the cover to me works great! I take the firebox off the side and we take it camping with us and it's perfect for some burgers and hotdogs. The trick with this grill is keep it clean, i clean mine the next day after use once it's cooled off. I bought a boiler brush (stainless steel) and use it to clean the charcoal tray and wash the grills in hot soapy water and coat them with vegetable oil. if you want something to last you must take care of it and keep it clean. not just let it sit on your deck and die! My wife and kids bought me the firebox and rotisserie so i have the complete package and as long as you keep it clean and covered i will have this grill for along time to come.
reviews.author: Larry-

reviews.title: "Decent but not good enough to last"
reviews.text: I was given this grill for my birthday just over 3 years ago and I followed all seasoning directions as well as a cover but the grill started rusting regardless of what I did. Within the first 2 weeks the side burner had burned itself out and I began to find other parts of the gas grill that were unsatisfactory as far as manufacturers build quality. I started to contact the manufacturer about replacement parts but have decided to just replace the grill with another. If I can find a grill with similar features that this one has I am going to purchase it but if not then I will just buy another one of these from Char-Griller.
reviews.author: coachwn

reviews.title: "Best grill I've owned for the price"
reviews.text: I bought this in March. We did not get to really use it until May. It is great. We use the gas side during the week and the charcoal on the weekends. Love being able to do this, as meat cooked on charcoal tastes best! If I have any complaints it would be controlling the tempature on the charcoal side. Cannot seem to get it to stay at around 300, but probably something I am doing wrong. Still if I need to cook ribs and want to slow cook, I use gas. Highly recommend it! No issues with rust, but I clean and oil it after every use. It is cast iron, so you have to take care of ti.
reviews.author: garyj4

reviews.title: "Best Grill I ever owned"
reviews.text: I have been looking for a long time for a quality dual Gas/Charcoal grille and finally found it. We have used it several times now and has been flawless. This grill was a little pricy. Two weeks later, after purchase, saw where I could have saved $100 when Lowes put it on sale. I use the charcoal side for all my meat and the gas side for sides, works out perfectly and plenty of room. The unit is heavy, but I keep it in one place so no worries about the wheels holding out. If the unit is moved alot, would recommend replacing the wheels with metal ones instead of plastic.
reviews.author: Ricky

reviews.title: "Rusted out"
reviews.text: I really liked this grill! I had the cover for it and kept it covered when not in use. I have had the grill since 2013. I went out to spray the grill with grill paint and I was cleaning it up a bit. It was not dirty though just faded paint I guess from the Southern heat. Anyway, I noticed what I thought was grease on the bottom, to my surprise it had multiple rust holes on the bottom on both sides, LP and charcoal. If it were not for the rusted out bottoms the grill would be in great shape. I have never had a grill rust the bottom out. Burners yes, grates yes, bottoms know.
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "LOVE IT!"
reviews.text: Have had my grill a couple of months and love it. I got it already assembled (all were pre-assembled) and had to fix and tighten a few things at the house. No big deal. I took plenty of time and cured it like the instructions said to help prevent rusting. I use it a few times a week, mainly the gas during the week and coals on the weekend. I did find when using it as a smoker that smoke was leaking around top pipe and between body and fire box. Quick easy fix! Get some high temp (orange) Permatex gasket maker and run a small bead between bolted together parts.
reviews.author: Sharkbait

reviews.title: "Extremly Disappointed"
reviews.text: I purchased the grill in April of 2009. Thirty days I purchased the side fire box and the cover. The first problem I had was grease dripping off the back of the lid onto our deck when it was open. I believe it is an design flaw as I have owned several grills and never had this problem. The ash drawer on the side box doesn't fit well at all. The rails that it rides on seem to be mis-aligned. The cover started to fall apart by the end of the summer of the 2009. I emailed and called the company concerning all of these items and got no return calls or email response. I tried keeping the cover together with duct tape to no avail. I have not been able to find a large enough cover for replacement and the grill is rusting badly inside and out.
reviews.author: Carl

reviews.title: "Can tell it was made in the USA"
reviews.text: This piece of equipment is outstanding. I added the firebox for smoking meat and works perfectly. Even a buddy in San Antonio is buying this. And he barbecues all year. The ONLY thing i wasn't pleased with is, in adding the firebox, the end handle needs to be removed and a smaller handle is added and lifting the 180 plus lbs. puts alot of strain where the firebox meets the grill. So, I added two nicely routered pieces of hickory so that i can move it like a wheelbarrow. Perfect! Also removed the wheels (which were fine# and put on to mini 4 wheeler tires with aluminum rims. #no spinners) I love this grill. Wife says I spend too much time with her, um it. But she loves the food, so its a keeper!!!
reviews.author: Marty357

reviews.title: "Chargriller Duo"
reviews.text: I have had this product three years. The idea behind it is good however the quality of the product is bad. After one year the tabs the hold the burner covers in place rusted and were gone. The answer from the company was you keep this outside. Yes I do under a cover. I had to order a complete replacement bottom barrel. Now a year later and the tabs have rusted and are gone again. A simple design change to have these bolt on would make replacing these easier. I have noticed the price has dropped about $100.00 since I bought mine. Still too much for this product.
reviews.author: terry

reviews.text: I have had a chargriller grill for about 4 yrs and have now purchased this one which I will pick up tomorrow. They make awesome grills and my original grill has held up great but now want the gas option also. My existing grill has been outside for 4 yrs with no cover on it and has only a little rust by the ajustable vent. Just remember when you cover a grill it is being protected from the element like the sun, rain , snow as you leave that cover on it does get moisture under it that will not dry as long as that cover is on so it is going to rust. Hope this grill is as great as my other one.
reviews.author: kevno

reviews.title: "Great Purchase"
reviews.text: I went on Lowe's website looking for a new grill and saw this one.I purchased it for $249.00,it was on sale, and had them put it together for me and deliver it.The only thing i had to do was put a battery in the igniter button.I seasoned both sides of the pit as directed and found it held my desired heat for 3.5 to 4 hours.The same day i seasoned it I cooked on it and loved it.I would have bought it sooner if i had known it was this good of a pit.I have absolutely no regrets or anything bad to say about this pit.I have used it numerous times already and I love it.
reviews.author: billyboy3026

reviews.title: "Poor quality"
reviews.text: Bought in March 2008 along w/ custom cover. Started rusting @end of 2008. Support brackets for flame deflectors on propane side rusted out/broke off summer of 2010. Tried working with manufacturer to no avail. Started out helpful went downhill. No satisfaction. Disappointed to pay that money for such poor quality design. Barrel integrity OK, just a lot of rust on the cooking grates and wire tray on propane side. Will not buy CharGrill again. Too bad as they are American company.
reviews.author: disappointed

reviews.title: "My Go-to Grille for everything!"
reviews.text: I bought this and the small side-box add-on a year or so ago. It's done well for everything from chicken to steak to prime rib roasts! I use the charcoal side for "real" food and the gas side for hot dogs, etc. We've even broken in the side burner for a few veggies, etc. - but it will blacken a pot in no time flat! My only request would be a one piece expanded metal or cast grille for the charcoal side instead of the 3 piece. I'm thinking of designing a chain drive hoist for the char side grille - wouldn't that be neat! I did have to replace the lower charcoal grate because the spot welds came loose - other than that it's smokin' like a loco!!
reviews.author: UncleHank

reviews.title: "Worst purchase ever"
reviews.text: Had a Char-Griller Charcoal grill with firebox. Most wonderfull grill I've had. Besides grilling, many a brisket, salmon, and chicken were smoked on it. When It finally wore out, I had already purchased an electric smoker, so I purchased the dual charcoal/propane grill. That was around mothers day 2012. I live in the Dallas area where the climate should be kind to grills. I've always kept the grill covered. In less than a year, I've had to replace the igniter, regulater, and knob for the side burner. I would not recommend this grill to anyone.
reviews.author: edkocial

reviews.title: "LOVE THIS GRILL !!!"
reviews.text: Great grill got it as a early fathers day gift.(Was on sale for $199) Early it is then no complaints from me. Just wish they would have had more covers in tho. Great for the whole family the wife and I, 3 kids, 2 grandkids, Son-In-Law, Dad, Brother and Sister in law and nefew. 12 people and no problems. Great for the price, the covers another $40. GET THEM IF YOU CAN!!
reviews.author: chefjoker

reviews.title: "Was not the best decision I ever made"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill on August 4th of 2011. It seemed to be the grill I was looking for and was able to use it for almost two years. I seasoned it exactly the way the instructions said to season it, and I kept it covered with the cover made for it when not in use.It started rusting after 9 months of use. I even bought some high temp grill paint and brushed off the rust, and repainted it in the spots that were rusting.Needless to say, it did not work, it just kept rusting.If you do not mind buying a new grill every two to two and one half years, this would be the grill for you.I would not recommend this to anyone, not even an enemy.
reviews.author: None

reviews.title: "Horrible Customer Service"
reviews.text: I recently purchased the Char-Griller Duo Black 3-Burner (40,800-BTU) Liquid Propane Gas Grill from Lowes.com for my fiancé for father's day. I had triple checked the measurements of the box so that I would be able to fit this in my vehicle. The closest Lowes to me was a 40 minute drive but worth it I thought for this grill. I even had my mother in law purchase the grill cover for him as a father's day gift . I drove 40 minutes on Saturday the day before father's day to pick this grill up. I walked into the Delavan Lowes location and noticed there was a grill all assembled right next to the entrance. It was the same grill I had purchased online so I decided to check in out while I waited for Customer Service to be free. There was an invoice taped to the front of the grill with my name on it and phone number and all my information. I thought to myself “there is no way THIS is MY grill”. The grill I was looking at was filthy (I have attached photos). The grill I was looking at was CLEARLY a floor model grill meant for display only. It had clearly been a grill that was brought outside daily for display. The grill I purchased online was supposed to be BRAND NEW. Also, The grill I purchased was supposed to be IN A BOX. There was no way I was fitting this assembled grill into my vehicle. I went up to customer service once they were free and spoke to them about my concerns. The gentlemen at the desk preceded to pour water from his water bottle onto a paper towel and attempt to clean the grill right in front of me. He could tell I was a little upset so he called a manage up to the front. The manager offered me a 10% discount on this grill. I was still very unhappy but my mother in law had already purchased the cover for this and my father in law was all set to give my fiancé some great steaks to grill our father's day dinner. I accepted the deal because I didn't want to be empty handed on father's day morning. Then there was a transportation issue. There was no way the grill was going to fit in my vehicle. I asked if I was able to have them deliver it for me and they said it would cost extra. I asked if they could disassemble the grill and put it back in the box and they said they no longer had the box. I had to contact my mother in law who had to drive 40 minutes herself to come and pick this grill up for me and deliver it to our house. The employees that I was speaking with acted like I was actually getting a deal because it came assemble even though that isn't what I wanted AT ALL. To say that I had a horrible experience with Lowes is an understatement. Needless to say I will no longer be purchasing ANYTHING from lowes.com and definitely will not be shopping at the Delavan location.
reviews.author: Talya

reviews.title: "great product goes together fast"
reviews.text: This is the first time for me with a char griller or char coal grill. I can't wait to use this this weekend. Contrary to what others have said it was a breeze to put together. I wish the basin and lids were a little thicker material but they should hold up well. Lowes says that they are stainless although I can't find it in the manual that they are for sure. Seems like a lot of grill for the money plus a side burner. I also have no problem with the wheels. I put it together in the kitchen and wheeled it out onto the deck over the thresh-hold of the door with no wobbles or problems.
reviews.author: super-man

reviews.title: "Great Grilling Solution"
reviews.text: I searched around for a grill that would do both gas and charcoal, and a friend mentioned this grill to me. I was nervous about it (some of the reviews were a little lackluster), but decided to purchase the grill anyway. I put it together in a couple of hours and just in time. We had a party at our house the next day and everything went perfectly. I decided to "kick the tires" and use both sides simultaneously...with great success.I'd likely recommend this grill to anyone interested in purchasing a duo-type grilling solution!
reviews.author: Jim99

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I've had my grill for 2 1/2 years at my beach house in North Carolina and is has performed great. I've not seen the rusting problems that some have reported. As far as the cover it's not durable at all. It tore the second time I removed it. I replaced it with heavy duty commercial Chargrill cover and it works good. For the money you can't beat this grill. Satisfied customer.
reviews.author: DH54

reviews.title: "Best Grill on the Planet!"
reviews.text: This grill combines outdoor cooking flexibility with ease of use like no other grill I've seen. You can offer your freinds grilling either way they want it, gas or charcoal, at the same time, while also warming your other fixins on the side burner. If you have a large group, you can charcoal and move the cooked burgers/ribs, etc to the gas side to use as a warmer until all your food is charcoaled. The grill seems sturdy and provides significant room underneath to store supplies. The charcoal side has a bottom tray that is easily removed to clean out the used charcoal ashes. This grill is about performance and flexibility, however, and perhaps not the best looking grill in the pack.
reviews.author: Chuck

reviews.title: "Great deal!"
reviews.text: I bought the grill online and had it delivered assembled. I went to the store and bought the side firebox for the smoker and installed it Saturday morning. After curing the smoker I smoked a shoulder for 21 hours and it was perfect. The only temperature variance was on the low side while I was at church on Sunday Morning. The only improvement I have come up with so far would be to have a door under the grate level to slide my drip pan in and out of. It is awkward to have to lift the grates (3) while the meat is still present. A smarter and better chef, I use the term loosely, would be better prepared. But I still would like that feature. It also looks great in my pool area.
reviews.author: Grandpa Wingnut

reviews.title: "Perfect Grill for Entertaining"
reviews.text: This grill is great for cooking for large numbers. The grilling area is spacious and the grill itself is sturdy and of good quality. One thing to note is it is very heavy and the assembly was not the easiest. That being said it seems to be a great purchase and looking forward to cooking on it!
reviews.author: Courtney

reviews.title: "THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS!!"
reviews.text: If you like cooking with Gas or Charcoal you have the best of both worlds with this grill. I've read some reviews about how this grill will rust, food does not taste right and it does not clean up easy....well it's because the people who wrote these reviews just lit it up and started cooking! The FIRST thing you need to do is READ THE DIRECTIONS AND FOLLOW THEM!Yes this will rust if:(1) you leave it uncovered and if covered a lot of mostiure gets to it(2) if you did not burn it in right the first time and(3) put vegetable oil on the inside & outside while it was still warm like the directions state!!Even if it does get a little rust on it (and it will) you can brush or lightly sand it off and paint it with heat resistant paint, then it's ok again but ask yourself this: are you cooking on the outside or the inside of the grill? Easy to control the air flow that makes cooking a breeze!! Super grill for the money well laid out design with space to spare!!!
reviews.author: Kurt

reviews.title: "If your going to grill...do the job right!"
reviews.text: I picked up the Grill Mate Duo and the side smoker box August 2012 and have used it at LEAST 2 time per week ever since! I love this grill. I have smoked turkey...(drunken) chicken...beef brisket...pork loin...pork ribs, you name it! All have turned out fantastic. Regular BBQ of steaks...chicken...hamburger and such are easy to get right because this unit hold the heat and for a charcoal grill is a breeze to use! I use mesquite charcoal CHUNKS exclusively because of their heat and flavor advantage. I have found that the heavy gauge construction holds heat well, making it easier to regulate the slow/low cook temperatures required for quality smoking. I have used the gas side a few times and it works very well, but I like the "real" charcoal grilling best of all. This grill ranks up there with units that cost $1200 to $1500.Get the cover too...well worth it.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Rusted on first use"
reviews.text: I've owned this grill for 2 years. The first time I put wood in the side smoker, the paint bubbled and I watched it rust in front of my eyes. When I cook with really high heat (Cowboy charcoal and wood chunks) the main unit bubbles and rusts on the lid also. And yes, it's kept covered when it cools.I love the grill and am trying to decide what to do to replace it since it has rotted out.
