I use it 3-4 times a week between the Coal, Gas and smoker and is awesome for large parties.If you do buy it, make sure you use a really good heat resistant paint on it ASAP.
reviews.author: Too Hot to Grill

reviews.title: "This is my 2nd one. Love it."
reviews.text: The first one I bought and did not take care of it much, had it out in the sun , rain, night etc with no cover and it lasted 4 years. And I used it and abused it. This time I bought the extended warranty and a cover that I highly recommend buying. The parts are available directly from the manufacturer and their customer service it's great. I will buy any product from this brand and I love this BBQ since u get both options and u can cook both ways, charcoal or gas, also you can use one set of grills for both side just move it side to side and you can save the other. All and all it's a great gril.. Only negative is the cover itself will last maybe 6 month in Floridas weather and it's like $40...
reviews.author: Milanesa

reviews.title: "Great grill!"
reviews.text: My husband's father's day gift was a hit!! He loves the duo cooking options. Had it preassembled - free at Lowes. Only drawback so far is that the porcelain-covered grates peeled with the first washing, although I used only water and dishsoap (no scrubbing, only soaked in water for a few minutes). Maybe they needed more oil-coating for extra protection. Be sure to fully pre-treat the grill as instructed before first use. Instructions were a bit confusing re: this process, so read carefully!! Enjoy your grill
reviews.author: Coupe

reviews.title: "Great grill"
reviews.text: I'm a charcoal cooker and have had more than one Char-Griller grill but also wanted a "gas grill" and went to the 50/50 three years ago. Seasoned the grill as the instructions say to and then each spring and fall repeat that seasoning with cooking spray oil. You can smoke a pork butt on the coal side for dinner and cook a burger to have with a cold one for lunch at the same time. This is a great grill for the price!!
reviews.author: bigBob

reviews.title: "Great grill"
reviews.text: Cooks great. Appears durable and built to last
reviews.author: Brandon

reviews.title: "Cast Iron ppl"
reviews.text: i keep reading all these negative posts about rust. Obviously those whose are rusting out haven't a clue how to maintain a good grill for starters the racks are made from cast iron so they are gonna rust if not properly cleaned and oiled after use. Number 2 i cant speak for the quality of the grill covers for this company but those of you who do not cover your grill or keep it out of the elements, don't expect it to last. Its natural for metals to rust especially when combined with heat and moisture (which happens when you cook) regardless of what a what a manufacture does if a grill is not properly maintained it will fall apart. take the time and effort to take care of your grill and it will last for many years.
reviews.author: railer

reviews.title: "Great Grill, Frustrating Service Post Sale"
reviews.text: I like this grill. But trying to get parts for it makes you want to just take a sledge hammer to it. The Lowes clerk says its not their fault, its Char-Grillers fault for not being able to supply replacement parts. Really, with Lowes buying power they can't lean on a vendor to make sure their customers are happy. All I want is a new ash tray since it had rusted through. Now I been force to go to some website and enter information to order it. It gets all the way to check out and then blows up. So now I have a call into their service center. Do yourself a favor. Skip this grill until Lowes does a better job of supporting replacement parts for this thing.
reviews.author: Gschmade

reviews.title: "Great value for price!!!"
reviews.text: Overall, great product for price.Enameled cast iron grill grates are a plus, but would prefer no enamel (personal preference). I would like an adjustment of the charcoal grill height to not require grill gloves; maybe a turn knob similar to other grills I've seen. Was a pain to put together (like all things assembled), but once together felt stable. This thing is big too. So probably not practical for small spaces.But, I get the best of both worlds,, charcoal and gas. Charcoal side does very well and design seems to allow air regulation properly with vent and side adjustments. Gas side has hot spots and seems to not get as hot as I would like sometimes, but may need to preheat longer. But for $250 (sale price), Spectacular!!!!
reviews.author: Cmhubbard05

reviews.title: "Awesome grill!"
reviews.text: I waited a year to review this so that I could see how it held up over time. Purchased this last year around this time because I liked the idea of having a gas grill for quick things like burgers and hotdogs, but charcoal for ribs, steak, etc. I bought it pre-assembled at Lowes so can't comment on how hard/easy it was to put together. I was impressed right away with how heavy and sturdy this is--it is thick metal, like my cast iron pans! Doubt it will ever rust out unlike many cheap (and even more expensive) grills I've had in the past. I did season it with oil as recommended in the instructions and regularly rub down the grilling sections with oil to keep it relatively non-stick (again, anyone with cast iron pans knows to do this!). It has performed wonderfully for the past year, and thanks to a mild winter in PA, I was able to grill year round. I don't have the smoker attachment, but I made a fantastic chili-rubbed smoked pork roast for the Super Bowl using indirect cooking with offset charcoal and a cast iron smoker box with hickory chips place right under the roast. (the instructions that come with the grill tell you how to cook this way) Guests said this made the best pulled pork sandwiches ever!! Both sections of the grill are large and you can fit a LOT of food on it. This grill has outperformed itself time and time again. I would recommend buying a cover to protect it from the elements. Very happy with my purchase!!!!!
reviews.author: DoreenS

reviews.title: "Best Grill I've ever used!"
reviews.text: I believe this is the grill to beat! How can anyone go wrong with such versatility with gas on one side and charcoal on the other? The design is well built and if you READ THE INSTRUCTIONS make sure to CURE your grill according to instructions. I've never heard of doing this but it is supposed to help with RUST. That being said, the gas side lights EFFORTLESSLY with the AA battery and 3-burner ignitor. Charcoal side with added soaked mesquite or hickory (or any fruit tree) wood makes a GREAT smoker. You don't even need the side smoker if you just place your meat on one side and charcoal on the other and let smoke for an hour or two. Then you can put the meat right over the charcoal for a DELICIOUS flavorful meal!. I know this grill will rust just like the rest of them so comparing apples-to-apples, the features, versatility, quality etc. this is a great deal on a high-quality grill.
reviews.author: SmokerFinatic

reviews.title: "Not worth the money"
reviews.text: Have this grill and will say it cooks excellent. Have had this grill for 2 years. The bad is I have never seen a grill rust out so quick. I have a cover on this grill and it is under a small roofed area. Yes it does get wet under the area but you would think the cover would do the trick. Anyway the whole area under the burners totally rusted out and the rails that hold the grates rusted out in spots. And yes I did keep drip tray area clean. I honestly think the grill cover caused most of the surface rust on the outside of the grill because it sweat on the grill. When you take the grill cover off it would be wet from the condensation. So if you have a garage or a shed that you can store this in you probably will be good. I wish it lasted longer cause I really did like this grill.
reviews.author: Stetto

reviews.title: "We will see"
reviews.text: Ok, I am writing a review, however, I have only had the grill for about 3 weeks. But for now, after reading alot of bad reviews, I have prepared my grill for hopefully a long life. So far, the grill was easy to assemble, I did add the side fire box. After seasoning the grill I cooked a brisket, ribs, and sausage. The smoker and charcoal side of the grill are great. The burner side works great. The only negative thing is the propane side, you can only use 1 burner on lowest setting to maintain 300 degrees. When I had all burners on low, the temperature was about 400 degrees. I suggest either the left or right burner on lowest setting, and cooking on the other end of the grill. I did purchase the grill cover, which I saw many negative reviews, but I purchased some Thompson's Fabric Sealer for $8, and now I believe the cover is water proof, and not weather resistant. So hopefully this will keep the grill from rusting like in past reviews.
reviews.author: momiester2

reviews.title: "Mother of all Grills"
reviews.text: this grill is the best. my char broil only lasted about 3 years of heavy cooking. I have had this grill for two months used it about 20 times and I can't get enough BBQ. I think I'm going to buy the smoker soon for more BBQ options. I can enjoy a nice beer on a saturday of slow cooking over charcoal or I can fire up the gas side for a quick fix. Also good for partys I did two beer can chickens on the charcoal side and 15 ears of corn and 12 potatos on the gas side LOVE IT!!!!! You will too!!!!
reviews.author: FLYERS

reviews.title: "Great Grill for the money"
reviews.text: This grill replaced 2 grills that I just got rid of. One rusted out and the other was on its way out. Both grills lasted a good time and I decided to replace them with a combo grill. My wife & I both love charcoal as well as gas. Gas is faster and easier when you have little time, where as charcoal adds flavor and is much slower. Many of the reviews that we read where good in helping us decide on buying this grill. It was very easy to assemble and the quality seems to be great. As for some of the reviews stating that there grill did not last due to rust and or deterioration, probably happened due to not maintaining the grill. You will get some rust, which is an easy fix, and if you read the manual and follow the info on how to maintain the grill it should last for years to come. We cooked a delicious standing rib roast on Easter and it turned out great!
reviews.author: Carlucci

reviews.title: "An Amazing Grilling Experience !!!"
reviews.text: I finally purchased this grill after waiting 20 months debating. I purchased my grill for the 4th of July entertaining, Myself and my cousin were the one that was entertained by the shear performance of this grill ! On 1 chimney of coals I was able the cook a rack of ribs and the whole grill covered with salmon and chicken breasts. If that wasn't enough ,my wife came out with some burgers at the last minute. I looked and saw that my coals were done anf figured I was going to have to go to gas, but instead the burgers cooked in record time beacause of the heat holding ability of the grill. I cooked down my sauce redution on the side burner and it took me a quarter of the time that it did inside my home. This grill is worth twice the price it cost. I also suggest that you purchase Kingsford Competiton coals as they do burn hotter; longer and better than the regular. Happy Grilling !
reviews.author: Don Juan

reviews.title: "Good Combo"
reviews.text: I would say in the summer I grill 5 nights a week. That includes anything from steak, chicken and burgers to pizza and pineapple.During the week the gas side is nice and quick. Very convenient and it gets much hotter than my older grill from SEARS. On the weekend with a little more time, I get the chimney of charcoal going and put something over the coals! Delicious - as for a side by side comparison the charcoal tastes so much better.It took a little over an hour to put the grill together by myself (it was a heavy box). The directions could be a little better, but everything kind of fits into its place easy enough.Honestly though I would not pay $299 for it, but $199 makes it a deal.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "great value"
reviews.text: I purchased mine 3 years ago and it still looks great. Covers faded but that is what it is for to sacrifice itself then what it covers. If you treat it like a cast Iron pan and coat it w/oil inside and out. Just remember this is not a 5 to 600$ grill. If you can afford to buy one of those buy it, however this is great for the price. Buy the fire box to go with it also. Great value, does alot and I have not been disappointed one bit.
reviews.author: gamecockred

reviews.title: "Great grill, poor service at Lowes."
reviews.text:
Very happy with the grill. However, Lowe's was a different story. I specifically ordered the item online, requesting assembly, so I could have a grill out of the box vs. one that's been sitting outside as a display. Unfortunately, this was not the case as they tried to give me one of the grills from outside when I arrived.
Disappointed. If Lowe's is going to offer assebly service, they should ensure the item is from a box and freshly assembled for the buyer.
reviews.author: LoriP

reviews.title: "WILL catch FIRE!"
reviews.text: Had the grill less than six months. I loved the initial concept of charcoal and gas. A few flaws right out the box but I could live with them. Handle stripped off day 1 and no I didnt overtighten, threads were garbage.  Had several hot spots but I learned to deal with it. Grilled several burgers and hosted a couple of parties at home.  You must clean the grease well out of the bottom because apparently it doesnt drain well. Set a few steaks on, closed the lid, went inside for two minutes and next thing I know it is its engulphed in flames! Fortunately I had an extinguisher or my house would've gone with it. Propane tank was so hot it was beyond touching. Please DO NOT BUY. Dangerous!
reviews.author: uscav88

reviews.title: "Awesome!"
reviews.text: This is a grill for those who love to BBQ. No hype, just quality and versatility. After researching grills for a month I decided on this grill. The quality is uncompromising, the design is simple, and everything works the way it should.I purchased the grill prebuilt and hauled it home, definitely a two person job as the grill is quite heavy.I ordered the side smoker box from Chargriller and installed it in 30 minutes. The overall length of the unit with the side smoker box is 6.5'.The grates are deep and wide, and can hold anything you can throw on them.I have owned many grills from stainless steel five burners to small charcoal hibachis but this is the one I will keep forever. Easy to work on and low maintenance.
reviews.author: Smokin'

reviews.title: "Chargriller gets too hot"
reviews.text: I bought the Chargriller on April 11, 2012 and did not have the chance to use it until recently. When I first used it, it burned the ribs. The thermostat was reading over 600 degrees on the lowest setting for only two burners. I could not believe it so I decided to turn off all the burners except for one and the thermostat read 400. Of course then I thought the thermostat was broken so I let it cool down completely and the thermostat was working.Thank you Lowes for printing my receipt because I had lost it. I contacted Chargriller and they told me I needed a new regulator. Now, I am waiting to hear back from them.
reviews.author: Chargriller

reviews.title: "Great Offset Smoker!"
reviews.text: Have had my Duo 5050 for a couple of years now and it has been awesome. I truly enjoy BBQ and Smoking especially with Charcoal. Plenty of room for Chicken and Ribs. I have had no rust. I do keep it in the garage. I have used the Gas side for a quick burger at lunch. So great for that. Have not went through one tank of gas yet and Fire up the Chimney starter on the Side Burner. So perfect for that. I added the Side Fire Box this last year. Has been good for the Long Smoke. Either that or the Charcoal Box Smoke so dang well. Have had no problem with paint either. Seasoned and oil it couple times a year. I am so happy with my DUO! Thank You Char Griller!!!
reviews.author: Crabby

reviews.title: "Good Smoker/grill"
reviews.text: I bought this unit 3 years ago w/ the additional side smoker (a must for the serious smoker) & had a lot of fun smoking! Lots of grilling room, & temp. holds pretty good. The burner was handy when I needed to stoke my charcoals. Hey, it is what it is, right. Not the heaviest gauge steel & not the best smoker/grill on the market, but for the price how can you beat it. My only complaint is that the tabs that hold the flavor saver in place on the grilling side (the piece that sits over the flame) rotted away rather fast. But I made due. Just bought a new one this winter & can't wait to smoke again. One more thing the heavy duty cover also weathers rather quickly. If you want to go buy a $1000.00 Weber or Viking, be must guest but I think I'll stick with my Chargrill.
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "Love the concept hate the craftsmanship"
reviews.text: I have had my grill for about 3 years. I love the idea of being able to grill with gas or charcoal depending on what mood I am in without needing 2 grills. Within the first year I started losing pieces like the smoke stack covers that were welded on and could not be reattached. 2nd although I kept the grill covered at all times of non use (I don't even want to talk about the quality of the grill covers they make) I still started seeing alot of rust show up on the body of the grill as well as the grates. The wheels are attached by plastic and with the weight of this grill that is not a good idea I lost a wheel within the first two months. The surface finish on the grates is not durable at all. I was very surprised at how quickly the finish was taken off through normal use and cleaning. They need to really work on the quality of their products.
reviews.author: jmaxxx2000

reviews.title: "Good Grill But..."
reviews.text: I have only owned this grill for a few weeks but my biggest complaint is with the cooking grates! The grates do not fit tight and when the grill heats the middle of the grill walls expand and the center grate will fall into the fire! I like to clean the grates when hot but almost impossible. However for $300 bucks it is a lot of grill.I purchased for our summer camp so it will not get a lot of use.
reviews.author: Scooter

reviews.title: "The BEST grill for the BEST tasting food!"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill at Lowes after spending most of the snowy winter figuring out what to buy. I found that most (if not all) online reviews praised the design, features and versatility but indicated failure in quality. I wrote this off as improper attention to seasoning of the grill and poor care.I bought it in March 2011 and have been using it HEAVILY year 'round ever since. I also invested in the side fire box (an absolute must have for quality smoking of larger meats or large quantity of food.I have ALWAYS been a year round griller (yes even in the occasional blizzards on Long Island# and have for over a decade grilled my Thanksgiving turkey. This past year was the best ever as I decided to SMOKE the turkeys #did two small ones to cut down on overall cooking time#. Never have we had such a fantastic thanksgiving dinner.Needless to say I LOVE THIS GRILL!!!!!So here is the truth about durability - IT IS TERRIBLE. After 2 summer seasons and one off season - the grill is now rotted to the point of no longer being usable. I did in fact follow ALL directons for seasoning the entire grill and all parts, I ALWAYS kept the cover on it in bad weather and even performed additional seasonings #oilings) as the surfaces began to weather. It seems that NO MATTER what you do with this grill it is going to rot away. HOWEVER that is ok with me. Since I was concerned at the negative comments given, I bought the LOWES extended protection plan. It is now September 2012 and I have just received a gift card to Lowes for the entire purchase price of my grill INCLUDING tax. I am going tonight to buy the EXACT SAME ONE AGAIN - and of course another protection plan. I have yet to find any other grill as capabale and well made as this for the price point. So what if I have to get a new one every two years. If it costs me $39.00 extra to do so, then that is fine with me.I absolutely recommend this grill to ANYONE who is considering it - but more importantly I would HIGHLY recommend getting the protection plan to go along with it. Great job char griller AND great job to Lowes Service Advantage!
reviews.author: bikerfd350

reviews.title: "Overall biggest bang for the buck"
reviews.text: First of all putting it together is a pretty tedious job much faster and easier with two people. Once put together it is very sturdy and with enough weight not afraid of it getting knock over. Love the option to use both or just one. The fact that there is a gas and charcoal side by side is great. Use Charcoal when we have plenty of time to cook and switch to the gas side when cooking time is limited. The Charcoal side is very simple but with plenty of real estate that you can even use it as a smoke if you pile the charcoal on one side and the meat on the other. The gas side is too simple I wish they would have designed the burner cover to go along the entire bottom of the cooking surface. The grease catcher is a nice feature especially how easy it is to remove the trap. Although that did not leave much room for the regular size propane tank, need to remove the grease trap in order to get the gas in or out of the bottom. The grill did come with hole with hooks to hang the utensils and the compartment in from of the charcoal grill is a great little feature.
reviews.author: Marcos

reviews.title: "Great Grill...Great Price!!!"
reviews.text: Purchased this grill a few weeks ago for $299...last week it went on sale for $199. I went to Lowe's and they credited me the $100. Every time I look at and use this grill I am blown away by how much grill you get for the money. I love having both gas and charcoal as options. Done various steaks and burgers so far and even a whole turkey on the charcoal side last weekend...worked great...was easily able to control the temp at 350-400 degrees. If you are looking for a grill that is well designed and has great options at a great price I would recommend this grill. As for the longevity of the product only time will tell but if it is seasoned properly and taken care of I don't see any reason why a person couldn't get many years of use out of it.I also purchased a chimney charcoal starter and love how one can use the side burner to start the coals. When I got the $100 back as mentioned earlier I ordered the fire box add-on and am very excited to give smoking a whirl once that comes in.
reviews.author: GrillMaster2B

reviews.text: I have purchased two of these grills. The first one rusted out within 6 months, and Lowe's replaced it b/c I purchased the extended warranty...the replacement grill rusted within 8 months, but I had not gotten the extended warranty the second time so I was out of luck. The quality of this grill is AWFUL for the original price I paid ($399).
reviews.author: WinkCrew

reviews.title: "Grillin' Time!"
reviews.text: So far so good!! Haven't had any problems with this grill since I got it. Haven't used the propane side yet except for lighting my charcoal. Loving this grill so far. No problems with the cover. Grills food exceptionally well as far as i'm concerned! Would definately recommend buying this grill for the price and amount of grilling space.
reviews.author: GrillinTime

reviews.title: "great grill for price"
reviews.text: got this awesome grill on sale for $200, what a deal. I bought the smoker immediately. I use the smoker most of the time,but it sure is handy to have the propane available to quickly cook something. I was a little leary about this grill because of some of the reviews about rusting,but after a year all is fine. Every time i clean the grill i spray it with cooking spray to help prevent rust. it seems to be working. very versatile grill
reviews.author: brink

reviews.title: "duo 5050"
reviews.text: I have had this grill 2 years,originally great till winter came and rusted the flame shields and the burners.i DID cover this grill and tried to get replacement parts only to discover that the holders were tic welded on...no way to replace them if there is nothing to hold them on....they were rotted.called the helpline and was told to buy a new grill body. tried to order ....no longer making this model.a waste of 300 $....the smoker is great...300 $ smoker......never again buy welded parts.the material is cheap.you will see....let me know if you have a better one.
reviews.author: munewk

reviews.title: "Just can't go wrong"
reviews.text:
I purchased my Duo 5050 grill 3 years ago and just purchased a second one a week ago. If it's just the 3 of us home we can fire up the burners and cook out quickly and easily. When company comes over or if we have more time, I can fire up the charcoal side and double my cooking space! The side burner can be used to heat up pots fast or to light your charcoal in a,stack can so you don't need all that lighter fluid.
 The protection plan from lowes is excellent for this product and for only $39.00 you have 3 years that if something does rust or wear out they will replace the parts with no hassles! Love mine and look forward to another long grilling season! ¥
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Best grill ever."
reviews.text: I love this grill. Seriously. Love it. I have both types of grills available to me any day- and I particularly like to grill with charcoal but also like the convenience of a gas grill when time is of essence. As an added bonus, I've found myself speeding things up by heating up my charcoal on the burner and then using the charcoal side of the grill.Make sure you get the special cover for this grill. I recommend getting the added smoker attachment as well. If you get a grill like this, you owe it to yourself to get the accessories that work with it.There are a few design things that I think could make this grill even better.....I find myself just leaving utensils on the gas grill grates as I don't really like how it hangs the handles, but that's just being nit-picky.
reviews.author: ThomasMc

reviews.title: "Grilling way more than ever"
reviews.text: I love this grill! Cooking on charcoal a lot now and love that I can fire up the gas side to get things done quick or if there is a large group.
reviews.author: califf22

reviews.title: "BEST BUY"
reviews.text: This grill gets hot and is hot! Cooks up a storm.Use the advice from others and buy the custom cover and oil it down after or before every use. I plugged the vent holes with foil and it cooks ever better! Anyone know what the burners cost?BTW, paid 199 minus 10% onsale at lowes.
reviews.author: etpetp

reviews.title: "Get what you pay for?"
reviews.text: I'm sitting here, with my grill 'still in the box', and reading all the complaints about rust and whatnot with this grill. I'm wondering, how many of you complaining about the rust picked up an already assembled, displayed outside the doors of Lowes for who knows how long, grill and how many assembled their grill themselves. Also, since there is a lot of cast iron (notorious for rust), how many of those complaining know how to take care of their grill. Bottom line is, if you leave this grill outside, covered or not, then this grill is going to rust. This is simple, elementary science. For one thing, most covers are made of plastic. Plastic is prone to condensation and also will trap moisture in the air beneath the cover. If you want this grill to last, store it when not in use, keep it out of the weather. Also, if you read about cast iron cookware, or better yet, just ask your granny, cast iron has to be seasoned, and kept dry, or it will rust. This is not a new technology, this is the type of cookware our founding fathers used, but teflon has made cast iron cookware a mystery. Inform yourself before you blast the company that made it; after all, they only sell the product, it's not their job to take care of your product.
reviews.author: Jabo

reviews.title: "This thing will do everything except make coffee"
reviews.text: This grill is sturdy, made of cast iron and the heat on the gas side is tremendous. I was able to heat over 900 degrees during burn-in.The charcoal side is great. It holds it's heat very well. I added the firebox side add-on and that worked great as well. You have to maintain your fire in order to keep the heat up..Wood seems to provide the best heat source.The temperature gauges are not very accurate, so you will need to provide your own gauge source. One you have the temp right, it will be easier and easier as time goes by.This thing will do everything except make coffee...I Love it.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Duo Black Combo Grill"
reviews.text: Bought this grill 4 years ago with a cover. After Lowe's delivered the third grill within a week, I finally had a grill that worked...HOWEVER...I should have sent it back after the second grill was delivered and purchased something else. Even though I keep this grill covered at all times, the grill rusts badly almost immediately including the inside of the grill and the burners are just about gone. I am EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED! I would NEVER recommend this grill to anyone! Saddened as I really thought this would be a good product from CharGriller...
reviews.author: Patti

reviews.title: "Not too bad..."
reviews.text: Bought this grill about 3 1/2 years ago. Assembly took quite some time, but once it was together it worked OK (grill grates moved around and would fall into the grill if cleaned with a brush). I wanted to replace my charcoal Weber grill with this, but found the charcoal side had too many gaps in it and the air flow/temperature was hard to control. Kept the Weber and rarely used the charcoal side. Three years later I'm now going to replace it since the main gas burners are "rotted" and the grill grates are rusted to the point they flake and leave metal in your food. The side burner is great for a "charcoal chimney" and that still works well. I didn't expect the grill to last past 5 years since that has been my experience with gas grills, but I feel this one fell apart a little too early. Great idea, so-so execution and quality.
reviews.author: Joel

reviews.title: "save your money"
reviews.text: I got this last year, cause it was duo use. my family grills minim of 5 days a week year round. the gas side dose not maintain heat. It burns at 400 on low. makes grilling harder. and the heat shield only lasted 5 months before i needed to replace them. the smoker side/ charcoal side works fine no complaints on that. save your money and don't buy a duo grill.
reviews.author: Killer-Catfish

reviews.title: "Junk..."
reviews.text: Purchased this grill less than 2 years ago. Ignitor went out after 2 months, The cooking surface deos not heat very evenly, lots of hot spots. Less then 2 years, all 3 heat plates have burnt up. Replace them? Char Griiller doesn't even sell them, need to buy third party @ $25 each. I would not recommend this grill to anyone.
reviews.author: Chardy

reviews.title: "Dual grill"
reviews.text: Great product. Recommend painting the interior with high heat paint as it isn't treated. It will rust if not.
reviews.author: 1Bluedevil

reviews.title: "Great for 2 Years"
reviews.text: If you are looking for a good/expensive option for a very short period of time, this grill was great for 2 years @ $150/year and then, this year, the back lip that holds the grates on the gas side rotted off and it is now unusable. I guess I'll be going charcoal for July 4th.
reviews.author: Paul

reviews.title: "Not for pros"
reviews.text: I bought this one last year, used it all summer for smoking meats and the typical gas grilling, it was great. Just pulled it out from winter storage, had it well covered from the snow, ( I take good care of anything I own). It's now rusted and parts will have to be replaced. This grill is probably good for only 3 seasons of use. Like everything in America it's another disposable product, worth the $200 their asking for and not the $300 I paid for last year. Good beginner grill though for anyone wanting to learn and then move on to more professional equipment if you're serious about your grilling/smoking.
reviews.author: Lou

reviews.title: "YES!!!"
reviews.text: Finally they make what I was looking for - a gas grill and a charcoal grill in one unit! And lucky me, it was on sale and Lowes offered free delivery on the weekend I bought it. Purchasing the cover is a must as it is specifically made for the grill's smoke stacks. I also purchased the Side Fire Box which can be used as a small grill or a smoker. The Rotisserie Kit is an another optional item I bought. It holds 25# worth of meat and works either via electricity or batteries.
reviews.author: Grillin' Gertie

reviews.title: "Chargriller Duo w/offset firebox"
reviews.text: I've had my Chargriller Duo with the firebox for 5 or 6 years now. I still love it. I use the prpane side almost every weekend and on average once a month I use the offset firebox to smoke pork shoulders of brisket.  The unit performs very predictably and I always get positive compliments on the results. Naturally over the years there's been some wear and tear on some of the conponents,but the I have been able to easily replace the parts through the website. I am defiantly a big fan of this product and the company overall.
reviews.author: Jmoyers

reviews.title: "Great BBQ!"
reviews.text: Just purchased one of these bad boys! Assembly took a few hours, but the quality and sturdiness are evident. Used the charcoal grill first. Slow cooked a beef roast and it was excellent. Liked the fact you can adjust the level of the coals. Used the side burner and chimney to start the coals. I may purchase the Texas style smoker next.
reviews.author: BBQmaster

reviews.title: "Good Grill"
reviews.text: Bought it because I like the barrel design, and I like charcoal and my wife will only use gas. Must abide by the manual for the oil treatment. Will rust as many cheaply made grills normally do. I just bought my second Duo grill yesterday. I bought my first one in July 2009. I cooked on it once a week on average. A friend of mine liked it so much, I gave it to him and bought another. I got the charcoal side done, tossed some coal in it and while waiting for the coals, I finished the gas side. I also got the smoke box for it this time, but have yet to break that out of the box. I can see that it will be very hard to maneuver with the smoke box attached as it needs to be moved for me to be able to use it. You can get this grill cheaper at other places.
reviews.author: T.J.

reviews.title: "horrible paint"
reviews.text: got the grill last year loved it then this year i bring it out and rust. any spot you miss cleaning before you put this away is gonna rust. the way they box it isnt the greatest either i had to paint atleast 5 spots that had missed or been slid on the ground while in the box(box had small holes in the bottom). other then the paint they used its a nice functioning grill. i would suggest spending a lil more and getting a grill thats stainless steel. unless you dont mind rust or are a ocd cleaning freak.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Great Grill For Price"
reviews.text: It took quite a while to assemble, lots of parts, but I followed the instructions and it went together easily. The only problem I,ve had is the circular hole where the gas canister is suppose to sit was just a little to small, however, a couple minuyes with a drill and grinding wheel solved that problem and this could have been a fault in the canister not the grill. Both the gas and charcoal sides cook food very well. Very happy with this purchase.
reviews.author: USAFRet

reviews.title: "Worth half the price"
reviews.text: Rusted out within 18 months despite being under a cover and well maintained. The enamel on the grates came apart and burners stopped not long after. Despite my purchase of the extended warranty, Lowe's had no interest in fixing it. I replaced the burners and grates, nursed another year or of it and replaced with a Weber.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "I love this grill!"
reviews.text: I have been using this grill for around 2 months now, since I found it on a great deal at Lowe's. I was looking for something that could handle both charcoal and gas, and I found exactly that in this grill. I have been extremely satisfied using the side burner for starting the charcoal. The adjustable charcoal grates work wonderfully. I am also really happy with how heavy duty the whole thing is. I am now ready for the summer grilling season! The only drawback I see is the overall size and weight.
reviews.author: DennisT

reviews.title: "Dual use"
reviews.text: This grill offers the same cooking space as a regular grill, with 3 propane burners on the gas side. The charcoal side has an additional plate built into it to protect the outer shell from hot coals. The propane side is good for a quick grill taste with no prep time needed, and on the weekends when you have time to prepare the charcoal you get meat that has that great taste of mesquite coals or whatever your type of grilling style is. The side burner offers the flexibility of cooking a quick dish outside when you don't want you whole house smelling like the dish. Easy to move around with the wheels, a bit heavy but that's why they put a heavy duty handle on it!
reviews.author: Buzz

reviews.title: "poor quality"
reviews.text: I have owned the grill for three years and have had multiple issues over the years. the first year the gas side would surge, which required the regulator to be changed. the second year the knobs broke which required all the knobs replaced and one of the lines. the third year the gas grill rotted out requiring it to be thrown away. I was really surprised how fast it rotted, because they had a great design
reviews.author: fl29cracker

reviews.title: "Terrible Experience!"
reviews.text: Brought it home and it was damaged in the box. Had to unpack the whole thing to see that there were damaged parts. So I got a mallet and block of wood and straightened out the firebox and lid best I could. Then, more parts were broken and missing. Then, one of the igniters would not work! Then, Char-Griller was impossible to deal with trying to get it warrantied. Nothing but endless emails. So I put it up on my trailer and brought it back for a refund! Lesson learned: never take an item like this home in a box. Buy an assembled one so you can see what your getting.
reviews.author: tx77318

reviews.title: "I've had for 3 years and still looks/works great!"
reviews.text: Okay, so I bought this grill 3 years ago. I love the fact I can smoke or use the gas side. I've had a few big parties that called for both at once but that is not common for me. It has held up well and has sat in full sun/rain/snow without rust or anything for 3yrs. you can adjust the height of coals and/or airflow. Lots of space on the grill. can be a pain to clean compared to cast iron but not hard or a big deal. It just takes a small tool and must be cleaned one bar at a time instead of getting rough with it like on a cast iron grill. I would give it 4.5 stars if I could because I have 2 issues with it. that being said, I would buy it again today for the price!!! It is well made. Don't get me wrong, it is not one of the super thick smokers but it is nice and does everything I could wish for out of it. I use it 1-3 times per week most spring/summer/fall and about every 2-3 week in the winter.1st - the starter went out after 1 year but a new one can be ordered for just $10. I just use a match but that is me. I don't use the gas side much as I like a smoke flavor over gas.2nd - I wish it had a smoker box. So bad that I'm thinking about getting the firebox they sell at lowes that I'm told will mount to it (same brand). Nevertheless, the coals/wood chips can be lowered on one side to the point it doesn't give any direct heat and will smoke a brisket or ribs for hours!!!
reviews.author: Mee55555

reviews.title: "Best of both worlds"
reviews.text: I was very much a "webber man" but I really wanted the ability to do both gas and charcoal. This grill fit the bill nicely. It is not sexy, good looking or otherwise appropriate for those interested in the aesthetics of their patio. However, it is tremendously functional. On the gas side, it gets up over 500 degrees in 4 or so minutes. 700 in less than 10, which was a huge leap from my previous grill. The 3 burner density is nicer than other grills. It gives excellent temperature control. The total is grill size is a bit smaller than some other gas grills, meaning you could only do 9 burgers at once. This is not a problem as I do not have 9 people in my life I would cook for.On the charcoal side, the ability to raise an lower to charcoal is surprisingly handy. I have not installed the firebox, but I plan to so I can do some proper smoking.Side burner worked great. A new feature for me that I thought was gimmick until I started to use it regularly.The cons are: It is surprisingly hard to clean the grates and the valve for the propane tank is awfully close to the drip pan, where you could easily burn your hand.
reviews.author: Craig87

reviews.title: "Rotted out after 5 years"
reviews.text:
The gas side of the grill is rotted out after 5 years. The burner mounts on the back of the grill have rusted through the metal. The heat deflector shields above the flame rotted away after a couple of years. The burner for the side burner has rusted through. For the price of the grill I would expect the steel and paint to last longer than 5 years.

Grill is great in theory, love the choice of gas or charcoal, depends on my schedule. I bought the fire box for the side of the charcoal end for smoking. Worked as a good smoker after I made some modifications to the smoke stack and added baffles.
reviews.author: btizzy

reviews.title: "RUST GO IT"
reviews.text: I wanted a charcoal grill and my wife wanted a gas grill. This was the perfect solution for us. We even bought the cover though it only lasted about a year due to the sun. This grill began to show signs of rust after the first year and by year 3 was useless. The lips that hold the grills rusted through and and the center grill fell. When I attempted a temporary fix is when I realized the entire back side on the gas half was rusted through so bad it was beyond any fixing.I was so disappointed that we tried to take care of this grill and it rusted out like it did. $350.00 (including the cover) and all we got was 3 years.
reviews.author: rtyndallnc

reviews.title: "great grill!"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for only $199 since Lowes had a sale for $100 off and free shipping. I also used a 10% off coupon from a change of address packet from the post office. Paid only $196 out the door with free shipping! This grill is well designed. I love that I can do three types of grilling. Gas, charcoal, and smoking. I bought the attachment for the smoker which doubles as a travel grill. Fantastic!
reviews.author: triune

reviews.title: "Versatile and fun"
reviews.text: The dual fuel design is very helpful. The sideburner is multifunctional and sized to use a charcoal chimney. The gas side gets hot very quickly. The charcoal side keeps a temperature well. I've only had it a couple of weeks but so far so good. I have some concerns about the durability. I did purchase the cover in hopes of extending the product's life.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Not a bad deal!"
reviews.text: Overall this grill has been very satisfactory. I read the reviews both pros and cons before purchasing and can understand their points. All things considered and for the amount of money spent.....it is still a great value. My husband does most of the daily cooking and uses the grill for dinners most of the time and year round. He is still getting used to cooking on this grill but loves the set-up so far. I didn't purchase the smoker box because we don't generally eat our meat that way but my husband would be very interested in giving it a try once he has totally adjusted to using the other sections. This grill does cook differently (hotter) than the standard style gas/charcoal grills out there. All grills truly used regularly do wear out, no matter how much money you spend on them. The trick is to care for them with regular use to extend their life. When it comes time to replace it again when all worn out a few years later......you didn't break the bank buying it in the first place!!! Very happy with the grill so far.
reviews.author: debbeez

reviews.title: "Not Recommended"
reviews.text: I had this grill maybe 2 years. I had the cover also so it was not in weather.It rusted and as you see part of the back side just disintegrated, because I can tell you I certainly do not grill everyday. Not worth the money, best of both worlds but not a good grill.
reviews.author: Vickie

reviews.title: "Great Grill, but..."
reviews.text: I am an avid, year-round griller, and love the features of this grill. The convenience of gas plus the availability of charcoal in the same unit is what makes this unit one of the best. This is my third CharGiller product - quality is good but durability is suspect - I've had this one for about a year and it is starting to rust out. I treat my grills very well - I've had a mini Weber kettle for about 10 years and it is still going strong. The previous two CharGrillers seem to last about two to three years before falling apart. Great buy for the "grill sergeant" who loves to grill, just be ready to replace it after two to three years. Buy the Lowe's protection plan!
reviews.author: Mick

reviews.title: "Problems after one year"
reviews.text: Customer service is very poor for this product. You never get to speak to an actual person when you call. I have had problems with gas side not working for about 5 months now, and I've only had grill for a little over one year. By the time you get to speak with someone in customer service, you are informed that your warranty has now expired. The gas side no longer lights. The grill is rusting because the grill cover that is supposed to be used with this grill is of very poor quality and rips and discolors annually.
reviews.author: Kesha

reviews.title: "Duo 5050"
reviews.text: I have had my grill for over 3 years and it finally just started to breakdown on the inside. The flame covers rusted away but the grill cooks amazingly. The best 2 foods i have found to cook on here is steak and chicken. Always leaves both meats very juicy and tender. I always sprayed my grill down before and after each use with pam or similar product to assure that the grates stay clean. I also bought the fire box for the charcol side to use for smoking. It works fairly well and produced on of the best briskets ive ever eaten. I did purchase the 5 year extended warranty for it and for $50 more i really paid for itself when i called to order replacement parts for it and they in return just mailed me a gift card for full purchase price plus tax. They told me it was hard for them to get the replacement parts and that this would be easier. I agreed and will probably got back with just the propane grill instead of the duo just for space and efficientcy.
reviews.author: Mullet

reviews.title: "So far so good..."
reviews.text: We have only had this grill a few weeks but have been using it almost daily. Before cooking on it I seasoned the whole grill twice, including the smoker box. Our local Lowes messed up the assembly but they made good on it and we picked it up the next day. I have done ribs ,chicken, steak kabobs burgers ,turkey breast all smoked on the charcoal side, everthing came out awesome! I really like how easy it is to clean out the ashes and get the grill ready for the next use. I read a lot of reviews on rusting. I believe seasoning the grill and keeping it clean on not leaving loads of ash in it the grill will last. I loosely cover it to keep direct rain off. I am kind of new to smoking meats but we are having fun with this grill and so far we are happy with it..
reviews.author: Dannh

reviews.title: "Rust, Rust, Rust"
reviews.text: After 1 year of use and always covered with the grill cover, every single grate has rust on it and the heat shield has chunks of it falling off due to rust. Even the charcoal side which has never been used is rusted.
reviews.author: GrillingGal

reviews.title: "great grill BUT"
reviews.text: First of all let me say how much I loved this grill, but what I really liked was the customer service-ALL AMERICAN AND IN GEORGIA.  However my caveat is that the design of the brackets for the heat tent are terrible. they rust badly and are almost impossible to remove the old ones.  I must confess that I live in Florida near the Ocean so I would not recommend to anyone who lives near the coast.  If you don't live in high humidity then by this grill you will love it.  As far as those bracket replace them often before it too late
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Biggest piece of junk"
reviews.text: This is the biggest piece of junk I have ever purchased. Within 2 years this grill has rusted to pieces, to the point it's not even worth buying replacement parts for. This is the first grill I ever bought a cover for and it wasn't worth wasting the money on. I have owned 2 Webers over the years and both lasted me over 10 yrs ea. and they were never covered or brought in during the winters. I have tried contacting this company twice in regards to this matter and have not heard a word from them. So obviously they don't care about customer service either. Would not recommend this to anybody unless you just like throwing money away. The concept of having a gas and charcoal grill was a nice idea, its just to bad that the product itself is a total piece of junk.
reviews.author: dyooper

reviews.title: "RUST!!!"
reviews.text: This grill will rust out within 36 months and you will be sad. Replacement parts are, apparently, not available. (The Char Griller website is, essentially, non-existent.) If you still think you want one, you can have this one for free in St Louis, MO. Bring a broom and dust pan.
reviews.author: Tim--the--Enchanter

reviews.title: "Not for serious smoking"
reviews.text: I bought this grill and the side fire box earlier this month, and while it is serviceable for your basic "throw on some burgers" type grilling, I do not recommend it for smoking.  This thing leaks smoke like a sieve, which in itself is not a huge problem, but it also leaks heat.  The key to a good smoke is temperature control, and this grill just doesn't have it.  With gaps between the lid and body as large as 1.5", heat leaks out.  Which leads to needing much more fuel as well.  I spent about $100 sealing up the gaps, and got a marginal improvement at best.  There are other issues, such as rust after less than a month (on a covered porch AND with the cloth cover), positioning of the chimney, lack of a baffle plate, wooden handles, wheel size, etc... but what really kills it for me is the complete lack of control.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Aweful"
reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but this is without a doubt one of the worst purchases I have ever made. The gap under the grill is so large that if I have a breezy day it blows the grill out. I live in the desert. It's often windy here. Impossible to use unless it's a calm day. I miss my Weber. I don't have time to type the rest of my complaints out but after over a year with it I HATE THIS GRILL....and I'm not that hard to please. I'm giving this grill away....yes it's that bad
reviews.author: hate this grill

reviews.title: "Best value ever"
reviews.text: For the price you get the best of both world's. If you like to cook with gas or brickets this one will do it all. You can even use the smoker at the same time. You will not need any other BBQer. I love it
reviews.author: armyofone42

reviews.title: "Please Read"
reviews.text: This was the one and only Char-Griller we will ever buy. I bought it last year for a Father's Day gift to my husband and this year, the day before Father's Day, it almost caused an explosion. The gas line on it must have been bad (bought that way cause it was barely used) and we've only used the grill maybe 10 times over the past year. The line caught fire and now our grill is ruined as well as our weekend. It scared us to know that something like this could happen. I'm glad no one got hurt from this defective product of a grill. Please if you're going to buy a grill, buy a better brand. If you do buy this grill, cause you don't care about my review, always check the line before each use to make sure it's not going to cause a fire and possibly an explosion. We are probably going back to just a charcoal only grill and not this brand. I tried adding photos of the burnt mess, but the site is not letting me. Go figure.
reviews.author: Geek

reviews.title: "1st year was great"
reviews.text: The 1st year this was the best grill ever. 2nd year had to paint the casting and inside was deteriorating. 3rd year the gas hose caught fire. It is too close to casting I was lucky enough to shut off tank before it exploded. Customer service said hose was out of warranty and would not send new one. Bought a better hose at ACE. The flavor bars and bottom of casting rusted through before end of summer. They have changed the design of the hose since.
reviews.author: proGriller

reviews.title: "Garbage"
reviews.text: I had this grill a little over 1 year and I bought the cover for it that is from the same company and the grill is so badly rusted that the griddle will not stay intact... totally pathetic
reviews.author: Concerned

reviews.title: "Just What I Wanted"
reviews.text: If you love the taste of charcoal but sometimes don't have the time, this is the grill for you. This is not a $1,000 grill but it is good quality for the price. I bought mine at Lowes and paid for delivery (about $380 total). I was surprised Lowes assembled it before delivery without me asking or paying extra. It's been an excellent performer the 4 times I've used it . It's kind of large but saves space if you were running separate gas and charcoal grills.
reviews.author: eye1care

reviews.title: "dont do the free assembly"
reviews.text: iv been looking at this grill for a while before buying .. i got one that was assembled at the store already the top covers were back wards the bolts were loose and iv been having trouble with the propane regulator the whole time iv owned the grill which is about three years ..dont attempt to move this thing from house to house it loosens up rather quickly . i say this because my friends that own the same grill have similar problems .  who ever bought it assmebled the have propane issues .. and loose bolts straight from the store first day for the price its a good grill
reviews.author: alex

reviews.title: "Best Value in a Dual Purpose Grill!"
reviews.text: What a great grill. I own one and bought one for another family member. We all love the grill. Temperature control is very good, and it cooks slow, medium, or fast--all easily adjustable. This sucker is heavy, well engineered, and made to last. You simply cannot beat it for the money!
reviews.author: CCO57

reviews.title: "Great Concept and works well"
reviews.text: We purchased this grill 2 years ago, my husband is meticulous about cleaning it and keeping it covered but the poor quality of the materials have made it so I already need to replace the grill. The tabs that hold the grates in place have rusted on both the propane and charcoal side, the covers that cover the flames and help give you an even cook fell apart after 6 months. Not to mention that even with the cover the entire outside has rusted and needed to be sanded and painted every year since purchase.Granted we use the grill a lot both summer and winter and I loved to cook on it but I would and will never purchase another grill from this company, I would prefer to spend a little more for a better quality product.
reviews.author: Barb

reviews.title: "Why so many complaints?"
reviews.text: I've had this for a month and used it many times smoking (bought the side box for it too) and BBQ'ing. Easy cleanup.I read all reviews before diving in on this purchase. This is a pretty solid BBQ.Everybody is talking about rust. I live IN THE RAIN 80% of the time. I waterproofed the cover and also keep the exterior greased in with bacon grease. Not one rust spot thus far.The grates are cast iron (which I have always preferred) and they need to be seasoned just like a cast iron frying pan and they need to be cleansed and then put a light coat of oil or bacon grease on them after use. It's virtually non stick if seasoned properly.I also read about folks having temperature control issues when smoking. So did I the first time through. The key is to use less coals and to control your dampers. I can easily maintain a 150 degree temp or hotter if I need it without a problem. This is one of the better grills IMHO.
reviews.author: edbo11

reviews.title: "Very Nice Flexible Grill"
reviews.text: I've had this grill for about 2 years now and really have enjoyed it. I like the flexibility of Charcoal when I have time, Gas when I don't have the time and both when I have a big crew over for a summer party.My only two complaints/ considerations that I will offer up for you to consider:1. With the placement of the gas tank directly under the grill, it's a little bit of a tight fit to reach under and turn off the gas. I'm of the school of turn off the gas from the tank before the knobs so it it's hot down there and just have to be careful not to burn your skin. I'd say I have average size hands so a guy with big hands may get a little frustrated.2. While I like the upper racks for general use, it has taken away my ability to make Beer Can Chicken as the placement of the rack comes across the top and won't let me close the lid without tipping it over.Other observations that I originally had concerns about based on reviews I saw when I purchased this grill:1. Rust: Is there a little interior rust in the grill? Yes, Do I season the grill as I'm supposed to? No. I'd suspect that if I was more diligent, I'd have less, but with what I do have, it's very minimal and doesn't impact performance. (Those that compare to a higher end grill at twice the price.. my mindset is that the life of 2 of these grills would be right about the same of 1 higher end grill)2. Grill Cover: My experience is that it is durable, but fades/discolors fast. It's still durable, no cuts or tears.. just discolored. It's withstood 1 Chicago winter and I have no concerns of it making it through this winter. I absolutely would recommend getting the cover and using it, but when it discolors later, remember it's about protecting your grill not the looks of the cover.I wasn't planning on grilling tonight, but now that I'm thinking about the grill, it might be time for a change in plans.
reviews.author: Dan-S

reviews.title: "It's what I've been waiting for in a BBQ"
reviews.text: I bought this BBQ In the beginning of the summer,I do all my meat on the charcoal side while I'm cooking the vegetables on the propane side…perfect if you like to entertain.I'm going to get the smoker box this winter…the only problem is the cover for it didn't last the summer with the uv,it got really thin and ripped.other than that I couldn't have made a better purchase
reviews.author: K-man

reviews.title: "Rust, Rust, Rust, Rust"
reviews.text: I bought this grill with high hopes (but not enough knowledge.) It had exactly what I needed, gas for convenience and charcoal/smoke for cooking low and slow. For the first 6 months I loved it! I smoked brisket, ribs, pork shoulder and other BBQ treats (I am a Texan, so I have a legacy to uphold) every other weekend and had good success. I bought the manufacturers custom cover. Sadly, within the first year the outside was covered with rust, even with regular use of the cover. Within 18 months the metal ledge inside the gas side of the grill that hold the grates up had rusted though, making the grill unusable. I called Chargriller and found that they warranty the charcoal side of the grill body for 5 years, but the gas only 1. Both sides are made of the same material. Obviously they were aware that the materials used on the gas side were not up to snuff.I have spoken with their service department and they are nice, friendly and ultimately of no help. After they pointed out I had no warranty i said "So, I guess I am out of luck." The rep said "well, that doesnt sound very good." I said "But it does describe my situation, right?" She couldnt help but agree.Sometimes a great seeming product at a great seeming price is just too good to be true.
reviews.author: jgiddens

reviews.title: "excellent for backyard part-time "pitmasters""
reviews.text: Hefty price at first but I feel I got what I paid for and Lowe's honors us vets with a military discount that was a blessing! I purchased locally about 4 years ago and later added the firebox to the side. Since the purchase I have had to replace the gas side burner covers with stainless steel adjustable covers also purchased from Lowes. I am on my second grill cover but I keep my grill/smoker on an exposed deck. The plastic knobs are my only real complaint and wish the manufacturer would use better hardware regarding this. I use this beast year round and my side of our neighborhood love the smell of this thing and even bring different hardwood over for me to use! I have read some of the complaints and would advise to take an average of the overall reviews before making a decision. I grill at minimum of 3 times a week and usually wood smoke on the weekends. I must mention that the manufacturer cautions on the heat of your fire be it charcoal or wood. if the temp exceeds 500 degrees for long periods, #bon fire#, the paint will peel after the grill cools, especially the fire box addition. Besides, smoking meat is low n slow....low temps for longer periods of time right? Keep the charcoal side and firebox, if added, oiled each time the grill is used to maintain season of grill. I love the ability to fire up the gas side during the busy week but really enjoy the feature of using the side box the cook over hardwood! some complaints exist about the sppeed this thing uses charcoal but I use kingsford just to get my wood started and use primarily wood to cook on. On occassion i have used only charcoal but the size of the grill and it not being 'air tight' allows alot of air to burn up the charcoal quickly compared to professional smokers. The side burner is excellent to get the charcoal starter fired up in a hurry and I can then dump the hot coals right into the firebox to flame up the wood. We have smoked and roasted pork, chicken, beef, salmon, seafood, and venison all perfectly! I will caution to keep some spray oil, like Pam, handy to keep all exposed parts sprayed and wiped down religiously. Keep ashes dumped as soon as they cool, and dump the drip pans. These simple steps will aid in keeping your investment in good working condition. in the past 10 years here in TN I have replaced some nice gas grills, the last one a stainless 4 burner. This gas/wood/smoker is by far my favorite and most reliable grill. If you need something better I would advise building your own. good luck with that!
reviews.author: Linedog

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Best Customer Service Ever"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill on Lowes.Com and had to assemble which was easy enough and that's good because no part came pre-assembled. At the very last step I found that the charcoal grill bottom attach point to hang the charcoal tray was missing. Char-Grill quickly fedexed a new bottom. It'll be a minor nuisance to unbolt and replace the grill bottom but the customer service at Char Grill was fantastic.
reviews.author: NA

reviews.title: "Last grill I plan to own"
reviews.text: I was looking for a duel (wood & gas) grill for several years and thought I was going to have one custom built. Then I saw it. It was exactly what I was looking for and the price seemed impossible. I resisted the temptation to buy it on the spot and instead went home and checked out the reviews online. Everything I read confirmed what I hoped and back to the store I went to get it. My only advice is to bring a couple extra folks because this baby weighs a lot! Once home it was a fun project for my daughter and I to assemble - I was very impressed with the quality of materials and the easy that it went together.A year later, I still am still in love with this grill - my wife got me the cover for Christmas so it was protected from the elements over the winter and still looks and works great!Buy it - you'll never need to get another grill.
reviews.author: Rob

reviews.title: "Love it!!!!"
reviews.text: This is an awesome grill, you have the best of grilling (gas/charcoal) its built like a tank and from good quality materials. I got the rotiserie motor system from chargriller's website and its great for roasting chicken and pork..... fully recomended A+++++
reviews.author: GYSGTUSMC

reviews.title: "My husband loves his gift!"
reviews.text: My husband has been waiting to get this BBQ for over a year now, and we're so glad we did. It's awesome that it has a charcol grill on one side and propane on the other. I personally love the flavor of charcol better, but having the ease of propane is great as well. I would recommend this BBQ to everyone! The only recommendation I have is if you're planning on picking it up, make sure you bring some really strong men. This thing weighs a ton!
reviews.author: Jess0915

reviews.title: "Great idea - poor construction materials"
reviews.text: Let me say first off how much I loved this grill and wanted it to be the "holy grail" of grills. The combination of gas and charcoal, especially with the firebox on the side provides the greatest versatility in a single grill that I have yet seen. I could go on and on about the fantastic meals I have prepared for family and friends but that will just make me hungry,The biggest problem with this grill are the cheap grade of materials it is constructed with. On the one hand it is what makes the price tag so affordable, but on the other you will be shelling out that same amount every 3 years to replace this thing as it falls apart from rust. It doesn't really matter if you cover this thing or not - it will rust and it will break. Honestly, I would rather pay 2-3 times the amount and have this thing last 10 years.I suppose you could keep your eyes peeled for when this goes on sale at Lowe's (it drops by $100.00 once a year sometime in the spring) but I really don't see that as a good long term option. Pity, as I loved this grill for the first couple of years.Reviews that say High Quality and Durable are not accurate - those folks just haven't owned this grill long enough.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Rust Bucket"
reviews.text: Don't wast your money. I had it for 21/2 years and it rusted completely out. The bottom of the Gas side rusted all the way though the top even after I sanded it after the first year and repainted it keep rusting. After 2/12 years it went to the dump.
reviews.author: Backrode

reviews.title: "TO CHEAP TO BE TRUE"
reviews.text: My wife bought this for me Father's Day 2013. The first thing I had problems with was regulating the heat on the gas grill. Then the grate on the gas side started to bend in the middle when I put a ten pond brisket on it. The charcoal side works fine. I would not recommend this grill to anyone. The price was to good to be true. I will pay extra next time and get a grill of better quality.
reviews.author: MyBad

reviews.title: "Great grill"
reviews.text: We got this grill a couple months ago, so I can only comment on my experience up to this point. I am extremely pleased with the grill for the price. I assembled it myself in about 3 hours (it was actually a lot easier to assemble than other grills I have owned). We didn't run into any problems with the assembly. The assembled unit feels very solid. As others have said, the wheels must have been upgraded recently because they are a very sturdy rubber. I love cooking on the grill. I have not had any problems with the gas side being too hot as others have. I'll generally sear my steaks on a high setting with the lid up, and then drop the burners down to low and close the lid. We don't have any problem keeping the temp around 375. The charcoal side (as others have said) is amazing. We don't have the smoker box, and probably will not add one since we can smoke in the charcoal side as it is now (coals/wood on one side/ water pan on the other). For the average person, that leaves enough room to smoke up plenty of meat for a party.I can't comment on the rust issues others have since we've only had the grill about a couple months. What I can say is that every grill will have rust issues eventually, and those issues will be a lot worse a lot faster if you don't take care of your grill. After assembly, I seasoned both sides of the grill by coating all the inside surfaces with vegetable oil spray and heating both units up to about 400 degress for a few hours. I also rubbed vegetable oil on the outside of the grill chambers while it was heating up. Be sure to put a large piece of cardboard under the grill when you do this if you want to protect your floor from the oil that will drip off. With either side, you need to keep the inside of the grill relatively clean and free of build up. The gas side is very easy to clean up after use. The grates and burner shields come right out without any screws or anything. Scrape those off and wash the shields if needed in your kitchen sink. There is plenty of room to clean the bottom around the burners, also. This doesn't need to be done every time, but I don't think a lot of people EVER really clean anything but the cooking grates. Do that every so often, and spray the inside and outside surfaces with vegetable oil again to coat it all and get it reseasoned (all surfaces, even on top and under the 'lip' that holds the grates (that people say rusts out on this model). Do those things, and I don't see why this grill won't last for many years. If you don't keep it clean, it will rust out, just like the most expensive models.
reviews.author: TC

reviews.title: "Great Purchase"
reviews.text: I bought this grill in early 2009 because my old charcoal grill fell apart from years of use. The grill has held up well over the years with minimal upkeep in the heat and humidity of Eastern North Carolina. The cover worked well for 5 months of the 2009 summer while I was away, but as soon as I was back I was back to grilling. I have rarely used the cover since. The grill has rusted some as mentioned in other posted, the gas bottom of the barrel, the tank stand, etc, but it is not as bad as some others have mentioned, especially being uncovered for almost 2 years surviving hurricanes, and snow in the winters. I plan on purchasing another one in the future when this one finally kicks the bucket. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes the convenience of gas, but truly loves to cook with charcoal. For the next one I will break out the grill, cover it in high temp spray paint prior to assembly to assist in making it last.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: "Grill - Smoker"
reviews.text: Though there were a lot of parts and a lot of nuts and bolts, Time was all it took to get the unit together!
reviews.author: TIP1120

reviews.title: "Built cheap"
reviews.text: I bought one of these not quite 3 years ago and is already rusted out clear through the back wall and it spent it whole life on a covered porch. The 5 year warranty only applies to above the grates. Do not buy . I like the idea of gas and charcoal but just too cheaply made.
reviews.author: Cf

reviews.title: "Excellent value"
reviews.text: I have had this grill for two years now. I have thoroughly enjoyed my grill, utilizing both sides (but mainly the propane). when I bought mine I paid the $300 listed here.Two months later they had a Memorial Day sale where they discounted it to $200! What a steal that would have been. I bought one at that price as a gift to my son and he loves his, too. But, it was worth the $300 I paid. If they happen to toss out another deal like that ($200) for the summer I WILL buy another one and store it in the rafters for when the one I have takes a dump! that's how much I like mine.I use mine on average of twice a month, more so in the Spring and Summer of course. For me it has plenty of cooking space. It has held up well, albeit I heard about the negative reviews regarding the brand cover that is assigned to it. I purchased a heavier duty cover, which fits perfectly over it, and it too has l lasted (so far), but the harsh Temecula summers have been beating it down (mostly faded) so I expect the need to buy another one after this season. The burners have not fouled up on me, it heats up quickly, and it disperses the heat well (although like another reviewer stated yo need to only use one burner for lower temp jobs) overall. I have only used the side burner twice. that was an added feature I knew I would rarely use when I bought it.Negatives: The small interior elevated rack, which I rarely use, seems to have taken a beating from the heat generated. Still is functional, but need to give it a good scraping / cleaning before I use it again.GAs for rust - I see two small area down at the legs, which are exposed. No big deal... I plan to steel wool it down and spray it with some Rustoleum.I give this grill two thumbs up!
reviews.author: GrbgCllctr

reviews.title: "RUST BUCKET"
reviews.text: bought it for under my new covered grill station .  rusted out less then 18 mts . sad
reviews.author: oifmurph

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: I bought my grill about six months ago and have been thrilled with it. I use the LP gas for quick weekday grilling and with the addition of the side smoker box, I use the large grill on the right for weekend smoking. The only criticism that I have is that the paint doesn't hold up where it is exposed to heat. However, that is easily corrected with a $5 can of high-temp spray paint. If you are interested in smoking, this is a very versatile piece of equipment. You can catch it on sale for around $200. Side smoker is $60 or so.
reviews.author: Builderbob

reviews.title: "Loved at First but now:("
reviews.text: I really enjoyed finding a dual use grill but after a year the gas side has rusted and is falling apart, charocoal side is still going strong. I have replaced burner and heat sheilds in it now the racks need replacing.
reviews.author: LoveGrillingyearround

reviews.title: "save your money"
reviews.text: Rusted out in a year and a half after keeping it covered. Save your money for a better design without chimneys directly over the grill.
reviews.author: Skip

reviews.title: "Its Going To Be A Good Summer!"
reviews.text: I purchased this gril because my wife broke my cheap one. I thank her everyday I use it for breaking the old one. I built it my self, and it was not difficult at all. I had to get some help to put the lids on but other then that it was easy. The reason Heavy is a pro is because the wife won't touch it.
reviews.author: SgtHep

reviews.title: "buyer beware"
reviews.text: I got this for a fathers day gift from my 2 grown sons. I love the design of gas vs charcoal and enjoyed using the grill for about a year. I kept it covered when not in use but noticed serious rustingon the brackets that support the burner sheilds. The brackets are welded to the bottom half of thegrill and are not replaceable. The center sheild finally collapsed and was no longer usable. I contacted the manufacturer since it had a multi-year warranty but they would not honor it since I had not receiptsince it was a gift. I can't tell you how disappointed I am in this product ! I like the design and liked that it was American made, but they will not get my money again! I've had to replace the igniters 3 times, the charcoal grate 1 time, the temperature gauges (2) 1 time, and jerry rig supports for the burner guards that rusted away. The 45.00 cover is piece of junk too...last about 2 yrs max!
reviews.author: Disappointed in Davie

reviews.title: "Love this grill"
reviews.text: I was looking for a grill back in April and stumbled upon the idea of a dual gas and charcoal grill at Sam's Club. I was very excited about the possibilites until I read the review of that particular grill. Almost gave up on the idea until I saw this grill at Lowes. The reviews were great, it came highly recommended by the sale's guy (which isn't saying much, but still), and I haven't been disappointed since we bought it.I love the combination of quick grilling with gas when time is a factor and the more time consuming but more flavorful grilling with charcoal when I have more time. I've used both sides several times now, following the directions for treating the interior of the grill with vegetable oil, and have not noticed any problems. I got the grill cover and have been very pleased with how it fits and is easily put on and taken off. I appreciate that in the future I can invest in the charcoal chimney and smoke box, both of which are made by Char-Grill and are said to be easily attached to the grill (plus the grill cover expands to cover the smoke box, which is nice).The grill is heavy, but I had the grill pre-assembled and delivered, at the time both free, which saved on the trouble of moving this beast of a grill. I plan to store it in the garage during the winter to avoid exposure to the MN winters, so the weight will only come into play twice a year.
reviews.author: Kyle

reviews.title: "Smokin' Grill!!! (Pun intended)"
reviews.text: This grill rocks, but you absolutely must get the smoker attachment. I rarely use the gas side, but it is nice to have either as a backup or more space for large parties. It's really easy to control the temp when smoking ribs, tri-tip, tenderloins, Boston Butt, whole turkey (top rack removed), whole ham, or whatever you're into.I have read that some people complain about rust. I've had mine for a year with zero rust. I do keep it covered when not in use, but I use it A LOT!I had Lowes assemble it for free, because I am that lazy. Though it has wheels once the smoker box is attached, don't plan on moving it around very much! The burner works great with my Weber Charcoal Chimney. Coals are hot and ready to go in only 3-4 minutes.
reviews.author: DC

reviews.title: "FABULOUS GRILL!!!"
reviews.text: Bought one 20 months ago and it has been great!!  I also bought the 3 year warranty with it and it will be well worth it because this weekend I'm taking it in all rusted out and falling apart.  I plan on buying the exact same one with another 3 year warranty.  Therefore, every 3 years, pay $39.95 and get a new grill!!
reviews.author: bill

reviews.title: "RUSTED BUCKET"
reviews.text: I waited to review this product untill I had it for awhile. Ive had this two years and the propane side is rusted out , the burners are gone and the burnwer covers as well.
