Three monts in the electronic lighter quit. After year one I cleaned the grill from top to bottom for the winter and even then the rust was prestty bad. I cleaned,primed, and repainted the entire inteior with a quality high temp black paint hopeing to slow the rusting process. No such luck. The bottom has been falling apart in chuncks now since I opened it this year. (Yes I kept a quality cover on it always) On top of this the grill grates began to fall apart after the first year as we began to notice pieces of them coming off on our food. If you want a grill for one year its OK but not past that.
reviews.author: fishomen

reviews.title: "Love it"
reviews.text: Couldn't get any better, gas & char-coal. only thing that could be better is more room to get gas tank in & out. really hard to get a big hand in to turn gas on & off.
reviews.author: Pappo

reviews.title: "Replacement Grates"
reviews.text: If you buy this grill. your grates will be rusted within a year and replacement grates cost more than a new grill!!!
reviews.author: kwhite141

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: This grill is great, as it is big enough to grill 4 chickens on each side. The best Part is that you can use charcoal on one side and propane on the other side for those people that don't like charcoal flavor. Just wish I would have bought it when it first came out at the cheaper price, but still worth it.
reviews.author: Joey

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: So far this is the best investment I've made this year. I love that it's a gas and charcoal grill in one. The only thing I had a problem with was putting the grill together. The box says easy assembly which is true if you've put together a grill before. It took about 4-5 hours which isn't too bad, but if I had a truck or knew someone that does then I would've bought it already assembled. I was actually missing a couple parts and one piece was broken, but luckily I was able to go back to the store and they replaced them for me. Now that everything is up and going, I love this grill and highly suggest it. My main suggestion is to buy this preassembled. Rent a truck if you have to
reviews.author: asilva85

reviews.title: "About the rustƒ"
reviews.text: I bought my 5050 two days ago, but only after reading the customer reviews. Noting a few comments about rust, I asked the Service Manager about rust prevention. He said the best thing I can do is to invest in a cover and not to leave it sit under the cover more than a week at a time without removing it to let built-up condensation evaporate, both on the grill and on the inside surface of the cover. He also urged me to read and follow the page in the Owner's Manual regarding grill preparation. That procedure is similar to seasoning a cast iron skillet to prevent rust. I'll do my part - let's see if it works.
reviews.author: Larry L.

reviews.title: "Duo Char Grill"
reviews.text: Overall for the price its a decent grill...have had mine two years and the LP side rusted a bit at the bottom...so I spray painted it with stove paint as per the instructions...it would be best to keep this grill in a shed in winter...the cover was a piece of junk...too heavy and faded horribly..so i just replaced it with a generic cover...but as I said for the price and options for dual grilling i love it and it works great..its just not very weather proof!! ...remember its not a Weber!!
reviews.author: meegd

reviews.title: "Awesome grill"
reviews.text: Three friends and I have one. We all love them. One more neighbor is getting one, after grilling on it last weekend. Great grill for a great price.
reviews.author: Whahoo

reviews.title: "Awesome Grill"
reviews.text: This grill has stood up to some abuse and still performs. I have had this grill for three years and stored it outside with no cover so it has faded a bit but that is to be expected. I grill year round so it has seen a lot of use. I have had some very hot fires in it and the thermometers still work. This spring the igniter quit but that is minor. I managed to get the fire hot enough to burn off the ceramic coating so the surface needs to be replaced but again that is my fault. Overall this has outperformed any other grill in this category for the money.
reviews.author: Kansastransplant

reviews.title: "Great Concept. Love it."
reviews.text: The best concept to hit the market in my opinion. Gas convenience during the week smoker on the weekends! The gas side serves as a grate cleaner also, so when you want to smoke something, I simply cook off the gunk on the gas side and then place the grates from the gas side to the char/smoker side. I rotate the grates in this manor. Love the grill concept.My grill when I bought it had some slight workmanship issues. The ash pan for the offset smoker box had a gap on one side when fully closed and there was a slight dent in one of the bottom bbq pit halves which was not a big deal, but a bit of an eye sore. The temp gauges were pretty accurate. Personally I would have liked to have seen the bottom shelf made out of aluminum vs. steel because mine rusted out after 3 years. Once it starts, it won't stop. My advice is to use veggie oil on the paint every few months keep the grill lasting, it really does help. I wish I would have done it more often than I did but you learn the hard way sometimes. Best thing to do is get a pray bottle, fill it with veggie oil, and then spray down everything letting it soak into the paint. Using a paper towel wipe away any excess.Great starter smoker/grill but you may find two dedicated grills, one smoker plus one gas grill a better option after you gain some experience. I would recommend this grill but it could benefit from some minor improvements.
reviews.author: Grillmiester

reviews.title: "Great Grill For The Money"
reviews.text: This grill is built well and with the design of the frame is appears to be stronger than most I have had. The electric lighter for each burner is great it allows you to use any without lighting one you do not intend to use. The adjustable charoal rack is a simple design but very good and by not being of a crank design reduces breakable movable parts. The coating appears to better applied and more resistant. My only complaint is I have not been able to find a cover to fit it correctly.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "grill"
reviews.text: I love the grill. after assembling found it to be shackley. It really needs more screws in the legs.I added two more screws to each leg. made it much better. I went back to the store and checked one of their assemblies. if I had done that first I more than likely wound not have bought it. sales staff and clerk were excellent. Please use this to make it better. it is not a complaint.Thanks Bernice
reviews.author: Pete

reviews.title: "Worst Grill Ever"
reviews.text: Porcelin pops off of the grill grates. Chargriller refused to stand behind their product. Grill didn't last a year.
reviews.author: Vicky

reviews.title: "Best grill I've ever owned!"
reviews.text: I've had this grill for over 7yrs, with the proper maintenance and care it will last for a very long time. I'm sure I will get another 3-4yrs out of it. I installed the firebox and also made a modification installing 2" dolly wheels on the legs so it does not have to be lifted to move (it is very heavy with the firebox installed, also keeps moisture out of the legs). I purchased the cover and keep it covered whenever not in use. I have had to replace the flame deflectors on the gas side which is expected (they take a beating) and also replaced the striker -all parts can be ordered directly from Char-Griller.This is a great grill for any type of cooking you wish to do, very heavy gauge steel unlike other brands. I highly recommend it!
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "Best of Both Worlds"
reviews.text: I love the convenience of gas for quick grilling and/ or thee smoke and flavor of charcoal grilling. The interior is designed for easy clean and the 6 ceramic grates remove individually so cleaning is a snap. The inside is also easy to wash down with a hose. I love my DUO Grill
reviews.author: Jefferyp100

reviews.title: "Excited to buy it, disappointed 6-12 months later"
reviews.text: I bought the grill 2 years ago or so and I was so excited to buy it when I saw the large grilling area, the fact that you could do propane on one side & charcoal on the other. I bought it without doing any research or reading the reviews, but I thought it would be an upgrade to my smaller existing propane grill (and I wanted to do more charcoal grilling).Along with the grill, I bought the custom cover. The cover is not good quality & I didn't like how it is just "weather resistant" rather than water proof. After a very short period of time, I found that the grill was starting to rust, more so on the propane side rather than the charcoal side. I live in the pacific northwest, so I assumed that with the amount of rain that we get, the grill wasn't suited to our wet weather. I am surprised to see how many others around the countrly are having the same issues that I am with rust.As for the grill itself, I did like how hot the propane side got in such a short time, but did notice some paint discoloration, as well as the thermometer stopped working at the end of the season. I didn't like that the uppper warming racks are stationary and cannot be taken off the BBQ. My old BBQ had a place where the warming rack would sit, and if you decided to do so, you could lift it off with ease before or during your grilling. I like to grill a Beer Butt Chicken, which requires the chicken to sit upright on the beer can. With the warming rack on the grill, it made it next to impossible to do so. On the other hand, I like to have the option of the warming rack if I am making a Garlic bread or baked potato on the grill...so it would have been nice to have a removable rack rather than one that gets screwed on during assembly.The grill worked really well for the first summer I had it. After the summer I put the cover on it & stored it on a covered area of my patio, but it still got really rusted. I also had issues with the flame being way too low after re-filling the propane bottle and in turn had to play around with the propane regulator & have it sit in a specific position for the flame to be on at a reasonable level & create decent heat. Most recently, one of the grill knobs on the propane side has seized up & I thnk I may have to start using pliers to turn it on and off.Two years in, I regret buying this grill. I think next time around, I will spend more to get a quality grill rather than less on the cool idea of having a grill that can be propane or charcoal.
reviews.author: Concrete

reviews.title: "GRILL BLEW UP!"
reviews.text: I would NOT purchase this grill again! We've had it about 3 months and we set it on low to cook a few T-bone steaks and went to check on them and the grill had blown up! Melted the hoses and all of our grill accessories! It was so hot the propane tank was on the verge of blowing too! Do NOT buy this grill!
reviews.author: LeAndra

reviews.title: "Doesn't get much better than this..."
reviews.text: I am a twelve month BBQ user. We have had a monster Stainless grill for the last 9 years and have cooked pretty much everything including the annual thanksgiving turkey. Decided this year it was time for a new grill but didn't want just another boring SS monster. Did some looking on the web and found this char-griller with great reviews - and for the price at lowes (pre-assembled no less) I figured I would give it a shot. I also got the side firebox (though I didn't set it up for a week - silly mistake, what a difference).When I got it home, I went through and tightened up all of the hardware fasteners, which was much better than having to actually build the whole thing from parts. I then read ALL of the direction and followed them very specifically including the all important seasoning phase. It is a good idea to buy this AFTER dinner so you are not tempted to jump right in to cooking on it as you will be disappointed if the seasoning step is skipped. I have since used this grill at least 20 of the last 30 days both gas and charcoal sides.Setup and installed the firebox the second weekend and WHAT AN AWESOME ADD ON!!! We had some people over for a mini BBW party (yes seems strange in mid March). We smoked a rack of spare ribs for dinner all day on the charcoal side while grilling up burgers and dogs for lunch for the kids on the gas side.I wanted to also comment on the convenience of lighting charcoal using a chimney and the side burner. I have watched my father with his old Weber kettle grill for years - lighting the charcoal with one of those U shaped electric lighters. This was the biggest reason why I bought a gas grll to start with. Using a charcoal chimney in conjunction with the gas side burner makes charcoal grilling as easy as gas cooking and SO MUCH TASTIER!!!Make sure you get the custom made cover too (which is made to accomodate the side firebox also). Worth the price!I also decided at just about the one month point to go back and get the extended protection plan. Skipped it at first based on the low price, but now appreciate what a great BBQ this is a want to keep it around for many years. (4 yrs additional for only $60)In closing this is a great grill at a great price that can be picked up locally with no assembly charge. Thank you Char Griller and thank you Lowes!!!
reviews.author: FireSignZ.com

reviews.title: "More than I could have expected!"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill back in early June, even taking in to considerations the bad reviews from some and as such was expecting some problems. I was gladly mistaken! I picked up the firebox and cover as well.I had it together in about two hours by myself even though the instructions recommended two people. The wheels, which a lot of folks complained about were beefier and must have been upgraded. There was no "knocking" or drilling out the channel from firebox to charcoal sections, all I had to do was remove some screws and a plate.I can pick it up with the handle on the firebox and there isn't that much play or flexing as was reported in some earlier reviews, and is fine for me moving it around the area I use it in for mowing and so forth. It is heavy!I have used it almost every day...all sides, gas, charcoal, and firebox, with no rust or problems. I do keep it liberally coated with pam, burn it off (the grill racks) after each use, get rid of ash in the firebox as it can attract moisture, and like I said, no rust problems. It has been rained on...although with the cover on over the weeks as we've been experiencing a high incidence of thunder storms and high humidity in our area of the Pacific Northwest, which is unusual, and I'm not going to move it every time the clouds roll in but this weather hasn't promoted any rust.I've done (smoked) pork roasts/chops, several briskets, and chicken using the firebox and all turned out excellent and it held a constant 248 degrees on both apple wood and mesquite fires. This is with the chimney vent cracked and I like to smoke at the higher end temp, but the 225 to 250 range is ideal. No problems there. A rule of thumb, if the smoke is white, the fire's right! I can get pretty consistent temp control using both the gas and charcoal sides as well. I don't know what an earlier review is doing wrong.Overall, this is the best grill I have ever owned! If you want to experience true BBQ in the south east and Texas styles without spending thousands, then I'd get this grill!Tonight we are having spare ribs cooked on the gas side, and I don't expect anything but a delicious experience!
reviews.author: bigbill756

reviews.title: "Great grill so far"
reviews.text: This is my first new grill in probably 10 years. Been without one for the last two.  Haven't had a charcoal grill in forever. We decided to do this duel idea and I love It so far. I have used the charcoal almost every time I have used the grill but this week I used both used the gas for corn on the cob and the charcoal for the burgers and brats. I like the idea though that if I don't want to wait for the charcoal to heat on a week day I can move a little faster with the gas. The thing is solid and heavy. I put it in and out of the garage for now since I didn't get a cover yet but I have followed the instructions to help keep it preserved anyway. I got the smoker for the side but haven't used it yet. That's my next task. Happy Grilling!
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Great Idea horrible product"
reviews.text: I purchased the grill in May 2009, early fathers day gift. I also purchased the side fire box and the cover. grease drips off the back of the lid both gas and charcoal sides. The grill started having problems right away, ignitors out, upper racks rusting, paint affected from heat, cover breaking down right away I could go on and on. After one summer of use I emailed pictures of the grill and the rust and ripped cover and the company would not stand behind their workmanship. They claimed it was my fault for having the grill outside in the weather???? I bought the cover from them and used it. Two years later all the upper racks are rusted, the tabs that held the burner covers are rusted and gone. I have tried to repaint the tubs with high heat paint to cover the endless rust. Great idea, bad grill, horrible company; worse customer service ever and they do not stand behind their product at all. I was hoping buying American was the right thing but I will NEVER buy Char griller again and I will discourage any one thinking of buying one to turn and walk away. These grills are not worth one cent.
reviews.author: Yubajeff

reviews.title: "Fire Hazard"
reviews.text: This grill is not designed well. Grease drips off even with drip pans in place. Apparently the gas line was damaged in the process, and our entire grill went up in flames yesterday. Propane tank valve and all! Could have burnt our house down and our cars. Will never buy another CharGriller product again
reviews.author: Jess

reviews.title: "RUSTS OUT QUICKLY"
reviews.text: Like the convenience of duo fuel grill, but first one rusted out almost completely on charcoal side after a year, then the gas flame shields rusted.  Sold that grill and bought another of the same 5050 model, covering it to protect it, but flame shields still rusted through in less than a year, lots of other rust on entire grill.  It is a great grill when new, but don't expect a long life.
reviews.author: William

reviews.text: Very easy to use, easy to clean, like that we can add a smoker to the end at a later date.
reviews.author: Liz1952

reviews.title: "Grill O' My Dreams!!!!"
reviews.text: I have to agree with smokinforfun, this grill is indeed "freakin' awesome" ! His review is what swayed me to finally decide on this grill. I was replacing a Weber, and was steering towards getting another one. However, my father insisted on gifting me a new grill of my choice, with $$ not being an issue. That being said, I shopped around to try and find the best deal. I knew what I had in mind, but felt guilty looking at the $800 grill I had my eye on. I am so glad it worked out the way it did. I never knew this grill existed, and I had planned on purchasing a a charcoal grill later in the season. When I saw this grill I feel in love. When I saw the price and the reviews from real people, it was sold.I have had it for only a month, but have cooked every meal on it since it arrived. I have used the charcoal side much more than the gas. Some of the reviews suggest that after 6 uses rust begins, I have used it about 30 times, maybe more. I will fire up the gas side to cook a quick lunch for my son and his friends when they are in the pool. NO RUST. I have cleaned it many times, because of the high usage. I have the custom cover, which is heavier and more durable than my Weber one was. It was only $30(reg. price) vs. the $80 Weber(sale price mind you). So, I do not understand how the cover did not work for the other people. Just like, smokinforfun, I plan on getting the smoke box.The only problem I had was with assembly. I had it assembled at the store. The lids were put on backwards, and the middle gas burner was not connected. In the matter of a 10 minute phone call, I had a brand new grill and 10% refund promise. 2 days later the new grill was delivered, the old one removed. That afternoon I went to my local store and got my refund, no questions asked. Kudos to Rob, manager at the Vineland, NJ Lowes. The service I received with this transaction made me a loyal Lowes customer forever. We are in the midst of several home updates, so I will be visiting Lowes a lot in the near future
reviews.author: ccrizturp

reviews.title: "7 great years, 4 moves, 3 Alaskan winters"
reviews.text: This grill is fantastic. It survived 4 military moves, including 3 years in Alaska. It eventually began to rust out, but not before getting every penny out of it, and then some. It is so well made and user friendly that I am buying the exact same grill again!
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "Duo 3-burner propane and charcoal"
reviews.text: Great grill heats up quickly on the propane with even cooking. If you have a little more time and want the charcoal side that's easy too. Get your coals hot place meat on burner, you can close the lid to hold in the smokey flavor. A definite good purchase.
reviews.author: Terry

reviews.title: "Grill Too Hot on Low"
reviews.text: I purchased the Char Griller Duo a couple weeks ago and have used it twice on propane and once with charcoal. I am a "low & slow" griller, mostly cooking on low heat (250-300 degrees). The Char Griller, on low heat, exceeded 500 degrees when cooking with propane. I bought another thermometer just to verify the temp, and tried switching to a different gas bottle. I loved the grill and concept, and really wanted this thing to be satisfactory. But there is no way I can live with a grill that can't cook below 500 degrees, especially when the company recommends against cooking at that high of a temp. I emailed the company twice with no response. So....I hauled the grill back to Lowes tonight, broken hearted.
reviews.author: Stix

reviews.title: "Love it"
reviews.text: I have had this grill for over 5 years now and love it. I did buy the smoker box to go with it. The heat stays in and I ues it every week. I smoke meat about 5 times a month and it comes out great. I have had some rust, however I have not put a cover on it. I'm buying another one, just to have it. I do some BBQ Comp. and have used it. Would like to have better wheels to move easier
reviews.author: The Kid

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: This is a great grill. There is nothing fancy about the thing, but it can cook.I have primarily done propane cooking for quick food preparation in the evenings when the kids and wife are hungry. Immediately you will notice it is solidly built. The thing heats up quick and it is easy to maintain a steady temp. I like the fact the lids(s) actual wrap around the bottom half to kind of seal the cooking area. The warming rack is well sized and can hold a good deal of whatever you may be cooking; as others have said the warming rack should have a small lip on the back. Cooking with coal is similar all be it a bit slower initially than the propane, but it works really well. The adjustable coal rack is a useful/good feature. Again, plenty of cooking space.Pros:Heats FastSteady Temp MaintenancePlenty of cooking roomSide burner (good for heating up coal in a coal chimney)Cons:No back lip on the warming rack
reviews.author: nelsbellls

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews that lamented about their difficulty in assembling the grill. It took me 45 minutes from box open to grilling, I could have been done sooner but my wife wanted to help). Yes, the directions have their muddled areas...just stop and think...common sense goes a long way.This grill is well designed and works great. I looked at a lot of grills before I made my decision. This works for my family's grilling needs. Don't sweat the assembly.
reviews.author: planb110

reviews.title: "Best grill I have ever owned"
reviews.text: I have owned a number of grills over the years and this one is by far the best one I have ever owned. Having the ability to use gas or charcoal is obviously the selling point here. If I have extra time for dinner, I use charcoal. If I need to cook something faster, I'll use gas. I have also used the charcoal side on many occasions for smoking meat. It is fantastic. I eventually purchased the side firebox and love that also. It allows for the entire charcoal side to be used for smoking rather than just the center portion when using the "water-pan smoking" method.I've been using it for over 2 years now and constantly recommend it to people. When this thing finally does need to be replaced, I will likely buy the exact same one to replace it with.Cons: It is a large grill with heavy components. It took a while to put together and I would recommend 2 people rather than 1. I did it myself but it would have been much easier if I had someone to help. The components will rust but if you use vegetable oil spray (as the manual recommends) to coat the outside and inside it will make the grill last much longer.
reviews.author: OD17

reviews.title: "BEST GRILL FOR THE MONEY!! ALL AROUND....LIDS DOWN"
reviews.text: I bought this grill Brand New way back in April of 2007, have had it ever since, up until this month March 28th 2012 when I finaly had to junk it, agaist my wishes because it was such a great grill for so long (5years stright) Im going back to Lowes to buy me another one tomarrow after exstensive research on all the others everyone has to offer for the same price anywhere around. All I can say is that, yes it does rust, what doesnt, and the ignitor switch or plunger however you want to say it to start the gas side stoped working soon after it was bought new, maybe in a few months, and the Heat Shields finialy started to fall of thier suports cause of the rust deteriation of the metel just this 1st part of this year 2012 and the best part is, not for me anyways, is that all the time I have had this grill for the past 5 years stright, I NEVER HAD IT COVERED! and it was always left to the Elements outside, so I think I can write this review being Unbias and because of maybe my lack of stupidity and the unavailbilty of being able to purchase a cover to fit it, till they finialy came out, since I also had added the Fire Box (smoker) to it. I will aslo note and agree with everyone else, the wheels and axles need some attention. After a while those plastic wheels start deteriating and wont want to support the weight of that mosterous BBQ Grill when its time to move it around after about maybe 4 years. The axles are just short enough to reach from side to side of bottom frame so adding other type of wheels wich I recomend later will aso require an longer steel axle. Other than this I cannot complain. I will be however buying a cover this time for my new one and I bet it lasts Alot longer than 5 years. I just wished it was a 4 burner though.
reviews.author: BigJon

reviews.title: "Best for the money and then some..."
reviews.text: I wanted this grill for two years but my wife had me rebuild our very expensive stainless after each summer of use. Stainless is far from it, and the guts rust away in no time. I was trying to convince the wife again why I wanted this grill when the salesman pointed out that it was on sale for $199. Sold!!! This is the best grill hands-down; whether your preference is gas or charcoal, you're set. It is well built, durable and can be heated to very high temperatures if necessary. I haven't added the smoker yet, but it's ordered and on the way.
reviews.author: Grill'n It

reviews.title: "excellent customer service"
reviews.text: purchased in box. brought it home to assemble. the main tubes for the frame were damaged. called customer service new tubes arrived within three days. upon further assembly charcoal ash pan and two grill grates found to be also damaged. customer service again (very nice people) sent new parts again within three days. gave grill to father for father's day he loves it.
reviews.author: Robbie

reviews.title: "Quality control issue with charcoal body hang tabs"
reviews.text: During assembly of the #5050 grill I found one of four hang tabs was missing from the charcoal grill body. The hang tabs are spot welded to the inside of the charcoal grill body (bottom section of charcoal grill body).I called customer service and then sent an email containing: model, S/N, receipt of purchase and pictures. They sent a replacement grill body to my home at no charge in a reasonable period of time. This was a quality problem during manufacture that resulted in a defective grill. I wasn't happy that I needed to dissassemble and install the replacement part. Kind of makes you wonder what other parts of the grill may have similar problems that will result in a premature failure.I've used the gas side three times and it's seems to work well. Its too early to provide a reasonable review of this product but check those tabs before assembling the grill ! !
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Nice product"
reviews.text: So far I am extremely pleased with the grill. I really like the fact I have both charcoal and gas. Gas for when I dont have time to wait for charcoal to get ready. The side burner works great for getting the chimney starter going with the charcoal. The large wheels allow for it to be moved with ease if you want instead of those tiny casters found on other grills.
reviews.author: Cygnus

reviews.title: "Doesn't last long"
reviews.text: I bought this grill 2 years ago. The concept is really great. Having the flexibility to use charcoal is what sets this grill apart from the rest. With that being said, all of the internal components are rusting away. I do take care of my grill by cleaning it periodically and do cover it after use. So beware that the longevity of this product is 3 years at best.
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Great for the money"
reviews.text: My wife got me this for our first anniversary and I have used it at least once a week. For the first year and a half it sat outside in the weather in Florida so yes it got rained on. I use the gas side a ton and the charcoal side quite often. The gas side is still useable but about time to replace it and the charcoal side is still in great condition. I would say three years for 3 hundred bucks is a great deal because everything will eventually need replaced. If you get a thousand dollar grill that last 5 years you didn't get as good a deal.
reviews.author: Chad

reviews.title: "Amazing every day grill"
reviews.text: I am in love with this grill. I have had it for over two years now, and it is still growing strong. After a year I bought the add-on smoker box. I love that there is both gas (weekday) and charcoal (weekend). I use the side burner for both cooking and the charcoal chimney fire starter. It is so easy to use, I can't find anything wrong with the grill! I bought a large generic grill cover for it which works pretty well, just be careful of the chimneys on top. I really like the small grill plates which make them easy to move around, the adjustable charcoal tray for ease of adjusting height and easy cleaning. My husband and I assembled the grill together which was not too difficult. Only thing is it is large and heavy. Also, if you attach the smoker box you have to remove the handle which then makes it very difficult to move.
reviews.author: KeriB

reviews.title: "Horrible and horrible warranty"
reviews.text: No regulation on the gas. on low heat it gets to over 700 degrees in minutes, causing the bbq to catch on fire. This has been the problem since we bought it. Called the company they would not warranty, replace or refund with out us jumping through hoops. I will never ever buy a product made by this company again. I will spend the money for a weber or a traeger.
reviews.author: Michelle

reviews.title: "Too Hot"
reviews.text: Greetings fellow grill enthusiast. Like many of you I spent several hours researching and choosing this product. Overall I am ok with the unit. The issue I am having is that even on low, the gas side is running at 450 degrees plus. I have reset the Regulator but it has not helped. I have read the FAQ which was no help. I have tried to use the website and do a support ticket, no help. If anyone has had the same problem and has a solution I would appreciate it.
reviews.author: Danny

reviews.title: "Fun grill but questionable quality"
reviews.text: I bought it on sale in mid April 2011 but did not use it untill the past memorial weekend, just past the 30 day returning period. it is an awesome design and reasonably priced but comes at cost of quality. In my case, the fire grate/ash pan on the charcoal side turns out to be defective. On one trial only, two of its six welding points have alreday broken off. I tried to contact the manufacture by phone and email but their customer service appears to be just for the show. No one has responded yet. I called Lowe's whose customer service filed a report and non-commitally promised to (maybe) exchange the part.I am crossing my fingers now hoping something will happen.Make sure you give it a good scrub during your 30 day trial. Hualing and dismantling this 150 lbs locomotive surely is a lot of fun as well.
reviews.author: DW

reviews.title: "One Happy Husband!"
reviews.text: After a few very strong hints from my husband, I surprised him on Christmas Eve with this awesome grill!!! He began using it almost immediately. He is extremely pleased with the versatility this grill offers, with both the charcoal and gas options. I am very happy I took his hint - he helps more with the cooking now!!-Sherri (and Russell) Coker
reviews.author: Sherri

reviews.title: "Ultimate grill for everyday use!"
reviews.text: I grill 5 to 6 days a week. This is without a doubt the best grill I have ever owned. Very well constructed with quality materials. After one year of use my grill still looks brand new! My only complaint (and it is a minor complaint) is the position of the propane tank in relation to the drip pan. It does make changing the tank a little bit of a pain if you're in the middle of cooking due to the heat of the drip pan being so close to the tank. But if you use hot mitts to change the tank (or better yet make sure you have enough fuel to finish the job before you start) it's really not that big of a deal. As far as the wood/charcoal/smoker side, absolutely no complaints from me. I can dial in from 190 to 650 degrees with the air inlet and outlets depending on what I am cooking and keep the temp consistent throughout. If you like to cook with either propane or wood/charcoal, this IS the grill for you!
reviews.author: Norcalrigger

reviews.title: "rust bucket's"
reviews.text: I live in N.C. and this grill was only in use for a11/2 years the paper thin lip that holds the grates was first to go then fixed with nuts and bolts lasted a few more months after that the backing fell out . I was at the dump when i saw another person with the same grill his review was the same but his lasted 2 years
reviews.author: wontdothatagain2

reviews.title: "Love it but would not buy again"
reviews.text: I have had this grill since August 2012 and it has been covered since the day I bought it. The inside of it is falling apart and rusty. The burn covers will not stay on bc the prongs that keeps them in place have burnt away and the covers have rusted and burnt away. The knobs have cracked and broken off that I have to use a screw driver to utilize the gas side of the grill. I did not buy the extended warranty plan so I cannot get a replacement. I have been to lowes and the only replacement parts I can buy is the gas hose and the knobs.
reviews.author: Tipster

reviews.title: "Like the dual fuctionality"
reviews.text: I like the dual fuctionality however mine is now a couple years old and is starting to fall apart. I have used a cover and have taken good care of the grill but the grill grates are now rusty. I am disappointed I can't find brand name replacement parts for this grill. They still sell this grill at lowes. Why can't char-broil sell replacement parts?
reviews.author: DrewF

reviews.title: "Best Grill I've Ever Owned!!"
reviews.text: I just love this grill! We have wanted one like this for a long time, and finally found it on sale at Lowe's just in time for my husband's birthday!! It has great features like one side for gas, one side for charcoal, a gas side burner, automatic ignition, and HUGE grill surfaces! We are probably going back to buy the optional smoker box...
reviews.author: Belinda

reviews.title: "So far so good…"
reviews.text: My last grill (Char Broiler) rusted out in 3 years. We use a grill almost every day in the summer and keep it covered, but they seem to have a lifespan of about 3-4 years in this price range. I saw the duo and it looked like a really great buy, about the same as the Char Broiler that I had, Plus it has the charcoal option and the side burner. Seems sturdy too. So far I love it. Cooks great, nice and even. Lights right away. Grates are pretty easy to clean. The big question is, how long is it going to last? I guess we'll see. I did buy the cover that goes with it since it is an odd size and has the stacks. It is quite large and very heavy. One snafu during assembly the holes in the bottom of the gas side for the bolts that hold the grease tray, were drilled wrong. They were reversed! The ones that were on the left, were on the right and vice versa. Since most of the grill was assembled at that point and I didn't want to have to wait for a part from the manufacturer, I just re-drilled the holes. Hopefully for the sake of others, that was just a rare manufacturing error. I didn't find anyone report the same issue.
reviews.author: adsartist

reviews.title: "Best Grill I've Ever Owned!"
reviews.text: I've had this grill for going on five years. I also bought the side firebox for smoking. There is very little that I would change about this grill. It's nearly perfect.One thing I would change is that there should be a way to utilize both sides of the grill (gas and charcoal) at the same time when you are smoking meat. Being able to combine the two sides would be handy for indirect cooking and keeping things warm too.A few people are complaining about these grills rusting. Mine has rusted, but not significantly. It has been outside for five years so you have to expect a little rust I guess. I notice that the gas side rusts more than the charcoal side. I'm not sure why, but there seems to be something about the chemistry of the propane flame that encourages rust. In any case, I find that the people who complain about rust the most also seem to be the ones that talk about thoroughly cleaning the grill after each use. I think you need to let the grease kind of coat the metal to help keep it from rusting. I think you really have to treat this grill like a good cast iron pan. One thing I did do was cover the entire grill (inside and out) with vegetable oil after I put it together then let it get good and hot to "season" the metal parts of the grill. Since then, I clean out the charcoal ashes (they'll hold moisture) and kind of wipe off any kind of barbecue sauces (they tend to be acidic) and let the "grease" stay in place. I think a lot of my success with avoiding rust is to never clean off that protective layer.Anyhow, this is a great grill. I'd buy another one in a minute...when I have to. I need to think about getting some new heat shields for the gas burners as they've pretty much seen their day and the warming grates have rusted, but they're not very useful anyhow and a little rust doesn't hurt anyhow. There's some of the black pain that has come off of the side firebox (I think due to pretty extreme heat) so I need to hit that area with a wire brush and a little high temperature paint.Buy this grill...but don't scrub it down and remove all the grease and oils between uses. Season it like a cast iron pan and treat it like a cooking tool and you won't be disappointed.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "I love the grill."
reviews.text: I bought my grill during this past black friday sale for $199. I've never had a charcoal grill always propane. This is the best grill I've had. In the past I've had a Weber grill, Aussie grill, and others this is the best bet for your buck. I would've still bought this grill for reg price. The side burner is great for starting a chimney of charcoal up. I also use the side burner to make beans and corn. I was surprised that the propane is quiet. I will be buying the firebox soon that attaches to the side of the charcoal grill so I can smoke a lot of different foods. The only flaw I see is that the smoke comes out a little where the hood of the grill closes. It's a easy fix to seal it off properly. I highly recommend this grill.
reviews.author: val

reviews.title: "Perfect Father's Day Gift!"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill because it was very highly rated at a large camping store, where we first saw the grill in person. What first impressed us was the large dual cooking surface, it's literally like getting two whole full-sized grills in one. This grill came assembled by Lowes, which saved us $ and time.My husband was thrilled when he first saw the grill. The black finish is reminiscent of the grills serious BBQ enthusiasts use- not like the shiny chrome pieces we've seen elsewhere for twice the price. We had a large family party on Father's Day, and my husband grilled boneless/skinless chicken thighs and hotdogs on the propane side, while slow-cooking pork ribs and burgers on the charcoal side. My family raved about the taste. The only two things we purchased that I wish had come with was a charcoal starter (which you can start on the propane burner- AWESOME), and ceramic briquettes for the gas side.
reviews.author: Big Momma

reviews.title: "Best Value for the Money"
reviews.text: I have owned the sister grill to this one for 6 years. It is a gas grill with the smoker attachment. The smoker attachment is part of the reason for purchasing this grill. I built an outdoor kitchen and have been in the market for a new grill for several months. I have shopped and compared many grills and feel this is the best value on the market. I looked at the more expensive grill Lowe's carries and love the thickness of the metal compared to the Char-Griller brand but the Charcoal side of the more expensive grill had no way of adjusting the height of the charcoal. I took my old smoker and attached it to this grill and now I have all three in one grill. Gas, charcoal and a smoker all rolled into one. Love the grill. It cooks better than any grill I have ever owned. I cook on the grill at least three times a week. Grill needs to be cleaned a lot to get long service from it both inside and outside must be cleaned and oiled down several times a year.
reviews.author: Joseph

reviews.title: "JUNK!!!!"
reviews.text: I have been using this grill for over a year now, kept under my awning and covered with a grille cover. The propane system SUCKS it goes out 20 times every time I use it. Will not stay lit. Since day one out of the box.  The manufacturer would not do anything to help me. I replaced the propane tank multiple times, and replaced the complete propane system twice! Complete junk! I threw it in the trash after 100s of times being let down
reviews.author: Me

reviews.title: "Very nice buy"
reviews.text: Bought it for my husband have used it more than him,Well I should say I volunteer to BBQ , lol, justLike the oven with less clean up. Both sidesAre great!!
reviews.author: dossjua

reviews.title: "Great Grill!"
reviews.text: Very well made and thoughtfully laid out. The steel is heavy duty and the gas grill heats up great, the grates hold heat for a good sear and the body seems to hold for baking well.I use the charcoal/wood side more and the side burner unit is perfect for igniting the charcoal. Unit for raising coals helps to bring on the high heat. Have not installed the smoker yet, but am looking forward to a triple threat....Overall a great value for the money!
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Wonderful"
reviews.text: We have had the grill for about 2 years now and really love it. It was fairly easy to put together and we have moved since and it traveled well.
reviews.author: emmashelhorse

reviews.title: "Best Purchase"
reviews.text: I purchased my grill over 2 years ago and it works like a dream. It took me a little time to assemble but once that was done it was easy sailing. I've grilled all through the summer and on the holiday's in the winter. I love it and look forward to using it for years to come. Buy the cover it's about 40 dollars but worth it.
reviews.author: GrillMaster

reviews.title: "GOOD GRILL"
reviews.text: HAD THIS GRILL FOR 11/2 YEARS SO FAR ITS GOOD GRILL YES IT'S WILL RUST IF YOU DO NOT USE THE COVER ALL THE TIME I DO NOT KNOW WHY IT HAS 3 BURNERS IF 1 BURNER HOLD 300 FINE ON LOW THE BOOK SAYS NOT TO GO OVER 400 IF YOU GO OVER 400 THEN IT WILL RUST FASTER BUT EVERY GRILL I HAVE HAD RUSTS CAN'T WAIT TO GET THE SMOKER FOR IT
reviews.author: JRC111

reviews.title: "Great Gril"
reviews.text: I bought this grill 2/10/11 for my husbands birthday. He and I put it together with no problems. Very sturdy grill. We didn't realize how heavy it would be and had to get additional help to move it to our grilling area. I also bought him the smoker box that attaches onto the side. Great addition. A must have for anyone. We have never done any smoking but we tried it. There were rub and marinade recipes inside the installation booklet and they are great. We smoked a boston butt and it was sooooo goooood. Glad I bought the smoker box. Everything we have cooked, either on gas side or charcoal side has turned our tender and juicy. This is the best grill we have ever bought.We love the grill and are very happy with it. We have not had any problems with the grill from putting it together to cooking/smoking on it.
reviews.author: Teresa

reviews.title: "5+ years and still going strong!!"
reviews.text: The best grill I've ever owned! Cover is a must have(you can see how many years I've had this grill from black cover fading) The only problem is the middle rack is disengaged but I don't use that thing anyways.Due to this grill, I quit buying the least expensive gas grill every year for $100 or so. Added bonus is that my family can enjoy charcoal grilled steaks here and there
reviews.author: Zowie

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: After only a couple weekends and several uses--my review is this.It is a great grill for the price.I have used the gas side and the charcoal side. I bought the side grill/smoker box and it works great.Whoever assembled it made a couple mistakes but they were minor fixes and quick as well.The feel of the grill is that the steel used is heavy enough to get hot and hold heat well. As I would expect. The grill itself is pretty heavy so it isn't moving from where I have it.Overall--its a good grill and I would recommend it.
reviews.author: RD-in-TX

reviews.title: "The MAN GRILL"
reviews.text: Smoker works awesome. Gas grill side is not the best but it works for my purposes, which is to keep stuff warm after smoking. I like the all in one grill. concept. The ignitors stopped working after 1 year, but I use a lighter now instead. Very heavy, hard to move around, but it's a man grill so what can you expect.
reviews.author: Les

reviews.title: "Rust bucket"
reviews.text: I have had this grill for 1 years, at this time it has rusted grates, rusted top cover,igniter failed 1st year. I should say it's all rusted and very hard to cook a burger on rust. All they would need is a better coating and then charge us a little more.
reviews.author: barcusfirearms

reviews.title: "Do not buy this grill"
reviews.text: I had this grill for a year and 1/2... Inside and the bottom of the grill is completely rotted. I had it covered when not in use.,however we do grill 3-4 times a week.....do not spend your hard earned $$$$ on this grill.
reviews.author: Rijeka

reviews.title: "Good Concept Bad Design Poor Quality"
reviews.text: I love the concept of this grill. I even bought the additional offset smoker attachment. The metal on this unit is very thin. The smoker would not hold heat and it took a ton of fuel to smoke a brisket or pork shoulder. The racks that hold the grill grates on the gas side rusted out after 1 year of use. The gas side is now useless. The igniter on the grill side never worked.Like I said great concept, poor quality.
reviews.author: TexasGriller99929

reviews.title: "More than disappointed"
reviews.text: I purchased this about 2 years ago, got the firebox attachment for smoking reasons.  Also bought the grill cover.  The grill cover didn't even make it for 1 year and the material basically turned off white in color.  The firebox attachment has a wooden handle on it.  When you use it, it starts to sap and you can't even touch the handle without burning yourself.  The one temperature on the smoker side has already stopped working.  There is also no way to control the temperature of the smoker.  The components of the grill side have already wore through and have started to fall apart.  I had a weber grill for over 16 years with the cover and only had to replace the burner and covers 1 time.  Like I stated, I have only had this grill/smoker combo for 2 years and I am already going to have to replace the components of the grill.  I like two things only, the size of both the smoker and the grill and the quick lighting of the grill.  Never had an issue with lighting it, well yet anyway.
reviews.author: Shawn

reviews.title: "Best grill ever"
reviews.text: We bought the grill before a party at our house. We couldn't even believe how much we would enjoy it. This grill is so awesome. You can have both sides going at the same time, or you can just use one side. You can slow cook ribs and let them simmer. This is probably my favorite purchase at Lowe's so far!!
reviews.author: Tamra

reviews.title: "BBQ completeness"
reviews.text: I purchased this product approximately 5 months ago now and chose this particular product because it has both a gas grill and barbecue in addition to the side burner. Call it the best of both worlds. So far I have been happy with it and would choose to purchase it again if need be. Assembly is pretty straight forward although it does scratch easily during the process. The storage space below is adequate at best but the shelf reduces the that. Also the box is very heavy and large so you certainly need two people to move it; be careful however because the box is poorly made and everything fell out the bottom when I was moving it to the assembly area I had chosen. This unit also has an addable smoker which I like for its expansion capability. Price of this item is substantially more than other options but those are either gas or barbecue, not both. Lastly it is much bigger than other bbq options so plan the space accordingly, especially if you choose to add the smoker unit at any point.
reviews.author: J3mmr71

reviews.title: "Very good grill"
reviews.text: I like how a lot of people are complaining about the quality of the grill and keep saying "oh it rusts within a year of having it, it's not worth the money ahhhh." Well I hate to say it, but anyone with common sense and know-how is going to know that this type of grill, with the material it is made of, IS GOING TO RUST. But there are precautionary measures that can be taken to prevent this, and sometimes, it's just going to happen! The performance, cooking space, heat distribution of this grill is phenomenal. Does the job exactly how I would want a grill to do. IF you are worried about such a grill not lasting, or rusting, just research how to help prevent it as best you can in the long run, and you will enjoy the grill to it's full potential. Happy Grilling!
reviews.author: Thatoneguy123455

reviews.title: "Love the dual charcoal/gas capability"
reviews.text: Side burner is really good to start charcoal in chimney & then put in charcoal side of grill. Love it. Only draw back to the unit is the hole for the 20 lb propane tank is too small for use with exchange tanks. You would have to own your own propane tank with a small rim in order for it to fit in the hole provided by the grill. Would love to have 1/2 inch added to the circumfrence of the hole.
reviews.author: Wade

reviews.title: "A Good Grill Aspiring to be a Great Grill"
reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews here before purchasing this grill. To me it was easily assembled and the instructions were clear-cut and linear in their approach. The only complaint I have about the instructions is that there are conflicting points about how to season it before use. Recommended seasoning in one place recommends a max of 250 degrees for two hours and in another is says use high temp for the gas section. WD-40 is recommended to remove remaining glue from affixed placards; this did not work for me. Instead, I used "Goo-Gone" with good results. Sure would have been nice to use stainless fasteners, at least on the small screws that retain the burners. Thus far I've had a hard time keeping the charcoal side down below 400 degrees, even with the damper shut. As some others have commented, sealing or at least minimizing the gap at the back of the top and bottom housing might help in that regard. The side burner works great to light off a charcoal chimney and I've found that the capacity of charcoal held in one of these devices is about right for this grill. The burner tubes for the gas side burn nice and even, providing balanced heat control. I'll have to wait and see about the tabs and burner shields that some have expressed concern about here. One thing going in I didn't like is the wheel configuration. For smaller areas, you have to pull and swing to maneuver this behemoth where you want it, requiring a good amount of muscle and a switching engine from the local rail yard. I'm going to retrofit mine with casters so it can simply be pushed or pulled from its parking area on my deck. Overall, so far, so good.
reviews.author: Yooperman

reviews.title: "this is the best grill i have ever owned!!!"
reviews.text: I have owned mine now for 2 and a half years and still works as good as the day i bought it and i cook on it alot!! I have lots of parties and it has been on many trips camping and to the beach... and the only thing i have had to do to it is replace a few bolts that fell out during the 260 miles trip.. I bought the grill and the side smoker and the cover too.. it is heavy but a good grill that will last will be heavy.... I would recomend this grill to everyone!
reviews.author: rosscoe

reviews.title: "Love this grill!!!"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for my husband's birthday. We looked at several grills, but we always came back to this one. We really liked the 50/50 design with gas and charcoal. We prefer charcoal, but in some situations I, being the one who cooks the most, like the gas for quick fixes! We've used it a few nights a week since I purchased it nearly a month ago. I bought it already assembled so I don't have any comments of how easy or difficult it was to put together. When I got the store they were having a sale on these so several were ready to load up! I removed the grates and washed them in my kitchen sink... cleaned up good as new!!! Also, the wheels roll smoothly for easy mobility. Best purchase I've made in a long time!!!!!
reviews.author: Jess

reviews.title: "Great grill for year round cooking"
reviews.text: This is a great grill. I use it all the time. The side burner gets hot enough to fry all foods outside. I use the gas grill in the winter time in the pacific northwest, and the charcoal in the summer. I love the option to have both types. If you have the money buy this grill. It takes some work to put it together. Its very big. Have fun and happy grilling
reviews.author: carl1331

reviews.title: "A great grill"
reviews.text: These are some of the best grills out there I have had mine for 3 years and NO problems. I have seen reviews people say thiers is rusting and so forth and so on but are you takeing care of it ? The owners manual says do not get the grill too hot it will remove the coating (powder coat) not paint after use clean and wipe down your grill Olive oil works great... My 1st Char-griller is still being used after 7 years and this 50/50 its used 3 or 4 times a week year round. I agree the cover does not hold up to good after about 6 months of sun it dries and starts to rip during taking it off and putting it on so much. would love to have a better cover for it but the grill still looks and works like new. After all the years of use its almost time for some new IRON grates.
reviews.author: partsguy

reviews.title: "BBQ was good till paint Peeled"
reviews.text: Purchased July 28,2016, just over a year later paint started to bubble and peel. I always cook on a low tempature so over heating was not an issue. I also purchased the cover so it would keep it out of the weather elements and hopefully keep the BBQ in good shape over the life of it. Other than the paint it was a good BBQ just disappointed in the quality
reviews.author: Phil2844

reviews.title: "Char-Griller is truly an excellent product."
reviews.text: This is my second Char-Griller Duo-Pro 50/50. I added the firebox/tabletop grill to the first one. I have owned stainless steel grills that did not even come close in comparison to the Char-Griller. This is by far the best grill you can purchase and a great bargain at the price. As for Lowe's, they are simply first class! They honor Veterans with the military discount and they do not discriminate regarding products it can be applied to. Please Veterans, support Lowe's. They truly do appreciate us, and they show us that!
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "New Toy For A Dad"
reviews.text: We just bought this grill yesterday and used it last night. It was the best grilling experience that i have had. Only thing i have found is with 3 burners on the gas side, it is complicated to keep the temperature down but even with that issue this is the best product, yet, for the man who wants to cook alot in his backyard. This is an excellent product, well built and extremely heavy. I would recommend this product to friends and enemies. love it. Read other reviews about quality, i checked all the weld joints and all seems well for new product. I will report back on durability over time.
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Had mine for 5 years"
reviews.text: I have had this grill combo for about 5 years now. Since I smoke alot, the charcoal holders are worn out. Firebox is worn out.Getting ready to replace mine with another one just like it and adding another fire box.This unit is everything your looking for and durable.
reviews.author: bakeray

reviews.title: "Great grill, great price!"
reviews.text: This is the first grill I've bought in a few years. I'm not a "griller" in the tailgating, manly man, uber-fan sense of the word. I just like to cook outdoors on occasion. I've had a propane grill for about 10 years and never liked it much simply because you just cannot beat the flavor of charcoaled cooking. However, propane has its upside and there's no denying that it's much quicker to flame up the propane than to wait for the charcoal to get ready. So, I've now got the best of both worlds! It took me about 2 hours to put together and it looks fantastic! I've used the charcoal side (awesome experience, easy cleanup) and the heating plate. The heating plate just fired up so easily that it almost scared me when I turned it on...seriously...I jumped and laughed at myself when I did. Didn't expect the "pop" that started it right up. The burners on the propane side fire up just as easily and I just love this thing so far. Time will tell how well it stands up to weather and use, but the cover should help extend its life.
reviews.author: Amateurgriller

reviews.title: "This is awesome"
reviews.text: My husband general only cooks on charcoal but wanted to try his hand at gas. He wasn't willing to give up the charcoal option so this was perfect for us. The gas is great for quick week night grilling and the charcoal is still there if he wants. We plan to add the smoker box and then we can let go of another separate piece. He's impressed with the quality and says it's beefier than the competition. Also we like the bottom shelf that will hold the gas tank.
reviews.author: mnaweeks

reviews.title: "Heavy duty"
reviews.text: Purchased this in July for my husbands birthday. He loves the fact it is both charcoal & gas. I asked this be assembled on pickup ,no charge, very nice.This BBQ is nice and sturdy, heavy and  heats up quickly. The surface is big enough for several items at once. I haven't had to cook much since purchasing this, my husband is happy to BBQ.
reviews.author: beades

reviews.title: "All Around BEST outdoor grill"
reviews.text: The best tasting grilled items come off of a char-coal grill, there is no dought about that. The Heat from the coals are what make a perfect product, wrong temp, it never comes out quit right. With the ajustable coal rack you are able to move them at what distance you need in a matter of seconds. All of a sudden the Kids and grandkids show up and want a quick meal with you, well, being the char coal side of the is just about out and no room left, we can quickly open the gas side of the grill and throw on what ever we can dig out of freezer or have someone run down the street and pick up burgers and dogs, walla, everyone is eating dinner without much of a big problem. I believe you call that convienence, and Grandpa or Dad saves the day. The only way this grill could be better is that if insted of a pot grill it is changed to a griddle type grill. Somehow saving some room from the grills and adding the room to the burner area to ENLARGE a griddle area, OMG that would make it perfect. I HAVE NOT seen a grill with a griddle incorparated into it. I have seen large self supporting griddles but not built in with a BBQ grill, WORK on that design and you will have a larger peice of the market, ALOT of people would love a griddle incorparated into there grill, and not one you have to add or take apart everytime you want to use it. I would pay a bit more for the hudge improvement on the griddle.The quality is fantastic, i let mine cool down a bit and then throw my cover on it and there is not the slightest hint of rust anywhere and I live in and around the water in Cocoa beach.
reviews.author: Joebob5291

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Duo Black Dual-Function Combo Grill"
reviews.text: I was looking for a dual grill set up and the Price that Lowe's had it offered for was unbeatable at any other location selling like or similar grills.  This is my first time buying a Char-Griller, so I'll see how it works out over the years but so far I am very pleased with its functionality and easy cleaning ceramic grades.  No issues.
reviews.author: LeRoy

reviews.title: "Not the best Quality"
reviews.text: I've had my Duo-5050 for less than 2 years and the igniter has gone out twice, moisture somehow gets into it and I guess it shorts out. The other issue is the support angles that hold up the heat plates, they rusted and are so thin that they are half missing. I did buy a cover for it to protect it from the rain but it hasn't helped. The exterior is well made but the quality of the inner parts should have been made heavier duty materials.
reviews.author: Asada

reviews.title: "ok for cheap money"
reviews.text: Its ok for a low priced grill if you purchase it keep it indoors. Mine rusted out in 2 years.
reviews.author: Kellerbear

reviews.title: "We will see if they stand by their product!"
reviews.text: I purchased the grill on sale and was excited about the features. After spending over an hour putting it together I noticed the igniter button on the control panel was missing and looked like it had been cracked off before packaging. By this time I was too far along to rebox the 160+ lb. item. I will be contacting the manufacturer tomorrow. We already used the grill twice, and it seems pretty good except for having to try and light the 3 burners seperately with a match. I will update this review after my phone call.
reviews.author: dakotadb2

reviews.title: "Don't bother"
reviews.text: I bought this grill less than 2 years ago, completely rusted inside and the covers on the burners are completely gone. The grates on the gas side are rusted badly, can't use it anymore. We don't like rusty hamburgers.. I wouldn't buy this grill again.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "service with a smile"
reviews.text: i ordered a repeat of the grill that finally fell apart here in bermuda! rust is rampant here on island and for this grill to have lasted almost 4 years (and i use it almost every day!) is quite remarkable. as an ex-chef the quality and ease of use is on the money, only wish design guys had come up with a better drip tray access for cleaning. other than that i just ordered another, as well as one for my son and the service from customer relations on the phone at Lowe's was impeccable getting these to our freight forwarder. didnt get his name but many thanks,
reviews.author: dale

reviews.title: "Best Grill Ever!"
reviews.text: I have owned many grills before, but this one is by far the best. I love having the option of charcoal or gas. The side burner is great for my charcoal chiminey. I can usually get the charcoal ready t cook on in about 10 minues. Love it!
reviews.author: MarkE

reviews.title: "Chargrill"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill a little over a year ago. I have it covered when I am not using it. The first bought cover was brand name, it lasted 6 months then began to tear with the pipes go out. It is rusting on the top, the bottom of the grill itself, and the drip pans. I have replaced the drip pans, the tent burner covers, and top rack (warmer).The last grill I have from Char-boil was terrific and lasted 8 years. Not sure what has happened in the years past, but grill is good if you only want it for a year. I am not losing any more $$ in this grill. I will be purchasing a new grill soon.
reviews.author: Dana

reviews.title: "Best Grill on the Market"
reviews.text: I bought this grill about a year and a half ago to replace my old beat up Brinkman 3 in 1. I'm telling ya, the thing is Awesome! My wife loves the ease of firing up the gas side for some quick dogs or burgers. I love the charcoal side for barbeques, and the smoke box on the side for low and slow smoking. The burner on the side is great for the chimney starter or sauteing veggies or whatever you need.So far the quality has been real good. No rust thru tough wet Oregon winters. Keep it clean is the key and I have the cover over it when not in use. I would recommend this grill to anyone!
reviews.author: BigMacattack

reviews.title: "The monster of a grill"
reviews.text: We didn't think we would use both sides at once. We do most of the time. We bake with the charcoal side and cook with the gas. For big cookouts. We have this thing cranking every weekend both sides it's on real what you can do with this grill. We bake Pizzia on the charcoal side on Sunday nights. This grill kicks butt.
reviews.author: Rock22

reviews.title: "We're Smokin'!"
reviews.text: First saw this grill in Alaska and learned just what smoking could do to food that had become humdrum. This grill is perfect for all you barbecue needs. It came on a Friday and by Sunday was fired up and ready for my friends to enjoy its creations. The grill is well designed and made to order for everyday use. Whether your smoking a brisket or grilling hamburgers and hots this grill won't let you down.
reviews.author: Emscowboy

reviews.title: "Great idea, not sure it will last"
reviews.text: The grill is a great idea, easy to assemble and works well; however, I had the grill for less than a month and already had rust spots - primarily on the inside gas-side lid, but also on the exterior around the chimneys.  About 5 weeks after the purchase, I went to Lowes and they told me to start by contacting the manufacturer.  The manufacturer said they do not coat or protect the grills against rust and that "A very important part of maintaining your grill is the frequent seasoning of all the metal surfaces of the grill – not just the cooking grates."  I have had several grills in the past 25 years and have not had to frequently season all surfaces (inside and out), particularly within the first month.This grill would work well in a covered area, or if you have time to frequently season the grill  "using any type of cooking oil, animal fat, shortening or any kind of 100% vegetable oil, which means nothing with water in the ingredients."  Be sure to do the entire inside, not just the grates.
reviews.author: myname

reviews.title: "Awesome Grill for the money"
reviews.text: This grill is a must have! When it comes to buying things I love to research and read reviews before i commit to buying something. Couldn't decide on whether to buy a gas or charcoal grill but after seeing the reviews for this grill i finally decided to buy it (at the original $300 price). Now about 1.5 yrs later I am so happy with it that I plan on getting one this week for my parents since it is on sale for only $200 (insane price to pass up).The grill is great quality and quite a jaw dropper with its impressive smoke stacks and size to all that see it during my many back-yard cookouts. I love using natural wood lump charcoal to get the great taste of wood fired BBQ and lighting the charcoal couldn't be easier when using a starter chimeny ($15) and the side burner (only takes a few mins to get the wood lit) However, I can't stress enough how great it is to have a gas grill as well. What a truely brilliant idea to have both methods of cooking on the same grill. When i'm cooking for only myself or when i'm in a hurry I use the gas instead. No need for a second bulky grill around. Yet when having a party i put both sides running to get an amazing 1040 sq inches of grilling surface. My guests can't eat fast enough to run out of food!!I also purchased the smoker side box which is also great quality and very easy to use. The temperature while smoking meats is much easier to control than i had first imagined. Also, the temp doesn't drop much when opening the hatch to add charcoal or smoker chips do to the indirect setup.The only cons i have is that the cover fits rather loosely and tends to come off or rip during very windy days. Now i keep a small 2X4 on it to keep it from flying into the neighbor's yard if i forgot to take it off. Also, the handles to raise and lower the charcoal grate should have been made of something that doesn't get as hot. Since temperature on charcoal grilling is controled not only with the vents but also by the height of the grate, i find it a bit annoying to have to grab rags or oven gloves in order to grab the handles to raise/lower it (due to the metal being extremely hot to the touch). Very big and hard to move around once the side smoker box is attached. Could use a 2nd set of wheels rather than having to lift one end to move it. But then again how often do you have to move your grill? (def not a tailgating grill) The rest of the grill is amazing and with a 5yr warranty against rust and availablity to order parts online directly from the company; you can't go wrong. That is if you ever even need to :)
reviews.author: M Cabral

reviews.title: "EPPIC Grill !!!"
reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this grill.  Live in Central Florida.  Use the grill at least 3-5 times a week.  LOVE IT!  I've read the rust issues, and I have to wonder how many of those inexperienced grillers are seasoning their meats and veggies with salt "during" the cooking process, which places salt directly on the metal parts.  We all know what salt does to steel, in a moist environment such as the inside of a grill.  Obviously, one should season whatever it is they are cooking, before or after cooking on the grill.  Before I found this unit, I was going through grills every 10-12 months.  We really give them a work-out. We keep the grill on a back porch, w/o a custom cover.  I'm not crazy about covers, because they tend to lock moisture inside the grill.  Also, I've found the Char-Griller inside customer service representative, on the phone, to be extremely responsive when I needed a small replacement part.On a third note, MANY people don't know how to cook and maintain the older "cast iron" grill cook surfaces.  NEVER use soap on cast iron.  Clean, if needed, then oil the entire surface, top and bottom, to reduce possibility of rust.  THANK YOU CHAR-GRILLER, FOR A REALLY GREAT PRODUCT!!!!  (No, I don't work for Lowe's or Char-Griller...lol)
reviews.author: Rob

reviews.title: "I like the concept of combo gas/charcoal grill"
reviews.text: My grill was delivered already assembled. It was missing a bolt for the shelf over the grill. The automatic electric ignition for the gas component does NOT work at all. If my electric ignition switch would work, I may recommend this product to a friend. Right now its hard to say.
reviews.author: GrillMaster2

reviews.text: After seeing my daughters, I really liked the gas, charcoal feature. Kept talking about it with my wife, she wanted me to buy it but I kept putting it off until I saw it on sale on the internet for $199 delivered. The local store honored the ad. Also purchased the Weber chimney and cover. Recommend the chimney highly for starting the charcoal. Recommend this grill to anyone thinking of buying a grill. Easy to use both charcoal and gas.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Love this grill"
reviews.text: I like the ability to use charcoal when I want and gas to fix a quick meal when I get him from work. Good sturdy construction and seems like it will hold up well. On sale for $245 right now. What a deal.
reviews.author: Romad275

reviews.text: We have had our grill for 2 weeks ( summer 2011) so far has been it is great not having to heat the kitchen on the hot, humid days of this summer My husband loves cooking on it however it has started to rust. What is up with that? Other than that the grill is great. If we as customers are going to pay $300.00 plus for something I don't think it should rusting after only a couple of weeks.
reviews.author: TT

reviews.title: "Great grill while it lasts!"
reviews.text: Wonderful concept. Love the ease of the propane side and the charcoal side is large, spacious and smokes well. The material is the absolute worst quality possible. The smoke box rusted after one use. The rest of the grill wasn't far behind. I have a Charbroil grill/smoker that is now 14 years old and has one tenth the rust. Brinkman has lost my business forever.
reviews.author: Sam

reviews.title: "First grill"
reviews.text: This is our first grill to go with our first home. LOTS of parts to put together but everything was there and it works great! Its heavy and it's something that you wouldn't want to have to move around all the time. We can't wait to host our first party and use both sides at the same time.
reviews.author: Jill

reviews.title: "Rust is King"
reviews.text: Full disclosure: I do not know how long a grill is supposed to last. This one is rusting at high rate. I spent $250 dollars (5 covers) over the years. The custom covers the are awful. The smoker for a non-insulated smoker holds your temperature great for backyard BBQ. The gas was great for the quick cooks my wife likes to do. I still smoke on it but the rust makes using the gas side very unappealing, The side burner is rusted out, the heat shield brackets have all rusted away. The entire grill is faded rusted and hardly looks like a place you want your food format this point. The bad news is, I love this grill because it was all in one space and my wife could cook easily. OUT of the box this thing is a five star review, after a few months your stars will likely drop to a one as well as there is no value in saving money if the product only last one good year and then starts to deteriorate. Highly disappointed.
reviews.author: Fireman1813

reviews.title: "Great Grill, do it all in one place"
reviews.text: I bought mine lows in June of 2010, used it all last summer, through the winter and still going strong.My wife likes the gas, easy to start and cook. I like the charcoal for the great flavors (Kingford Charcoal with the hickory already in it). I also got the side fire box for smoking and just makes this grill even a better choice. Also pretty cool to look at and has been one of the best conversation items when we have people over for a bbq. It is heavy duty and heavy weight, be sure to bring a friend to handle. The optional grill cover is the only weak link. In one year it is literally falling apart which is too bad, fits like a glove and looks good when on the grill. I will buy another but hopefully it has been improved.
reviews.author: mixitup

reviews.title: "Flaws kill an otherwise great concept"
reviews.text: I have owned this grill now for 2 years and I have to say that I like it, but it does have a few flaws. We'll start with those.The first problem was with the propane gas fitting. Recently, the brass nipple that creates the seal with the tank valve inside the plastic nut developed a radial crack. This resulted in gas leaking between the fitting and the tank's valve, making a noticeable hissing noise. I contacted the manufacturer and they informed me that the propane parts only have a 1 year warranty, so I would have to pay $25 + S&H for a replacement regulator. I went to a local hardware store for a replacement propane acme nut instead. Replacement was easy enough, just disappointing that they don't stand behind such an important part for long. BTW, the part was never attached more than hand tight considering the nut is plastic.The second is the sealing of the charcoal side. As other people have mentioned, there is a gap along the edge of the charcoal side, making control of the temp rather difficult/limited. That being said, it tends to stay around where I want it without much effort all on its own. Trying to smother the charcoal is pretty much impossible. Closing all of the vents just makes it burn slower until all the coals are dust.Rust has been an issue with the grill, though I do have the fitted cover for the grill to help protect it. The only parts that are showing some rust are the bottom shelf, the heat spreaders above the burners, drip trays and the side burner head. I hoped the cover would stop this altogether, but I noticed that the cover does allow water in through the seams. The body of the grill has not shown any rust yet.As for the pros of the grill:Convenient to have both gas and charcoal.Ceramic coated grates are thick and easy to clean.Electronic igniters work very well.Side burner works great with charcoal chimney startersHuge cooking area if you fire up both sides at once.In conclusion, I do like the grill, but the flaws of the grill mean I can't recommend it. To be honest, if you want both charcoal and gas, just buy one of each and sit them side by side.
