It will probably cost about the same, but then you can move each around independently and if one needs replacement, you don't lose both.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Best grill on the market"
reviews.text: My family gave me this for Christmas 2008. My wife and daughter put it together. Last year the burners on the gas side started going out one at a time. Also the heat shields started disintegrating. July 2015 I finally put the gas grill out of its misery. I got 7 years out of this grill! I removed the gas grill leaving the wood grill and firebox on the frame. I am going to build some kind of work top on the frame where the gas grill was. I sanded the rust off the frame and wood pit and will paint it tomorrow. I expect to get at least 5 more years out of the BBQ side, probably more if I maintain it like I should. This grill was NOT maintained at all. I seasoned it when it was new. Other than that it sat in the elements of central Texas under a cedar tree. It was easy to use. Most of the time I cooked using one or two burners. Very rarely were all three on at the same time. Does great steaks and burgers. The smoker I use for brisket, pork butt and turkey at Thanksgiving. Using oak, I can maintain 200-225 for hours while checking every 30-45 minutes.Oh yeah, ordered another CharGriller gas grill from Lowes. Can't beat it.
reviews.author: RetiredCoach

reviews.title: "Mostly Disappointed"
reviews.text: Hi - I have had this grill for 3 years and have had many problems. Just like you could imagine, I was super excited for a grill that could cook both gas and charcoal because on the weeknights after work, I don't have the time for charcoal but on the weekends, nothing beats the taste of a slowly grilled steack over charcoal. Well, the first problem that I noticed is that you cannot leave the propane tank open on this grill and expect to still have gas in the tank ( I know for safety reasons you shouldn't do this and maybe its more common than not, but my old grill was great for this#. I first used this grill for Easter, and we cooked the appetizers around 1:00, then shut down the grill #but didn't close the propane tank# while we prepped the main course. At about 3:00, I went to start the grill back up but it wouldn't start because there was no gas left in the tank. It was a full tank when we started, and so I had to run out to get a new tank on Easter and push back dinner by an hour and a half. The next problem that I had was the hardware on just about everything was completely rusted by the second season #and yes, I had the customer grill cover on the grill at all times that it was not in use). The handle to the gas grill fell off because the nuts rusted off and the top vent plate fell off because the hardware also rusted through. The temperature gauge on the gas grill also fell off but I'm not sure if it was rust related or just poor quality. In the second season of this grill, after discovering that the hardware was of poor quality and falling apart, I noticed that my temperature lever on the right hand side was no longer increasing/decreasing the heat when I turned it. I eventually removed the lever and discovered that the inside was stripped so the small plastic peice that used to sit in the metal device to turn the grill temp up or down had broken off and so the third burner would now have to be turned with a screw driver. Well, now the curb appeal of my once awesome grill was missing a knob, a temperature gauge, a handle and the top vent cover. My final problem was the straw that broke the cammels back. At the start of my third season, I can now no longer get the temperature above 300 degrees. I just got a new propane tank and the grill started up without problem. I had flames on all three burners, but I couldn't get the temperature any higher than 300. I tried everything in my power to get this thing cooking without luck. I used to have a grill that lasted for 8 years, never a problem with it besides old age. This grill leaves a lot to be desired, lacks any kind of quality, and doesn't hold up with the competition. I will never purchase another grill by this company after my experience with this one. I'd rather cook over an open fire in the back yard.
reviews.author: Dannyboy381

reviews.title: "worst grill ever"
reviews.text: THIS IS THE WORST GRILL I HAVE EVER OWNED. HAVE HAD IT LESS THAN 1 YEAR AND THE THING IS NOTHING BUT A BIG PILE OF RUST WARRANTY IS A JOKE . I PAID 399 FOR THIS GRILL PLUS ANOUTHER 89 FOR THE SMOKER ATACHMENT. WHAT WAIST OF MONEY I WOULD NOT RECOMEND ANY OF THE PRODUCTS THEY MAKE AFTER HAVING BOUGHT THIS GRILL.
reviews.author: robert

reviews.title: "Better than the Best including Weber"
reviews.text: This is the best grill I have ever purchased. It was easy to assemble and it cleans up very easy. I have seen grills costing 3 and 4 thousand dollars that cannot match the quality and design that this grill offers. This grill is the only grill for a good price across every website with 5 stars. Chargriller is the best and if I could purchase stock in this company I would... Buy it you will not be disappointed!!!!!!!!
reviews.author: Love to Grill

reviews.title: "Rust Bucket"
reviews.text: I bought this grill two years ago along with a 2-yr extended warranty.  I highly recommend not buying either one.  The grill is completely rusted out. In fact the side burner fell off recently. The burner covers are almost non-existent.  I thought surely some of these items would be covered by Lowe's extended warranty.  Wrong, they don't cover rust!  If I could give this a zero rating I would.  Total waste of money!
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Solid Purchase"
reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. They last about 7 years. Great deal when you get BBQ and grill all in one. I suggest adding the sidebox for indirect BBQ heat and a Cover to prevent the Texas summer from destroying the product. Don't purchase any outdoor grill/bbq in Texas without purchasing a Cover for it.
reviews.author: Ron2

reviews.title: "versitile"
reviews.text: I am a charcoal man I love slow cooking, but when the need arises for just a quick meal I found that having both types I just awesome.
reviews.author: Butch206

reviews.title: "GOOD BBQ BUT NEEDS WORK"
reviews.text: GOOD IDEA ,BUT THE REGULATOR FOR THE GAS WENT OUT AFTER 90 DAYS.IT SOME TIMES WORKED IF I KNOCKED ON THE REGULATOR FOR A FEW WEEKS THEN STOPED ALL TOGETHER BUT COIL SIDE WORKS GREAT, GAS SIDE DID TO BEFORE THE REGULATOR WENT OUT JUST DONT LIKE THAT I HAVE TO BUY A NEW ONE AFTER SPENDING ALL THAT MONEY .
reviews.author: MIKEYMIKE

reviews.title: "Poor Customer/Product Support"
reviews.text: While I generally like this grill, I have been trying to order parts for it for three months and they are continually out of stock via the Char-Griller website/customer service department. I am told that the parts will be in soon, but I have not found them available since corresponding with the company in April. If you plan to give your grill hard use and expect that some replacement parts will be required to keep it usable for a number of years, this is a serious drawback to this product.
reviews.author: Griller

reviews.title: "Well built. Works great"
reviews.text: I really like the option of being able to use gas or charcoal. I have only used the gas side so far. This grill is pretty nice for the price. Well built and has a lot of nice features. And you can buy a smoker attachment as well!  Very cool.
reviews.author: FastEddiesRCYuma

reviews.title: "Great grill for the money!"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for my husband's birthday and he absolutely loves it. We use the gas side during the week for a quick meal and the charcoal side is perfect for those lazy weekends. This will be the last grill we own. The barrels are good solid, heavy metal.
reviews.author: TGoswick

reviews.title: "Caught on fire, all rusted, heat is very low"
reviews.text: I bought it 3 years ago, gas grill is bad, heat is very low. but today I started the grill for the first time this year, put some steaks and the whole grill was in flames, I shut off the gas but the grill was still on fire, my head couldn't register what is going on for couple of seconds, how could metal grill be on file like it's made of wood. I ran to get some water and put down the fire with water. scary thing. the grill is total garbage, stay away.
reviews.author: Bell2041

reviews.title: "This is no mamby pamby grill."
reviews.text: This is no mamby pamby grill,its solid as a rock.Assembly instructions are great,everything went together smoothly with one exeption. One thru hole was missing on each of the leg cross bars. I just made my own. all parts are wrapped nicely and none had any damage.It takes a while to put together but its worth it.The ignitor seams to be a lttle on the cheesy side but works.It heats up quick and hold a steady temperature. Boughtt it on sale for $199. I got a great deal.Its worth twice that.Dont hesitate on this,buy it
reviews.author: Roy

reviews.title: "Overall a pretty good product"
reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I'm not too happy with the workmanship of the threaded holes in the legs and frame support. I started putting it together with a ratchet and switched to a philips head screw driver after almost stripping out two of the holes with the ratchet. Now the whole thing wobbles just a little more than I'd like, but overall a pretty well designed product. I really like the grease trap under the side burner on the gas side. Someone was really using their brain when they designed that part. I guess that doesn't have anything to do with Lowe's. The sales associate was super-helpful and offered to have the thing put together for me. I opted not to do that and really should have, but oh well.
reviews.author: txsmarine

reviews.text: The button to light the burners doesn't work but other than that, just keep a lighter handy
reviews.author: vicn

reviews.title: "Great grill that get LOTS of USE!"
reviews.text: This is an awesome grill! No better way to be able to cook with gas, charcoal, or smoke all in one unit! We've had the Duo for nearly six months and it gets used at minimum 4 nights a week if not more! In fact it is so easy to use and cooks so well that we probably do more cooking outside on the Duo than we do in our kitchen. The side fire box attachment is a great add on that produces great smoked BBQ!The only issue I have with the grill is the design on the gas side. The bottom of the grill has a large drip pan that can be removed for cleaning, but the bottom of the gas side can't be removed for cleaning like other gas grills that have a pull-out bottom. Not a real problem in the big picture.Do follow the directions and correctly season the grill prior to use! This will protect it against rust.
reviews.author: jr0112

reviews.title: "Maintenance and mods needed"
reviews.text: This really is a good product.  Read the directions and follow manufacturer's recommendations.  In the directions, it is specifically stated that this grill must be seasoned before use.  That will help prevent rust.  In addition, constant maintenance is also key.  Clean it.  Occasionally, re-apply some vegetable oil.  The burner will need to be ground and re-painted with high-temp Rustoleum on occasion, because the heat removes the paint and it will rust.  It's simple: take care of your stuff.  Cover it when not in use to keep the rain/snow off.  Thoroughly clean and re-season it at least twice a season, more if you use it a lot.  Get the side fire box as well to get the full effect of this thing.  It really is versatile.There are some videos out there of some mods done such as adding stove gasket and RTV sealant, adding dryer vent to the charcoal side chimney to lower the chimney to grate level, installing baffles & fire brick for smoking/heat control and adding additional grate-level thermometers.  I'll be trying some of those this coming season.In general, this is really worth it, especially if you hang on and wait for Lowe's to put it on sale (will hit the $250 mark on sale, so wait if you can).  There is ample storage space, plenty pf cooking area (I grill for a family of 6 on it) and it is really versatile, especially with the side fire box attached.  I was really skeptical when I was first looking at them.  As I looked and compared, the features and cost per feature began to make sense.  I really like using charcoal, but there are times where life is just too busy to wait for it or we just want to throw some dogs on the grill for lunch or in between my kids' track meet and their concert.  That makes having both gas and charcoal worth it. I went for the versatility and cost, and am very happy with it after a full season of cooking 4 times a week (sometimes more, sometimes less) on it.
reviews.author: Glenn

reviews.title: "My Wife And I Love This Grill!"
reviews.text: I first saw and fell in love with this grill over a year ago. But times were tight so I had to just look at it in the store. Then this year, all in the same week, we got our tax refund, Lowes put it on sale for $199 and I received a 10% of my total purchase coupon from Lowes. I jumped the the truck and headed to Lowes and bought it! I love having the option of both gas or charcoal. Charcoal for burgers, steaks, smoking BBQ ect and gas for quick cooking hot dogs or long cooking items like beer can chicken. We used it at least 4 times a week! There is not one thing I don't like about this grill. Keep it seasoned like the instruction booklet says and it should last you for many years to come. When this one finally wears out, I'm buying another one!
reviews.author: James S.

reviews.title: "Great idea, poor execution"
reviews.text: With all the glowing reviews of this grill, I felt I should post my experiences, which have been much less positive. I hated the idea of having to choose between gas and charcoal. I appreciate the convenience of gas for everyday use, but wanted to be able to cook a good steak over charcoal. This grill seemed like the perfect answer.The main issue I had is controlling the heat. Both sides have poor lid fit, and many holes. As another user stated, the LP side is open enough to blow out all three burners on a windy day. On the charcoal side, with all dampers closed, it is impossible to control the temperature because there are so many leaks. The fire simply rages out of control. To make matters worse, the bars that cover the burners on the propane side do not sufficiently overlap the flames, so you have to deal with constant flare ups. Couple that with inconsistent heat that led to severe hot spots, and I was left with burnt food and a lot of frustration.There are other negatives, and some positives, that have been mentioned in other reviews. But if I can't get it to cook right without extensive mods, none of that matters.Sounds good on paper, but not worth the hassle. I use the grill often and want to enjoy it. I got rid of the Duo, and am coughing up the dough for a Weber that will perform properly and last me 10+ years.
reviews.author: hqgriller

reviews.title: "Disposable Grill"
reviews.text: As several others have stated this grill is a great concept and worked perfect for about 2 years before the low grade metal started failing. Just like others the thin tabs that hold the grates burned out. Loved the way it got very hot and offers the best of both cooking worlds but durability is poor.
reviews.author: Captain53

reviews.title: "great for the price"
reviews.text: I have needed a new grill for a couple of years and avioded buying one because of the cost. I have had my eye on this grill for a while but never bought it. Finally after hearing me repeatedly say I'm gonna buy that grill my wife bought it for me. I love the fact that if you want to cook up somthing quick you have the gas side but if you have the time you also have the charcoal side for cooking. We also purchased the side fire box for it. Now I have a 3 in 1 grill/smoker all in one. I would buy this grill again in a heartbeat. Honestly I think the smoker is the best part. Easy to hold temp a very large cooking surface and virtually no mess. Great grill for the price. The only down fall I have found with this grill is that the gas side cooks way to hot for the size. The MFG tells you not to get the grill over 500 deg so you dont damage the paint but with only 2 burners going on low the grill stays at 400. I guess I will have to adjust my cooking style. Other than that this grill is AWESOME!!!!!!
reviews.author: TRAV3150

reviews.title: "Best Grill I have EVER had!!!!"
reviews.text: I would like to say thank you very much for engineering such a wonderful product that allows the use of both realms of cooking styles for specific items and time frames. I have owned this grill now for about 3-4 years and use it at least 2-3 times a week. I prefer to have open fire meals and always BBQ'ing all the time for gatherings. I honestly would not purchase from another manufacture for a grill. The original parts are all still intact and in really good condition, including the cooking grates from both sides and the flame shields (the gas side). Those are needing replacement and in the process of replacing them. I mean after 3-4 years, that's amazing!!!. I would highly recommend this grill and have succeeded.
reviews.author: R. Herrera

reviews.title: "Love it"
reviews.text: This has got to be one of the best grills I have ever purchased. I like the fact that I can light my charcoal on the side burner with the charcoal chimmney I purchased and then dump them into the charcoal side and cook away! no lighter fluid.
reviews.author: Tommymob

reviews.title: "Rust bucket"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for the versatility it offers and enjoyed it immensely, in the beginning. After only a few months, despite prepping it properly and keeping it covered, it began rusting and peeling paint. After 2 years it is now full of rust and not even worth scrap. It cannot be salvaged and I have to go out and spend more on a new grill. I'll be avoiding this brand and will spend more on another, which is what I should have done in the first place.
reviews.author: Rizz

reviews.title: "Love it."
reviews.text: I have had my bbq for over 2 years....if, by some catastrophic event, it stops working tomorrow I would still buy another one. Since I got it, I use it like 3 days a week. I clean the grill crates every time I use it, cover it when not in use. Still works like when I first got it. My only complaint....and it is not even a big issue...it took me over three hours to build...but I was enjoying just putting it together. Word of advice....do not buy a bbq and expecting to eat off of it the same night you buy it.....that goes for any bbq you buy unless you buy a prebuilt bbq
reviews.author: Jeffrey

reviews.title: "love this grill!!!"
reviews.text: I have had my eye on this grill for over a year and was finally able to wear my girlfriend down enough to purchase. assembled it by myself in about three hours with no problems. so far i smoked a pork shoulder, two racks of ribs, four ribeyes and a whole chicken to perfection. used the propane side to cook corn, asparagus, baked potatoes and kabobs. Everything turned out perfect!!! Best grill i have ever owned and it looks cool too. propane side gets VERY hot with all three burners on, even at low setting. keep an eye on that as the instruction manual says to not cook at temps above 450 because it can damage interior. i recomend using only two burners if lid is to remain closed. first time i smoked the pork my neighbor opened his window and stated "thats not fair!" he is right, its not so got pick one up today....
reviews.author: Keith

reviews.title: "Duo fan best of all the grilling methods"
reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of these grilles I have owned. The first one lasted a little over 7 years before I replaced it. Both times I have bought the side box for use as a smoker. These grilles are good for someone who likes a lot of options on grilling methods. We vary or cooking a lot and this grille gives us plenty of options. Want to make them last? Keep them covered in cooking oil spray. I clean and spray mine down after every use and like I said the first one lasted 7 years. I gave the first one to the neighbor after I bought a new and he is still using it. The main issue I do not like is assembly. Total pain to put together. I am picky though so I always assemble myself and double check everything. Im sure in another 7 or 8 years Ill be back to buy another one because of the great success Ive had we these grilles
reviews.author: SouthernKentuckyCubCadets

reviews.title: "8 Years Old!"
reviews.text: I have had this grill for 8 years and finally the charcoal side has rusted out in the back bottom. I use my grill all year round it gets a lot of work. I kept it covered. I did give a new coat of paint after 4 years. The gas side still going strong. However need to get a new one for this 4th Of July celebration. would highly recommend this grill to anyone who loves to BBQ with charcoal and have the convenience of gas. Just a reminder to all who have a problem with rust. Do not wash the inside of the grill with water. Scrape and sweep out, it will last you much longer.
reviews.author: Robert

reviews.title: "Great grill!"
reviews.text: I love the convenience of gas, my boyfriend loves charcoal. Perfect compromise! I will say though that the gas gets very hot, very fast even on low.
reviews.author: Angela

reviews.title: "Awesome buy"
reviews.text: i bought this grill at Lowes during their Memorial Day sale. I waited to the last day and boy was i glad i didn't pass on the deal. I cooked on both gas and charcaol and was amazed on how much quicker it cooked compared to my older seperate grills. The quality is there and maint. seems pretty basic. My grills are kept under a carport so rust is not a big factor. I can see many many years of awesome grilling on this DUO 5050.The only thing i would change is the drip pan and propane tank are to close together. I keep knocking the pan loose when turning gas on and off.
reviews.author: WBC1

reviews.title: "Great value and versatility"
reviews.text: I was tired of having 3 units- gas BBQ, charcoal BBQ and smoker on my deck. I bought this with the optional smoker (it's also a small BBQ) All went together easily (although the fist smoker unit was welded wrong and had to be exchanged). Cooks well in all three modes. My only complaint is that the hole for propane tank is a little small and binds up when you go to replace the tank. In the dry climate of Utah, this should last a good, long time. Gotta go, time to bbq.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Beast of bbq"
reviews.text:
we bought this last month and have been cooking and smoking food daily
people comment on the flavor of food as well
as its impressive style
reviews.author: lilascott

reviews.title: "great grill for the money"
reviews.text: if you want a charcoal grill and a smoker, but also like the ease of cooking on gas, in my opinion for the money you cannot beat it. i am an avid grill er and love to cook on charcoal, but sometimes just want to light the grill and cook because of time. so this grill works great for that. i also love to smoke ribs and chicken and with the add on smoker box it works well for that also. i have owned many grills and smokers and in my opinion this grill cooks well. i keep it on my back porch uncovered, and have had little to no rust issues. i have read all the reviews and agree the construction of some things may not be the best, but it still works and grills good. i have had the grill for 14 mo. now and i grill 1-2 times a week. i have never owned a grill over $300.00 and i seem to replace them every 2-3 years and based on what i see this grill should last that long . if you like to smoke and cook on charcoal and also have the gas grill there for when you are in a hurry i don't think you can go wrong.
reviews.author: smoker1

reviews.title: "Best Grill out there in the Market"
reviews.text: Had a wonderful experience....Great Grill for the family - enjoy the taste of barbeque grilled and smoked. Smoked is definitely for the family while Grilled is for guests. Am enjoying every moment of it.
reviews.author: DesertHwk

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: This is a nice grill.. I find myself using less of the gas side and enjoy cooking over coals as often as i can, but it nice to have the choice in one grill. My only suggestion would be to season this grill well.. there is a lot of residual manufacturing smells at first, so season well.
reviews.author: cspelliott

reviews.title: "Not bad...be wary of bad welds..."
reviews.text: Bought this grill just prior to the Super Bowl. Assembly was fairly easy to do alone. Seems like pretty solid materials. The hang up came during one of the last steps of assembly. While placing the charcoal rack in the grill I noticed it was missing a tab. I wasn't about to return the grill after having assembled it for 2 hours. I'll bend a piece of sheet metal and tack weld it on myself, but the point is it is a simple mistake that should have never passed QC.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Best Grill I Have Ever Used!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"
reviews.text: My fiancée bought me this grill for Valentines Day 2011. I used ti for the first time the other night. Myself not being an expert griller and smoker found this product very easy to use. I also found it very easy to assemble. The instructions recommend 2 people to assemble and if you have another person available I would recommend it but if not I put it together in about 2 hours by myself. So it can be done with one person it takes a little longer bit longer but it can be done. I love this grill!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I will use this grill year round no matter what the weather. I would recommend this product to anyone both gas and charcoal users. I love to use both and this grill is a great way to do that. VERY AWESOME GRILL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Well worth the money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.author: MOBowhunter1976

reviews.title: "Great Grill!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"
reviews.text: Hands down, the best grill I've ever cooked on. On thegas side it is the most even heat of any one of the many (over $ 1,000.00) grills that I have had. It gives you the choice of gas, charcoal or, with the addition of the fire box, a smoker. With both sides going you can cook for a crowd or just the two of us on gas in the evening. Without question, the best grill for the money available today. This review was completely unsolicited.
reviews.author: Stubby

reviews.title: "Best Grille EVER"
reviews.text: In noticing the ongoing kudos - and complaints - of this product, I am glad that I read the reviews THOROUGHLY and then followed the suggestions.First: The price and grilling features of my dual propane/charcoal griller with option for an add-on smoker - these considerations all have made this the best BBQ setup I have ever owned. Past grilles - Weber dome charcoal setup, Hibachi type grill, deluxe stainless multi grill setup. None were as versatile or effective in producing the great barbecue fare as this inexpensive, efficient product. I grill almost every week, year round; even on most rainy days (under a cover).Secondly - complaints about its durability and rusting seem to be from improper use, at least for the most part.There is a series of preventive measures that must be followed. After all, this inexpensive grille is just metal, not metal covered with ceramic. But that makes it much more efficient! Here are the precautions:a) Season the grille thoroughly, inside and out, with a relatively thin coating of vegetable oil. Don't forget to swab the inside of the stacks. The process takes only a few minutes of your time. Run it at half power / half heat for 15 minutes upon first applicaition. Let it cool, do it again.b) NEVER cook with it domed at more than 450 degrees Fahrenheit for more than 5 minutes at a time. Just regulate the heat, or lift the lid after 5 minutes to lower the temperature. It seems like this is where most barbecuers end up with a rusted product. The unit has a temperature gauge on each dome.c) Keep it dry, or wipe it down if it stays out in the rain. Obvious, eh?d) Buy a cover for around $40-55, the one that is custom made for the griller. It even has a velcro gizmo that allows it to pop out and expand for your add-on smoker, should you decide to get one. Use the cover between grillings, waiting (of course) for the unit to cool down completely.e) Season it every two years. I just got through re-seasoning mine. I have had it about 4 years and it still looks pretty much like new.If you follow all of the simple steps above, and you don't have it in an extreme weather area (like perhaps a salty environment by the sea), I can't see any reason why the grill should not last for many years. I live in the center of the hot San Joaquin Valley in California and, other than my cover starting to bleach out and show some tearing from heat rot, my unit is still in superb condition. Yes - I have already purchased a new cover to eventually place the existing one. Cheap insurance, given the very low price point for this unit, in the first place.Another plus - the igniter, after all of this time, still works perfectly. That seems to be the first thing to fail on other grills I have seen and/or used.
reviews.author: JohndeFresno

reviews.title: "So-So Grill It works OK"
reviews.text: Its just not stood up to the test of time, Finish on it wasn't as good as it should of been. Grill still works OK, But looks like we've had it 25 years & We've had it maybe 6 year now.... Bought the covers for it from the start and its under cover anytime we're not using it....
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Dual Function Grill w/ Side Smoker"
reviews.text: I've only had it a couple of weeks and other than the initial seasoning (no big deal - pretty easy), I've only cooked with the gas side. The unit heats up quickly and once I figure out the "hot spots" I'd say it works very well.  Some reviews indicated a concern with rust, I'll adjust my rating in a year or so if that's an issue - I live in upstate NY and grill/smoke all year; I do have a cover that fits (found it at Christmas Tree Shoppe's) over the whole unit - remember I have the side smoker attached so it's longer than what's shown in the product description.
reviews.author: UncleTony

reviews.title: "The best gas and charcoal grille"
reviews.text: I searched all of the gas grilles than I came across this gas and charcoal grille. I thought this one is what I have been looking for. We use our grille about 7 months out of a year; and I need a sturdy and durable grille to hold up to our daily use. We love the option of gas or charcoal grilling. We have used both options and the food cooks perfect. My whole family raves on how well this grille works and how easy it is to use the grille. The food is always cooked just right ; done to perfection and in a short grilling time. The rack below is very handy for storage and I really like the attached spice tray and the holder under the grille for the propane tank. We also keep our grille covered; therfore we have not experienced any rust issues. Finally the cost of the grille minus the promotion offered was a deal that I could not pass up. I am very happy that I purchased this grille. My sons friend helped us put the grille together: assembly was easy and he was so impressed that he went to Lowes the next day and bought the same grille.From: A happy customer
reviews.author: Optimistic

reviews.title: "Love this grill"
reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He likes to cook on charcoal and I like the convenience of gas. I bought the smoker attachment and we both love the end result. Make sure you follow directions on seasoning the grill but you won't be disappointed. Smoking great meals is easy once you get over the initial dilemma of temperature control. LOVE IT!
reviews.author: JLBuffet

reviews.title: "Worth It"
reviews.text: For the price this is a pretty good unit. It was good having both units together was able to cook vegetables on gas and steaks on char. I'm happy so far and cleanup was easy.
reviews.author: Bear

reviews.title: "Great bbq pit"
reviews.text: I love the convenience of being able to choose between gas and charcoal.
reviews.author: Tammy

reviews.title: "Best Buy for combo Gas and Charcoal grill."
reviews.text: Was a little hesatant to buy, concerned about assembly and quality. Assembly was EASY, 7/16 nut driver,small cresant wrench, small hammer, plyers and screw driver is all you need. Instructions are easy to understand and complete. Quality is not bad, for a grill of this price. This grill is very versatile, you can use the gas grill if you are in a hurry, or the charcoal grill if you have the time. They both work great!!!!.I also bought the firebox that goes on the side of the charcoal grill, which is used for smoking ( this is much harder to install,you might need some help). This firebox truly completes this grill,and makes this a truly all in one BBQ. I did my first smoking of meats on this grill and I have big plans and recipes for the smoker.( mouth watering as I write) I can see that will need a little more care than some of the higher end grills. But if kept clean and well maintained,it should last a while. Very Happy with the Chargirller.
reviews.author: 1Mbzdriver

reviews.title: "No bad, not great"
reviews.text: Ive had mine for 4 years now. It was a house warming gift from a friend who also bought himself one, his is fine. Mine has some issues, the porcelain on the grates started to come off while i was cooking food. Had to throw everything away, how that possible i dont know. Mine is rusted throughout with little to moderate use. The heat shields on the gas side rusted thru and the small tabs of metal bracket that hold them are completely rusted gone. I will have to order new grates, heat shields and weld small metal brackets to hold the shields. For a company to claim such Rust control, this grill has not held up. It started right away and has gotten worse and worse regardless of me cleaning and caring for it like a newborn baby.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "A good grill for the price."
reviews.text: The only problem I have is the propain tank does not fit in the area designed to hold the tank.. It does not sit straight in the holder and it is hard to turn off / on.I appreciated the fact that the grill came assembled. However, I had to go back and tighten about half the screws all over the grill. The side burner about fell off.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.text: I am using this now for the second time.
reviews.author: Tim

reviews.title: "Great Grill for the money"
reviews.text: The grill is hard to put together but once it is..hopefully its put together in the place you want, it because it is VERY HEAVY its a great size and grills great I would only recommend having it assembled first. other then that i'm very happy..
reviews.author: trish

reviews.title: "Love at first sight then reality set in."
reviews.text: I bought this 3 years ago from Lowes. Loved it the first year, enjoyed it the second year and threw it out the third year. You will not be able to prevent rust, not just the chassis but the burners also. By the end of the first year the wheels will flatten.
reviews.author: bbqbob

reviews.title: "Do not buy Char Griller"
reviews.text: I bought my Char Griller Duo a little over 1 year ago. I had the smoker box accessory installed on the right end of the grill. This was my 4th grill made by Char Griller. I have had great performance from each of their grills. Each time, I stepped up to a little newer and better model, finally scoring the best of their grills. I even handed down 2 of the grills to my kids. I have been a tried and true Char Griller fan from the first grill. Just over 1 year old, and the bottoms of 2 of the legs have rusted to pieces! They are literally crumbling under the weight of the grill. The other surfaces of this grill have also experienced significant surface rust, but I did not worry too much about that. I live in the same place as I did with my previous grills. I have a concrete patio surface. I faithfully use a Char Griller cover at all times. I haven't done anything different than I did with my other Char Griller grills to cause the premature rust problem. I called Char Griller's customer service department, explained everything, and they were absolutely no help. They welcomed me to purchase replacement parts from them. I did not expect a new grill, but I did expect at least a discount on the replacement parts due to the premature rusting and my customer loyalty. Ironically, I purchased their best and most expensive grill before I began to have problems. This will be the last Char Griller product I will own. Please note that this is not a reflection on the folks at my local Lowes store. They have always been very helpful.
reviews.author: Harvey

reviews.title: "So far so good"
reviews.text: I have had this grill for about two weeks now and have used it about 5-6 times. I love having the option for gas and the charcoal, on the same grill. I have read all the other reviews on here and just picked up the cover and the side firebox today and it has been going for about 4 hours. So far I like it so much I wish I knew how long it would last, because for $199 maybe I should go pick up another one for the future.....
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "The best grill I've ever owned!"
reviews.text: I've had my Duo with the smoker box for three years and look forward to many years of service. I keep it covered when I'm not using it and have no rust at all. The gas end has good heat control. I bought one for my parents and they're loving it too. I know I'll eventually need to buy a part or two over the next several years, but the manufacturer's site is very friendly and offers all parts. I pack the smoker full and have yet to be let down.
reviews.author: oldmills

reviews.title: "Best Purchase I have made!"
reviews.text: I saw this grill during the memorial day weekend sale and after a night of research I bought it the next day. The reviews on it were true and I love this grill. I had always grilled on a cheap 2 burner grill and with the added burner it makes a world of difference. Dont even get me started on the charcoal side, I will never have a steak on gas again. I am in no way second guessing this purchase. I will definitely be adding the side fire box.
reviews.author: Gabe

reviews.title: "worst grill Ive ever had"
reviews.text: When I bought this grill I also purchased the cover. I used the propane side once, maybe twice. I used the charcole side all the time. The bottom of the propane side is so rusted I wouldnt even want to cook something on it. The outside is fine. But the inside of both is horriable. I called customer service and they said I was supposed put veg / cooking oil on it to prevent rusting and some rusting was normal. I will be tossing this grill and getting something else this year. I wouldnt recommend this grill for anyone.
reviews.author: Justin

reviews.title: "Great features, and easy to use."
reviews.text: I had been keeping an eye on this grill for a year or so. I finally made the purchase, and afterand hour of putting it together, using thread-locker on all the bolts, we were on our way to agrilled dinner and seasoning.A couple of months later, we are still grilling, and couldn't be happier. Very easy to use, nothing has broken, or fallen off. We removed the second grate from the charcoal side, we needed the room for chickens, turkey, etc. We also added lava rock to the bottom on the propane side. It maintains heat well, and is predictable when it comes to added charcoal, and achieving the desired heat. We keep a thermometer on the grate to measure the heat there, and it is consistent from front to back, left to right.A few things to note, it is HEAVY, especially with the propane, and a couple extra bags of charcoal on the rack. the burner grate could be a little bigger, but never gave us a problem, just would be nice. Also, the top of the propane tank is close to the drip pan, and leaves little clearance to turn in on and off.there a much better built grills on the market, but for the price this is a great value, not to mention you get two for the price of one.
reviews.author: MJM

reviews.title: "I love it!!!"
reviews.text: I have had the duo grill well over 2 years now. I use it year round (in GA) at least 3 times a week and it is fantastic. With the side firebox and side stove, the versatility of this grill is boundless. There is hardly anything you can't cook , slow cook or smoke with it..I keep mine uncovered but under a patio roof , I have no rust issues at all except some surface rust on the side firebox- no big deal..When i first got grill, I sprayed the whole inside with cooking oil and started grill with lid down to season it and I keep tin cans over the chimneys so no premature rust problems.The gas side has pretty even heat distribution, better than any other grill i have ever had.I did have to replace the gas side drip covers over the 3 burners once with universal ones from Lowe's- but that is normal maintenance. I even bolted on a 2 x 12 butcher block counter the entire length of the grill that just adds the perfect final touch of prep workspace to a perfect grill....This grill should last a long time and when it does wear out, I will buy another one just like it!!!!!
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "I'ld buy another"
reviews.text: I have the 5050 plus the smoker attachment, and rotisserie. hardley use the propane side lol I use the smoker the most a little tricky getting vents set right for both heat and smoke but once you get it set it works great, metal is a nice thickness, not thin tin like most grills, keep it covered when not in use should last a long time, they need to work on the rotisserie supports and counter weight though, whne you buy rotisserie and extra parts to cover both sides 1 support is longer than the other that is the support you need at center and smoker end, but you only get 1, and the extra support you order is not the longer one lol, and as for the counterweight it's too long and sits on top of the smoker kinda defeats it's purpose.
reviews.author: john1163b

reviews.title: "Throw away bbq"
reviews.text: This bbq is great in concept, but the quality is terrible. After one year of use, it has widespread rust, paint is peeling, and the ignitor is failing. The grill is covered all the time with a Char-Broil cover (which is ripping at the seams after only a year of use). Don't waste you money on this grill. You'll just be paying again in a few years.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Good product"
reviews.text: I have had one of these for 2-3 years and very happy with it; that's why I bought one for my girlfriend and her son. Product showed up missing 4 screws from the legs and missing one foot cap and the other cracked.
reviews.author: None

reviews.title: "Has lived up to my grilling/smoking needs"
reviews.text: I've had this Duo Grill for 3 summers now, and it's what I need for doing quicker meals on the gas grill side and for the feasts I like to do on the smoking side. The Gas side has enough surface area for me to cook multiple items, which is great when I have family/guests over. I did spend extra to get the side box, because I need the full grate area when I do multiple racks of ribs. I've also been able to smoke a whole turkey for Thanksgiving the last 2 years (which my family loves). The key to it all is like many have said, keep treating it with oil at least once a season and cleaning it regularly. (I'm in the Bay Area of California). The Char-Griller cover that I bought separately, just ripped in year 3. I haven't decided if i'm going to buy another, or look into something more heavy duty like a tarp and wrap it with rope/bungy cord at the bottom.
reviews.author: BBQ-D

reviews.title: "Good while it Lasts"
reviews.text: Like the grill when new but rusts out and falls apart after a couple of years.
reviews.author: Jimmy

reviews.title: "Great combo grill"
reviews.text: Bought this grill for my daughters birthday, we put it together, pretty easy assembly, cured it then two days later we grilled some steak and shrimp and I have to say it works great. My daughter loves it as she works some tuff hours and it allows her to grill with propane when she's short on time but when she has time she really likes the charcoal side and will probably add the smoker box in the future. Great product in my opinion.
reviews.author: Griz

reviews.title: "Good grill don't get the rotisserie."
reviews.text: Just to clarify upfront, for straight barbecuing I love this grill.  When I bought mine I got all the accessories. When I attached the smoker on the sidedge I had to shorten the spacers to make it sit level.  I also got the rotisserie. Now I thought I was buying a rotisserie specifically for this barbecue. Lowe's did not have it in stock so I had to wait for it to show up at my house. It did not take to long but what I got is a chargriller universal rotisserie. The tabs in the lid were not easily removed and to use the rotisserie for a regular sized chicken you must take out the center burner cover. Then the rotisserie itself is not well built. Overall made me want to give the whole thing 1 star but reminded myself as a barbecue I do like it.  Just don't get the accessories.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Love it!"
reviews.text: I've actually only used this for a little over a week, so i don't know much about the durability of it, but I LOVE IT! I followed the instructions for seasoning, and then have used the gas side several times for quick meals during the week, and then for Easter Sunday, I baked a whole chicken on the gas side and smoked a ham on the charcoal side for Easter dinner! I am so excited to use this grill every day!! And the fact that I got it for $199 - $100 off on sale - with free Lowe's truck delivery (ordered it at 10pm on a Saturday night and had it at my house by 9am on Sunday!!) just makes it that much sweeter! My husband, who hates all facets of cooking...even grilling...just told me that he wants to handle doing the grilling every night now! haha!I super suggest this grill to anyone who loves grilled food. And I have been suggesting to everyone. :) Enjoy!
reviews.author: Paxton Wife

reviews.title: "Great Grilling tool"
reviews.text: I bought one at Lowe's 7 years ago for the same price and this the only grill I would ever buy. I have smoked, grilled every meat, vegetable that you could imagine and I have 0 complants.
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "A great grill!"
reviews.text: I love that I have a choice when I'm ready to grill. The gas component is very easy to use and I love that you can use both gas and charcoal at the same time for big cookouts!
reviews.author: julieben

reviews.title: "Great grill"
reviews.text: This was a father's day gift for my dad. He needed a new one and wanted the combo. We put it together, assembly was no problem.  He uses it almost every week. Great grill.
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "Expect to continually replace parts on this one"
reviews.text: We have had this grill for about 5 years, I caught it on sale for a Black Friday even for $200, regularly $399.00 at the time.  Today's current price is $249.  If you purchase on make sure you register it, MAYBE you can get some parts under warranty, I could not.  What you can expect is that the igniters will go out first (2-3 months), the burners are next (based on use, mine lasted less than one winter with weekly grilling), the drip pan and grease catcher were next and finally the duo bottom shelf.NOW, I can order all of these replacement parts (I currently have them in the cart of the Char-Griller website) for $140 plus tax and shipping, rebuild the grill and get another 1.5 years out of the burners or I can spend $250 or more on a new grill.Gas grill gets ZERO Stars!HEY! On the bright side, the charcoal side has been solid.  Charcoal grill gets 2 Stars.
reviews.author: Wayne

reviews.title: "Why didn't someone come up with this sooner"
reviews.text: Great concept, must have grill for the summer. i love using the gas for weekdays and charcoal on weekends
reviews.author: RYan

reviews.title: "From fast & easy to low & slow"
reviews.text: This is the best of both worlds. I have been a staunch charcoal fire only griller for most of my life but having young kids makes the time factor of charcoal a bit out of reach sometimes. In those times it is nice to be able to throw something quick on the gas side and be done, but I can still hold on to my charcoal roots when time is available. I've used the charcoal side for everything from high-temp quick steaks to all day pork butt smoking. The gas side has good even temp. And the burner/chimney lighter makes the charcoal side easy to get going.
reviews.author: Charcoal Diehard Wannabe

reviews.title: "A Piece of Junk"
reviews.text: Do not buy this piece of junk!!! Had mine for less than a year and a half when the gas grill sides bottom rusted completely out along with portions of the legs. Gave them a chance to make it right but they declined to take responsibility.
reviews.author: Bruce1156

reviews.title: "Great for roasting turkey!"
reviews.text: All the staff was helpful. Tried to sell me the product already put together (for my convenience). I ordered on-line and it was ready for pickup within the hour.
reviews.author: PattyD

reviews.title: "Best Purchase ever"
reviews.text: I love this barbeque pit. It is easy to use and easy to clean. This is the best barbeque pit I have ever purchased. You have the choice to use gas or charcoal.
reviews.author: putatat

reviews.title: "Best grill I've ever owned"
reviews.text: This grill is great! It is very well built. If you are used to a stainless steel grill, I recommend reading the owner's manual before you start grilling. The regular care for this grill is very different than that of a stainless.
reviews.author: CHSDK

reviews.title: "Great grill for the money"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for the reason of having the best of both worlds. It has both charcoal and propane chambers. I looked at the same type of grill at several places and found this grill to be more rugged than all others I looked at. What happened to the time when you would get the propane tank with the grill? I have used the grill several times and it works great. I would definitely recommend this grill to my friends.
reviews.author: Ernie

reviews.title: "Not half bad, but almost"
reviews.text: I used this regularly and stored it under a cover when not in use. The igniter switch went right after the warranty ran out. Then, the grill racks started corroding and the coating began chipping off of them. Then the burner covers on the gas side began corroding and the hook points on which they hang above the burners themselves, rusted away and I need to use sheet metal screws to support the new covers I had to buy on Amazon.  I also rplaced the grill racks but that didn't last long. Then the warming rack decayed to nothing.  Then the entire bottom of the gas side rusted out and I had to use a piece of sheet aluminum across the bottom to keep the heat in the cook area so things would cook at all. All this time, I had no problems and rather liked the charcoal side the way the coal rack adjusted up and down to adjust heat, though those grill racks also corroded.  All of this in 4 years use. I bought a new Weber gas grill and did a chop and Frankenstein job on the charcoal side to make that useable and discarded the gas portion of this Char-Griller completely.  I wouldn't recommend this, even though it seems like a good idea.
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "This is the best grill I've purchased"
reviews.text: The grill is an excellent buy over the typical gas or charcoal grill, Sometimes you wan t quick and clean and then some entrees are netter slowly smoked witha little elbow grease to get the fires burning. I assembeled the gril in approx. 1 1/2 hrs due to the manual script for assembly was too vague in some areas and the parts are not labeled to correspond withthe manual. Other than that I'm pleased with this purchase
reviews.author: Statulee

reviews.title: "Very nice double fuel grill"
reviews.text: This grill has replaced an old portable gas grill and a weber kettle. Having both cooking options in the same unit has made otherwise complicated cooking chores so much easier. The only thing I have noticed is that it is very hard to move due to the weight. My suggestion would be to put casters on the one end instead of stationary legs so it is easier to wheel around as needed. Otherwise, it is an excellent product.
reviews.author: JT61

reviews.title: "Started ok but ended up a rust bucket."
reviews.text: The grill worked fine at start,but even with clean up and a cover, the grill slowly rusted. Great for couple years but don't expect any longevity.
reviews.author: Tom

reviews.title: "Owned for 3 years now - great grill -well worth it"
reviews.text: This is an excellent grill and the first one of many I've purchased that has lasted this long without falling apart which includes many more expensive grills.  At 3 years, there is little if any rust.  The starter for the gas grill stopped working a while ago, but it could be batteries and I don't really use the gas grill much so when I do, I can light it with a lighter easily.  I use the charcoal side mostly and use the side burner to light a charcoal chimney to expedite the fire.  I keep it covered and am about to go get my 3rd cover (they fade early, but help prolong the grill life).  Grills well, has good smoke.  Like most things, if you don't empty the grease catchers from water, etc - it probably will rust.  Mine hasn't rusted yet.
reviews.author: cp

reviews.title: "Great Value"
reviews.text: The only problem I encountered is the Gas Bottle Holder. The access is restricted and the bottle does not want to come out once in place.
reviews.author: Friendly

reviews.title: "Good grill/love the convenience"
reviews.text: I liked the convenience of having gas or charcoal but the gas side rusted out even on a covered porch. Had it for 4 years and only replaced the burner covers and grates. The side burner for the pans was great to have, saved space on the grill if you wanted to make your side dish while grilling the steaks. I live in southeast Texas/Gulf coast where high humidity is the norm so steel rusts. Hated to put it out but the gas side was rusted and falling off the cart and unsafe. Only real con I can say is this thing is heavy having 2 grills on one cart.
reviews.author: Love2grill

reviews.title: "Nice Grill"
reviews.text: Have had this grill a little over two years. Cooks very well, not a top of the line Weber but does a nice job. We have it at our weekend cabin, gets used about fifty times a year. It's kept outside with the OEM cover, the covers grey up pretty quick. We only get about a season out of the covers but we are on a mountain top with some heavy wind. Liked the dual use feature and heavy construction. Was a little worried about rust out reviews but am glad to say not a problem with ours. This thing looks almost new, would buy another tomorrow if needed.
reviews.author: MARK

reviews.title: "JUST Get THE SMOKER"
reviews.text: The gas side rusted away in 16 months..there is nothing left in the bottom or rear of my gas grill shell.the heat plates lasted about 1 yr..which is normal. But for the whole shell to rust away is a sign of too thin + inferior metal.I grill about 2-3 times a week and use the side burner almost daily for my sear and saute, so as to not stink up my kitchen.Even with a cover (of which i recently bought a 2nd) the grill just rusted away from the heat of cooking combined with the florida Humidity.Smoker side is in OK condition as well as the fire box which I added...the Fire box has about a yr left int and BTW is a heavier gauge than the smoker and grill shell. Side burner is fine..Gas grill simply is not up to standards. Go buy a nice stainless steel grill and heavier gauge smoker.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: Great grill for the price. Nice to be able to use gas for quick meals and charcoal when you want that taste or have the time.
reviews.author: Missy

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: We have really enjoyed our grill. We love the fact that we can cook with charcoal or gas. The gas feature comes in handy when you're in a hurry to get the cooking done. The price was reasonable (we caught it on sale). We definitely recommend this grill.
reviews.author: ChrisM

reviews.title: "Great&FAWESOME"
reviews.text: i got this grill on sale for 199.95 and it was the best deal I have ever got. grill works great and it came pre assembled
reviews.author: JEJ

reviews.title: "Worst grill I have ever owned"
reviews.text: Absolutely do not waste your money on this. I have owned mine for a year now and the gas side is worthless. We grill quite often and clean it often as well. The gas grill on low will flame up a bunch. This grill totally engulfed in flames one night.
reviews.author: Nate

reviews.title: "Awesome Product!!!"
reviews.text: This grill has become the answer to my outdoor cooking needs. It allows me to cook with gas, charcoal, and I even purchased the optional fire box for smoking. Simply put, the versitility cannot be beat. We are really enjoying this grill...
reviews.author: twomacstrucking

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: Received this grill as my Father's Day gift early enough to put it together and use it for a family gathering on the day itself. Assembly was simple, although the directions could use a little extra effort. The grill is made of quality materials and works like a champ. Cooks evenly on the gas side, and the charcoal side does everything you'd want it to. Would definitely recommend this grill to anyone.
reviews.author: Daddy

reviews.title: "Good grill"
reviews.text: Love the grill. Just hard to find a quality cover for it because I have the smoker attachment.
reviews.author: Chillin and grillin

reviews.title: "Works Well"
reviews.text: Weak points are frame work not very strong, and two of the grates were broken during shipping.
reviews.author: painterAJ

reviews.title: "Good Grill For the $"
reviews.text: I got this as a fathersday present two years ago and it works great but the knobs had to be replaced a few times already due to the plastic knob cracking.Grates rust quickly if you don't coat them with spray after they cool off each time. I use it almost 365 days a year and I usually have to buy a new one every other year. This one looks like it may go three. For the $ it's still a good combo grill.
reviews.author: Jerry

reviews.title: "Best grill ever"
reviews.text: this grill is very easy to use, I cooks great, and overall the best grill I have ever had
reviews.author: Brad

reviews.title: "Best of both worlds"
reviews.text: I was happy with the charcoal/smoker grill with this brand a few years ago and went for the combo for a $199 special a few weeks ago. Both sides of this work extremely well, with the charcoal contained in a separate height adjustable tray, and the gas side cooks as well as a weber.This is a large grill, and it will take about 2 hours to put together properly. I did it myself, but get a friend. And condition the grill as the instructions illustrate. This is a heavy unit and should last for a long time. The steaks, hamburger, chicken, and pork chops I cooked so far have turned out great. No hot spots on the gas side that I've found. Charcoal side cooks pretty hot, so it takes less coals (use real wood charcoal).I cook outdoors at least 3 times per week, and am extremely satisfied not only with the grill, but with the value!One note - don't go for the cover, it is made of cheap material and will not last a season. Just buy an oversize heavy duty cover and you will be good. Cheers!
reviews.author: vintoni

reviews.title: "duo s-5050 gas and charcoal grill"
reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together. We love it!! It was to be a Christmas gift, however he was determined to go buy a grill. Therefore Merry Christmas early. I guess it was better to put together in October than December.
reviews.author: Neana

reviews.title: "Great Birthday Gift"
reviews.text: What a surprise a grill with gas and charcoal everything a bbq KIng could need
reviews.author: ACK Swordfish

reviews.title: "good for the money"
reviews.text: I bought this grill 3 years ago, but need new one now, the internal heat dispersers over the burners have disingrated ,also the grill cover got ripped off during a thunderstorm the first year I bought it not very durable, the electronic ignition quit working the second year so I used a lighter the past year and a half, but I do like that you get both charcoal and gas grillers combined. And I do cook year round even in cold winters in WV. For the price you cant go wrong. 3 years max if it sits outside year round, I'm on my way for another :)
reviews.author: cooker

reviews.title: "TOOOO HOTTTT !!!!!"
reviews.text: Purchased a year or so ago, propane side gets way too hot way too fast, just the other day i fired it up and it got so hot so quick that it burnt the paint off half of grill! The regulator should be adjustable or reduced at the factory. I have started seeing rust but with a little cleaning and some high temp paint the rust can be somewhat controlled.My biggest complaint is excessive heat tho.
reviews.author: Jason

reviews.title: "Great grill but not flawless."
reviews.text: This is a great grill for a user that wants flexibility of gas and coal. Here are my evaluations:Pros:Gas, charcoal and side burner!Sturdy design.Can use as a smoker.Adjust height of charcoal.Cons:Spacing for propane tank is poor!Handles for charcoal height adjustment easily come off during cooking.Make sure you prep the grill before you cook per the instructions or it will rust.
reviews.author: Joe Schmo

reviews.title: "Recieved as a gift"
reviews.text: A little tough to put together, but well worth it when done.
reviews.author: Hairgolf

reviews.title: "Duo S-5050 Black Gas and Charcoal grill"
reviews.text: Brought this as a birthday gift for my husband back in the first week of April when it was on sale for $199.00. It was a great investment especially for that price. My husband loves it. We can cook both ways and everybody is happy. He loves that it is easy charcoal removal and cleaning. I am so glad I brought it for him. Now my son in law wants one. I guess we will be buying him one soon.
reviews.author: Monica

reviews.title: "We Love This Grill"
reviews.text:
The Hubs bought this grill, with the side-box smoker, for Christmas several years ago. It sat in the garage, in the box, for more than a year. He finished building the pergola over our patio, and we finally put the grill to use. The Hubs did most of the assembly work himself, enlisting my help to move it and with those actions that required three hands. 

We love it! We've smoked chickens, and I'm fixing to smoke my first brisket this weekend. We grill everything from asparagus to pizza.

Using the side burner to light coals in a chimney means the coals are ready to go before the meat is at room temperature. We use the gas side less often than I thought we would. It can be tricky to get the gas side to stay at a certain temperature; if that's what you want, keep an eye on it until you learn exactly where to set the knobs & the vents to get the temperature you want. 

We haven't had any rust issues, even though we leave the grill out year-round. We live in a very dry climate; we average 8" of precipitation a year, and our climate is similar to a high desert -- hot in the summer, cold in the winter. I've noticed many of the complaints about rust are written by people who live in places I think of as being really humid. I bought a cover for a stand-alone swing to use to cover this in the winter. It's heavy duck cloth, so it vents better than the plastic ones, and it'll stand up to our frequent hurricane-force winds. It's too big for the grill, but it completely covers it. 

There's an upper rack that appears to be designed to hold buns. I'm not crazy about the way it attaches to the lid of the grill. In order to remove it, which I have to do to smoke or roast chickens upright, I have to unscrew the bolts that attach it to the lid. If I've forgotten - which I am wont to do - it means I have to wrangle those bolts while they're hot. Given the light-duty nature of the shelf, it could have been designed to lift off the bolts instead. That would make it much easier!

This grill is huge. Be prepared to design around it. Also, if you attach the side-box smoker, you lose the easiest way to grab ahold of the grill if you want to move it. My solution? A 4' long 1" dowel underneath the body of the charcoal grill side - NOT the side-box - near the legs. 

For the price, this grill can't be beat. At some point in the future, we may "trade up" to a better grill. This grill has a lightweight feel to it. But given that it's worked well for the last two summers, and given our dry climate, I can easily envision this thing lasting a decade or so. And, as others have noted, some steel wool and a can of grill paint will do wonders.
reviews.author: HillSlug98239

reviews.title: "WORST, MOST EXPENSIVE GRILL CHOICE EVER!  MISTAKE!"
reviews.text: I bought the version of this grill. It was purchased in 2016 directly from Lowes store in Alabama as a surprise Father's Day gift for my husband. This is a piece of junk, period. This is nothing but a rust bucket! We even purchased TWO of the covers, which are not cheap, price wise, but beware of 'weather resistant' covers, as rain will still seep through! For nearly $40, it SHOULD NOT! This is not really a cheaply priced grill either. It lasted, barely, for two whole years. Initially we loved it, but just were naive about the quality then. We're NOT happy. This is the worst grill we've ever owned. Unless you're willing to pull it into your garage every time you use it, in an effort to keep moisture & humidity away from it, it WILL RUST! The side that rusted away, and I'm talking about the body, as well as the screws/nuts etc. was the propane side. I went to try to replace the burner tubes, tent covers, and grill plates, and they were rusted through the body of the grill, which I didn't realize until I began working on it. So I'd wasted more money buying the replacement parts. AND it will probably rust anyway, you just MIGHT get one more year out of it. We'll never buy another one. We'll be buying something else for next spring!
reviews.author: epw

reviews.title: "BUY THIS GRILL"
reviews.text: I receved the Duo grill for christmas and cant wait to use it! I already want the fire box! this thing is massive and easy to put together ( I only had myself) so it can be done! the overall sturdy-ness is really good and this is a compairable to the leading brand at a competive store and its made in the USA enough said as long as you season the inside and out side of grill this thing will last !
reviews.author: Tommyo

reviews.title: "Made cheaply"
reviews.text: The gas side of the grill will rust out after 1 year. I kept mine under cover and after 2 years the gas side completely fell apart. I spent $100 purchasing replacement parts since I really like the design but when it rust this next time I'll be done with Chargriller. It's a shame as using better metal in the drum would solve this problem. I'd pay more for a better built product. Some of the after market parts I purchased are stainless steel and are holding up better after I rebuilt in July 2017. But the bottom drum is going fast. Cheap!
reviews.author: Eric

reviews.title: "Decent Quality"
reviews.text: Have now had this grill for over 5 yrs. It has never failed us. Also have smoker attached too. Does make it even heavier.  For the size it does need to have 2 more 4 inch wheels. But the extra 2 need to have swivels.  I am replacing mine with a new one. The bolts do wear out. I pull mine out onto a gravel driveway.  Have always covered it or had it in the garage. ZERO rust!!!! But you also have to do maint to an item like this. Most that are having rust problems, dont cover them and dont have a place to store them and aren't maintenancing them like they should. Everything is designed to only last so long now days. The grill does do and amazing job cooking on gas, coal or smoking!!!!!!! It does get used at least 2xs a week over the course of the year.
reviews.author: Frosty

reviews.title: "well thought out design"
reviews.text: I have grilled more this summer then ever before the versatility of this grill is awesome. Depending on how much time you have you can either use the propane or start the coals. I especially like that the coal starter fits over the burner for a quick start up of the coals. I wish that Lowes would have had the smoker attachment available but I plan to have that for next season.
reviews.author: Cutty

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: JP

reviews.title: "Awesome grill"
reviews.text: I've had this grill for 2 years now, out in the open, and it's held up well. Granted it's Los Angeles, but we still get our rainy season. The cast iron barrels are pretty thick... much thicker than similarly styled grills sold at the "other guys". In general the grill is very sturdy. The porcelain coated grills are good, but they can scratch (as I would imagine any porcelain grill does) and rust can form in the scratches. If you keep your grill clean though it's not a big problem. The thermometers are accurate. The debris catch tray under the gas side is a little hard to clean (not the grease tray...that slides out, but the larger tray that funnels the grease and debris to the trap) because it's not really accessible. I do most of my cooking on the charcoal side, but love the gas option for when we need to get something done quick, or when charcoal wouldn't really matter (e.g. hot dogs). The side burner comes in handy for sauteed onions and the like. We also deep-fry on it so that the house doesn't stink!I added the side firebox and love smoking, although I don't do it that often because of the time commitment. Great little unit! It does make the whole thing harder to move though because it restricts your ability to lift that side of the grill (you don't wanna put much force on the side-box itself, so end up trying to reach around it... really you need 2 people if you don't want to hurt your back).All-in-all I thought this grill was a steal at $299... at the current price it's a no-brainer. If I had use for another I'd buy one for sure.
reviews.author: toppaD

reviews.title: "Originally a good purchase."
reviews.text: After about three years of use, the control knobs cracked and would no longer work and the heat shields over the burners on the gas side rusted out. If the heat shields were constructed of stainless steel they would last longer and if the knobs were made of more durable material or made of metal, they wouldn't fail so quickly.
reviews.author: Grillerpro

reviews.title: "there is a reason its $299"
reviews.text: First don't buy a fillet for your first use...you WILL burn it. This grill is hot and there is no way around it (the gas side that is). This is a brilliant idea in general, however if they would use a little higher grade in the overall construction of the grill boxes and especially the actual grill grates on the gas side, it would last even longer. I have owned this for 1 full year/grilling season and I need to purchase new grill grates for the gas side as the gas side gets so hot it has burnt off the ceramic coating on the center of the gas grates. If you do buy this grill be sure to always sear on the same side of the grill and then turn the middle off and outside burners on low (cooking your meat indirectly in the center), this allows you to keep the heat around 350-400, otherwise the box stays above 500 and flare ups will ruin your experience. Also, think of a way to change the "bolts" on the upper rack so the upper racks come off easy...there is absolutely no way to do a beer butt chicken as the overall height of the chicken on end is too high to close the grill lids on either side without hitting the upper grills in each lid...quick modification or removal all together will solve this.For the money and for someone who knows grilling, go for it...you can make this work. For those that don't know how to grill, start cool and work up to a more refined heat! Definitely worth the money for the convenience. (if this gets to Char Grill Co...PLEASE DON'T GLUE THE AD SHEETS ON THE FRONT OF THE BARRELs, THIS IS TACKEY AND DOESN'T JUST "WIPE OFF AFTER FIRST USE WHILE HOT"...)
reviews.author: Bigsmooth, WA

reviews.title: "Convenience!"
reviews.text: When I started thinking about adding a charcoal grill to the back patio, I immediately pictured a separate grill sitting beside the current gas grill with a separate cover or having to wheel it in and out of the garage each time for cooking. As I was shopping for charcoal grills, I ran into the dual grill concept. There are only a few of these in the market, so choices are limited. For the price, this grill provides the convenience of one grill, one cover and the ability to put your charcoal chimney on the side burner for lighting. This feature alone is worth the price of admission as charcoal prep has never been quicker or easier. Don't expect the quality of a more expensive stainless steel unit, but it does the job just as well with the convenience of two grills in one. I have had the grill for two months and have used the charcoal side 5 times and the gas side twice. Buy some spray vegetable oil to fend off rust.
reviews.author: InYourGrill

reviews.title: "Are these real reviews???"
reviews.text: I got this grill in May and have read the reviews. Some like it and some don't.My main problem is with rust, was rusty when delivered by Lows. I cleaned and broke in as said by instructions. I keep this covered and after 5 months the gas side is rusted and flakings and just a mess. I liked the design and having both is great but not pleased with the quaiity at all.
reviews.author: Bubba_va

reviews.title: "Great grill for a large group"
reviews.text: We regularly grill for 12 - 17 people and this grill has LOTS of real estate. I love being able to use the charcoal when I want to, or quickly heat up the gas side if I want something faster. It is well built and easy to use and clean. I love how the side burner is perfect size for my charcoal chimney which allows me to get those going without the paper I used to use.
reviews.author: Randy

reviews.title: "Best of all worlds"
reviews.text: This grill puts in some amazing features. The side burner also acts as a perfect charcoal starter. If you don't know what this means it basically means that a charcoal chimney fits perfectly in it. Most grills it'll sit on top like nothing but with this one it meant for it and it looks great. It doesn't look to bad and I haven't had much returns on them. Its rugged and pure metal. To me that is amazing it doesn't get much better then that on a grill. I mean for 299$ and on sale it can come down close to 200$ no one can beat this. For both worlds and so much cooking space. I mean its no Webber or Broil-King. Yet it shouldn't be. Many companies make the whole charcoal and gas grills but truthfully this one I think is best. If you plan on grilling a lot like me|(year round multiple times a week minimum). Get a extended converge on it and save a few bucks because things will start to go on it if you use a lot without a cover.
reviews.author: Kyle

reviews.title: "Good value for the money"
reviews.text: I inherited mine from my brother in law who moved and could not accomodate size. It has stayed outside with no cover for four years. Nothing other than screw heads have rusted. I will say that the tires are not suitable and should be replaced immediately with heavier duty ones. It has performed beyond my expectations. I have not encountered any major problems.
reviews.author: thefarmer

reviews.title: "Best of Both Grilling Worlds"
reviews.text: Perfect grill for the patio....and love that I can grill with gas or charcoal if I prefer.....the assembly was a bit overwhelming, but was all done with the help of dad and a few hours of patient instruction reading!!! The only complaint I have is that it was ordered with "free assembly", was sent a message it was ready for pick up and when I got to the store, it wasn't, and the Lowe's staff, especially the manager at the Summerlin store here in Vegas were extremely rude, didn't own it was there screw up, and then because I complained they made me wait another 25 minutes to bring the box out to the truck I had borrowed to pick up the grill. Usually I love Lowes and their staff, but was VERY DISAPPOINTED in the LACK OF CUSTOMER SERVICE during this visit :(
reviews.author: NRVegas

reviews.title: "Best yet"
reviews.text: This is my second CharGriller Duo (Charcoal / Gas) grill. I had the first one for three years and they made some really nice improvements on this one, like a "slide out tray for cleaning" is really nice vs the fix tray which was almost impossible to get to. Having the option of Charcoal or gas is really fantastic. I slow charcoal ribs on the weekends and during the week I can fire up the gas for a fast steak after work.The only problem is the bracket on the tank side is too low to hook up the LP tank, and the valve hoses are to short to go around the front. I had to move the bracket up (bottom bracket bolt is now in the top hole). By moving the bracket up I cannot slide out the clean out tray without removing the bracket. I called the company and I am sending them pictures etc.for their review. Yes that is another thing I like .. some real person answers the telephone when you call.Keep up the good work. Love the grill.
reviews.author: Kenneth

reviews.title: "LOVE THIS"
reviews.text: We purchased this item about 6 months ago. We absolutely LOVE it. It is not hard to assemble as I did it all by myself, I took my time. My Beloved could not believe I got it all correct! He was suprised! Grilling is easy and fun on this grill and it gives you the option to use charcol or gas, which is fabulous. I would highly recommend this grill to everyone!
reviews.author: Julieto41

reviews.title: "What a Grill!"
reviews.text: Bought this on sale for $199, also purchased the smoker box and cover, what a deal, all for the original price of the grill.. Assembled by myself in about 2 1/2 hours. You must follow the owners manual and spray the entire inside with vegetable oil, which will help the grill from rusting, as it's made of steel. First time using the smoker made the best ribs I've ever made. One of the porcelain grates had a chip in it and 2 dents in one of the hoods, one email to Char-Griller and new ones were on their way. Very happy with both the the grill and the service from the manufacturer. Having the option of gas or charcoal depending on time is great. Plenty of room for everything. Side burner for that pan of whatever is very handy. Works great with a charcoal chimney for starting the charcoal, 2 minutes and good to go.
