If you've thought about this grill, it's a great bargain, but remember what it is and what it's made of. I'm sure I'll have many years of great BBQing ahead.
reviews.author: Elbill

reviews.title: "Second One I've purchased"
reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought since the last one died on us. It was almost 5 years old and we definitely could have taken better care of it. We didn't cover it too often and certainly didn't keep it seasoned and clean. But all in all for the price we paid, we got 4 or 5 good years out of it before it completely rusted out and literally started falling apart. We bought the smoker attachment for the new one and seasoned it this weekend. It works wonderfully and can even be detached to use on its own for camping or tailgating.
reviews.author: marajade

reviews.title: "Great grill for the price"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill 1-yr ago pre-assembled and delivered from Lowe's. I actually use the charcoal side more often than the gas, but love the versatility. The side burner is great for starting the charcoal in a charcoal chimney. I seasoned the grill as directed in the instructions using a couple cans of vegetable oil spray. I also purchased the custom grill cover which is very durable in my high wind area. Slow cooked some awesome ribs using indirect heat on the charcoal side with a water pan under the ribs. I put some crumpled up foil in the vents to help slow the coals down a bit. It does pull in a lot of air around the lid when closed. Foil on the seams can help fix this. It's a great grill. So much so that my neighbor went out and got one for himself.
reviews.author: Ospreymd

reviews.title: "Awesome grill"
reviews.text: We love this grill but it's huge! It's wonderful to have the option of using gas or charcoal and it heats up really quickly.
reviews.author: Zeke's Mom

reviews.title: "materials"
reviews.text: quality is veru good, but I would pay extra foe a stainless steel model
reviews.author: pcrose

reviews.title: "Great while it lasted"
reviews.text: I'll keep it short and to the point. The grill is awesome in design, however price vs quality isn't. I prepped this grill probably better than recommended, cleaned it after every use (while it was feasible) and kept it covered with their high dollar custom fit grill cover and the thing lasted just over a year.The side burner is about to fall off from rusting through.The cooking grates lasted about 8 grillings before the coating started flaking off and the grates started rusting.The lids are starting to rust uncontrollably despite keeping them well coated with cooking oil.The only part of the grill holding up is the frame and oddly enough the bottom halves of the grill itself. That might be because I lined them with heavy duty aluminum foil.Here's the kicker. Go price the replacement parts for this grill. The cooking grates cost $40+ EACH, the flame shields cost $26+ EACH and the top cooking racks aren't cheap either.Knowing what I know now about this grill, I would just buy separate grills of lesser cost and spare myself the heartache of having to chunk a $300 grill after only a little over a years use.BTW, the little side smoker, not worth it either (IMO).
reviews.author: McSkillet

reviews.title: "Fantastic Grill!"
reviews.text: Fantastic Grill! I bought it for my fiance for his birthday and he loves it, says it is everything he could ever want in a grill: gas side for cook outs, charcoal side for lazy afternoons, and a burner for cooking side dishes. The only complaint he has is that the cooking grid is not a non-stick surface, so food easily sticks and is difficult to clean.
reviews.author: Museum Lady

reviews.title: "Good Value, fun to use"
reviews.text: Easily assembled with good instructions, and all parts were there, they fit and worked from the start. Good design for the charcoal to easily lift or lower the coals when hot. The gas grill heats up very quickly, which reduces gas cost. My only problem with this unit is that turning off the gas when done, your hand hits the drip tray which can be hot.
reviews.author: bisjoe

reviews.title: "Don't buy"
reviews.text: Paint peeled off and same day I put it together for a BBQ..
reviews.author: Joejoe

reviews.title: "2 grills, same problems"
reviews.text: I got my first one for father's day a few years back. I got a cover and a smoke box to go with it. Within 2 years the inside was rusting so bad that the drip shields above the flames rusted to the point that I had to make my own. Then the igniter goes. Then every other time I do light it with a match the grill seems like it's getting 5% of all the propane. Tank is full. Try cooking dinner on 100 degrees. Not fun. Charcoal part is fine because it's charcoal. I was dumb and got the same model 2 years ago. Figured I did something wrong. Sprayed high heat protective spray in every corner I could. Still rusts, still gives out little heat with a full tank of propane, still having my drip shield rusted. Just waiting for the igniter to go so I can go buy a good grill
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "When & if this grill completly rusts out I will buy the DUO"
reviews.text: We have the DUO 5050 and added the side fire box 22424 to it to create a great smoker. We have had our grill for over 8 years. Sure we have had to replace some parts over that amount of time, but most grills would have been completely replaced because they simple would have completely rusted out. Over that amount of time we have cooked, grilled and smoke lots of great meals on our DUO 505 grill & smoker. When the legs final fall off our grill... We will buy the same combo. Thank you Ghar-Griller for great products & services!
reviews.author: Gene Sr.

reviews.title: "Very Disappointed"
reviews.text:
When I purchased this grill I believed that it might be what I was looking for, since it could be used in either gas or charcoal mode. 
 I purchased this the day before Memorial Day, expecting to use it that next day. Once I started to assemble it, it was obvious that it had been dropped from a good height. The bottom tray, both grill bodies and the smokestacks were all bent. One of the plastic feet that fit on the legs was broken. Fortunately, since I did not have time to return it to the store and still grill as planned, I was able to beat these items back into their original shape using a wooden block, a rubber mallet, and pliers wrapped in a rag to keep from scarring the finish. I will use some super glue on the leg foot.
Whether it works as advertised or not remains to be see.
reviews.author: Pete

reviews.title: "Father's day surprise"
reviews.text: My husband was on the fence as whether to get a gas or charcoal grill so I bought this model. Turns out it was perfect for our large parties and different styles in grilling. The only thing I can say that is negative is that the two barrel lids are held in place at the middle by an unsecured pin. Otherwise we are very happy with this product!
reviews.author: Demarest30

reviews.text: Recievied this as a Christmas gift and broke it in tonight (12/27/10). LOVED IT!!! Used the charcoal side to smoke some venison and pork and could not have been happier. Heated up quickly and held a very consistant temp with very little effort on my part. Tons of working space, although I am going to ad the smoker box. ***SIDE NOTE***...have the folks at Lowe's assemble for you - well worth it! Love the grill!! Buy one!!
reviews.author: Green_hed

reviews.title: "Love the idea, but product rust easley."
reviews.text: This will be the second season I have had this grill, if you are like me you will grill all year round but what I found is that you have to cover the grill in the winter, and every time you use the grill make sure that you oil it. I typically use Pam, which has kept most of the rust away. The direction do state to oil it but does not say how often, based on what I have seen, it needs to be done every time you grill. When it comes time to replace this monster, I'm thinking I might just buy a gas and charcoal grill separate.
reviews.author: ds4200

reviews.title: "Well......not sure how to star rate this so far."
reviews.text: Grill was delivered and looked ok. No owners manual. Went back to the store and they printed me a copy. Began to set up to season the grill as suggested in written reviews and online videos, and discovered the catch pan was missing as well as one of the grease trays. Discovered catch pan missing first and called CharGriller. They said they would send one out. About half an hour after suspending the seasoning I realized the grease tray was also missing. Called back and they said they would send one out. So after being super excited about my purchase and getting it set up to grill I'm just kind of disappointed. I'm sure I'll be excited again when I actually can get back to getting the grill up and grillin. I just wanted to do the seasoning with all parts in place.
reviews.author: Eric

reviews.title: "Unique concept."
reviews.text: Really like the idea of having the choice between charcoal or gas.
reviews.author: cessna

reviews.title: "so far, so good"
reviews.text: Put the grill together today. Some reviews said the unit was wobbly, ours is not. Very sturdy construction. It did take us about 2 hours to assemble, but the instructions were easy to read and follow. We also bought the cover (after we have used it I will submit a review). We grilled steaks on the charcoal side, they cooked very well. I also put some pork chops on the warming rack, they cooked just as well as the steak on the main grills. Again, so far, so good. I will review again after we have had the unit for a while.
reviews.author: Lucky

reviews.title: "Great design... very poor starts!"
reviews.text: I have used this grill about 15 times and own the grill for about 10 months. I just contacted customer service for the 2nd time with 8 months to get a new starter. Customer service has been AWESOME! It's not hard to start the grill with a long lighter however for the price the parts need to be better. Got the grill on sale for $199.99. If i would have paid $299 then I would have provided a 1 rating.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Do not buy"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill and tried taking it home. On the way home I noticed that the product was extremely wobble. Then we noticed that the grill had tons of grease on the inside and outside. We took the product back and they told me that all the grease is to keep the product from rusting out. We were told multiple times this product would rust and we really had to cover all the time and grease it frequently. The product moved in the wind and it was tightly screwed and in place. Ended up taking the product back.
reviews.author: Unsatisfied296366451

reviews.title: "Quality Product"
reviews.text: A little heavy if you are trying to move it by yourself.
reviews.author: Devil Driver

reviews.title: "MOAG! The Mother of All Grills"
reviews.text: Get the optional side tabletop grill for conversion to the firebox to use for smoking purpose. Don't forget to buy a charcoal starter chimney if you don't have one. It fits perfectly over the gas side burner and you have ready coals in minutes. This is the best deal out there. It does in one package all you want. Period. End of story.
reviews.author: ZZ Dog

reviews.title: "Really wanted to like it"
reviews.text: I really wanted to like this grill since I love the taste of charcoal and the ease of gas. I even risked it on reading some of the bad reviews. Sadly so far those bad reviews have been right.First thing I notice upon unpacking the parts is that almost everything is covered in some type of oil or grease. There could be a purpose to it but I doubt it as it is uneven and random. I know it didn't happen in transit to the store because the outside of the box is fine while everything inside has it. Whatever the reason it was an annoying mess during and after assembly.As other reviewers have mentioned the the quality just ins't there. The welds are pretty shotty and while I've only had the grill a short time I don't have high hopes of it lasting past the year. Some of the fastening hardware was also pretty low quality. I'm no bear of a man but I twisted the head off one the screws just hand tightening it. Sadly I left the grill lids upside down in the box while I was assembling it. When it came time to attach the lids I pulled them out to find a giant scratch down the top of the lid. At this point the thing was practically assembled so I just kept going. And then the rust. One of the handles had bit of the coating missing and it had already started rusting. Then there were the little things..like obvious misspellings and being shorted the right amount of washers.. that on their wouldn't have been a big deal but combined with everything else it just toped the whole experience off.I love using it but honestly in terms of quality it is a piece of junk. Its such a disappointment. If it weren't a gift I probably would have taken it back. Bottom line is I would never recommend it to anyone.
reviews.author: Rusty

reviews.title: "Disappointing"
reviews.text: We bought this grill two years ago, we were very happy at first with the grill. After one year the burner cover plates rusted away. You cannot buy replacement parts for this grill, you have to buy generic parts and make them work. After two years the barrel on the gas side is falling apart, So its off to buy another grill.
reviews.author: safariclub1

reviews.title: "Best Grill I ever owned"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill memorial holiday. The idea of having a choice between charcoal and gas is absolutely fabulous. When closed it holds the heat like an oven. On the charcoal side you can adjust the charcoal to where you want it for perfect cooking. The unit itself is built very sturdy. It should last for years to come.
reviews.author: knine

reviews.title: "Excellent Grill (for the first few years)"
reviews.text: As other's have mentioned, this grill is awesome! If you need proof, this is my third one. That also shows the problem, the durability of the grill is OK, but definately not a long term investment like something made of stainless steel. It will (no matter how often you season the grill and cover it) RUST. The last one that I had lasted four years, but I finally had to get rid of it at the beginning of this season as I was heading into a kitchen renovation and my family of four was going to be relying on my "outdoor" kitchen.So, the grill won't last forever, but boy is it a nice one while it lasts! The side burner is perfect for a charcoal chimney so you can even get the charcoal side up and running at about 400°F within about 10-15 minutes. The gas side is nice for two things I like to make a lot: fish (easier because lower heat control is easy) and home fries (can get the gas side to nearly 600°F and really get a disposable pan of oil pretty darn hot!The grill surface on the charcoal side is huge! I have had a two level fire built with the cool side having an entire pork shoulder (Boston Butt) and on the hot side I had veggies. Warming rack had buns toasting on the cooler side and corn on the cob warming up. In the event that I have the whole family over, I use the gas side as a warming oven to keep things ready until we serve.I use this grill all year for the past 9 years. As I said, I am on my third one so I would suggest getting the extended warranty from Lowes (3-4 years). That way, your next $300 grill will only cost you $60....
reviews.author: SchlupRae

reviews.title: "Chargriller review"
reviews.text: Gas side heats up ridiculously fast when compared to char broil (which I used to swear by). Charcoal side is phenomenal as well.  Only thing I would recommend is using tin foil or other similar assets to line/wrap the inside of the grill to protect it from any seasoning you may be using. Great and durable grill so far!
reviews.author: AirborneEA

reviews.title: "read this review."
reviews.text: I put this together entirely by myself in a little over 2 hours. Its not hard it just took time. Would go a lot fast with two people. The instructions were straight forward.-------Pros-----Gas and charcoal. I like the side burner for my chimney starter.The charcoal side is also adjustable so you can control heat very well. Its great to seat steaks on the charcoal. The gas grill heats up surprisingly fast. The electric starter is incredible. You push the button and hold it until the grill lights. No more "turn click spark. then again turn click spark". Its continually sparking until you let go much like a kitchen stove top. The charcoal side holds A LOT of charcoal. Easily 2 chimneys full and probably a little more. They also include a long wire match holder if you prefer matches.Two pretty large cooking surfaces. Everything is easy to replace if needed.-------CONS - - - -While these are minor. I thought I should still note them.The lids are a little flimsy. (or should I say the hinges are)It leaks smoke out of the cracks where the lid meets the bottom.electric starter requires a battery which needs replacing (no big deal). You need a custom cover in order for it to fit well. No electric starter on the side burner. (It still has one of the 1 click electric starter)It could use some more table top space. The only space is if your not using the side burner.The grill needs to be seasoned before you use it ( I want to grill now!)Overall I would say I love the grill. I would buy it again if I had the choice. Gas on the weekdays charcoal (FLAVOR FLAVOR FLAVOR) on the weekends or both if your entertaining a large crowd.Also, I would highly recommend hardwood charcoal. The flavor is intense. If you use the chimney with the side burner it fires up great. Hardwood charcoal can sometimes be hard to start.DON'T FORGET TO SEASON YOUR GRILL with Vegi oil! (IT WILL RUST IF YOU DON'T)
reviews.author: Jason Of Bmore

reviews.title: "Will buy again"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill for my husband for his 30th bday; n that was 7 years ago. It once had a cover but it faded, dried out n eventually got ripped to shreds about 5yrs ago.  It has NOT been covered since n has been exposed to all ohio's elements year round. The grill has had some mantaince such as burner tents (The original tents lasted MAYBE 3yrs before they rusted out n desintegrated.), igniter button, n regulator. The only 'seasoning' it has had is the years of use. And very recently it received its well over due cleaning when ALL the years of 'seasoning' was burned off when the grill caught on fire! Yes, the grill is now rust n probably goin to be replaced in the next year, but will buy the same one if my husband still wants both charcoal n gas grilling options.
reviews.author: K-lynn

reviews.title: "great grill! my friends have grill envy!"
reviews.text: bought this on sale for $199 free shipping & assembly (so I know I didn't put it together wrong!) this grill is a beast for one woman to handle!! My only problem is the grease drip pan does not fit with the propane tank in it's hole, the collars of our standard tanks are too high to allow the drip pan to fit as well.
reviews.author: DeeR

reviews.title: "Amazing Grill for the Price!!"
reviews.text: I bought this grill 10 years ago, and it is still going strong, but the burners and heat plates have started to rust.  It is mainly my fault as the last three years it has not been covered.  I plan to purchase this same grill again in the spring.  It cooks evenly, and is amazing for both charcoal and gas.  Love it!!!
reviews.author: JK

reviews.title: "An okay product"
reviews.text: Disappointed with the charcoal side of product. They could take a lesson from competitor Weber. The charcoal chamber does not seal... Thus all coals burn completely away. With a weber the chamber seals after use so that remaining coals are snuffed/suffocated. Leaving unused coals that can be used at a later time.
reviews.author: Reisnrg

reviews.title: "best grill on the market"
reviews.text: cook great !!! just a awesome grill at a good price at lowes
reviews.author: kj

reviews.title: "I like it but..."
reviews.text: I have had this grill about 3 weeks. For the gas grill, each burner ignites independently (not lighting one burner that lights the rest of the burners). One burner will not automatically ignite; the ignitor wire appears to have broken (become detached) and I have to light it with a match. The grill is heavy, it is irritating that I have to load the grill up on my truck and carry it back to Lowes to be serviced...If I follow through and get it repaired.
reviews.author: saltyangler

reviews.title: "Great Combo grill!"
reviews.text: I love it, I grill twice a week on it. For the money best thing on the market for a combo grill. I attached the side smoker box for indirect heat and it works awesome for smoking briskets, ribs, turkeys etc.. Buy the cover for it to keep it out of the weather. I reccomend a cover for any grill that you own.
reviews.author: Pat

reviews.title: "so far so good"
reviews.text: I noticed a lot of grease on the parts during assembly (almost like it spilled on them) i'm assuming this is some kind of lubricant protection from rust or semething? Just curious if anyone had noticed this or if it was normal? Havent gotten it all put together yet but so far very impressed with quality.
reviews.author: countrycooker

reviews.title: "Best Grill EVER"
reviews.text: This grill is amazing!!!!!!! Just finished my first of many BBQs and the product performed better than expected. Wow this grill has all the options that a grill could want and then some. I am just looking forward to using it again. The steak that I had was awesome. The rust problem that others have mentioned, well that I will comment on in time, but I'm hoping that with the proper care and some love there shouldn't be to many problems in the future.
reviews.author: GRILL MASTER 10000

reviews.title: "Best of both worlds and great value"
reviews.text: OK, I just fired up this grill for the start of the fourth grilling seasons, so now I feel I can leave an honest review.Short story: This grill is going strong after 3 full seasons.Long story: Ignore the reviews from people complaining, 'the grill rusts our after one season'.  These are people who do not take proper care of the grill.  I seasons my grill at the end of every year before winter.  Seasoning, is using high heat cooking oil, don't use peanut oil (you could kill someone), to rub down most of the interior parts of the grill.  I also take out the electric start battery. Finally, remove the gas hoses and store those in the garage.  I also purchased the proper fitting grill cover.  My grill stays out all winter under the cover on my deck.  Then all spring summer and fall it is used at least an average of twice a week.  The electric start fires up all three burners no problem.  The flames are even across all three burner tubes.  I have zero rust on the outside and there is usually a little surface rust at the end of a long grilling season but rubbing with oil removes that surface layer easy.  Again, I have three full long grilling seasons and the thing works like new.Best part of this grill, I get the best of both worlds! A charcoal grill for weekends when I have the time to smoke larger cuts of meat and the week night steaks, burgers and shrimp cook quick and easy on the gas side.  All this for less money than the average gas grill!!!  I got my duo for $229 on sale, Spring Black Friday deal.  The cheapest gas grill alone was $199 that I saw.  It is like getting a full charcoal grill for $29!Great deal, great product that holds up (when taken care of properly).  You cannot go wrong
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "SIDE BURNER RUSTED OUT EVEN WITH COVER ON"
reviews.text: I purchased the grill in the spring by the fall the side burner started to rust, by the next year the burner fell out. love the grill i just have to replace the side burner, very poor quality on the side burner, need to redesign the cover so it covers the whole side burner not just the burner..
reviews.author: jimmy

reviews.title: "The outdoor trifecta: grill, bbq, and smoker"
reviews.text: I also bought that small smoker unit that goes on the side. It can be used for hot and cold smoking. We love smoked cheeses! This is the just about perfect unit. At times it is--that's when my adult sons are here to do the cooking! It is easy to use and clean. I am thrilled with this purchase!
reviews.author: arlene821

reviews.title: "RUSTED OUT"
reviews.text: We received this grill as a wedding present 3 years ago, and it cooks well., except that the ignition button crapped out after about 15 uses. Unfortunately, it will rust out completely as other users have pointed out. We seasoned the grates, we always used a cover, and still the whole thing is rusting from the top down. The grates have been replaced every year because they rust out so badly over the winter that they almost break in half. Also, because of the large size of this grill (especially if you add the smoker attachment) only a cover from the manufacturer will fit properly. Their cover isn't very durable either, and ours began ripping right down the middle after about 6 months of use. We replaced too many grates and too many covers for this thing. The legs are also rusting off and the grill is crumbling. This grill is under a covered porch and has always had a cover on it. We are buying something else. Don't waste your money unless you plan to keep it inside and never actually cook on it.
reviews.author: disgruntled

reviews.title: "Great grill and easy to use."
reviews.text: We wanted to buy something economical and easy to use. We opted for this grill because of the dual cooking features and the heavy construction. We've had this grill for a week and we love everything about it. I personally liked the idea of the optional fire box for smoking foods. I will purchase that eventually. We have used this grill almost everyday since we bought it with no regrets. If you are a foodie like we are you'll love this grill from Lowe's. We took the one in the box and when we got it home it was missing alot of parts so we took it back to Lowe's and checked another box and it had parts missing too. Lowe's was very helpful in our purchase. We opted for the floor model and needed to get parts from the box to complete it. Besides all that it was worth the trouble.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Worth It..."
reviews.text: I have owned this grill for about 6 months and am very pleased with it. Really is the best of both worlds. Gas side gets up to temp fast and each side is big enough to actually cook enough food for a family or entertaining. The only negatives about it are putting it together takes a couple people, and if you use the side burner there's nowhere to put anything down. Otherwise, best grill I've ever owned.
reviews.author: JB

reviews.title: "High Maintenance to keep it working"
reviews.text: I used this grill for two full summer and winter seasons. Loved it versatility for gas, charcoal and the optional fire box for smoking. I used all of them. Bottom line though, this grill will rust and rot no matter how much time you spend trying to prevent it.I kept it covered when not in use. The high heat would peel the factory paint and then cause rust. Twice I sanded it down and repainted it with high quality, high temperature grill paint. This helped but could not fix it long term.The heat disbursing panels directly over the flame also rust and rot and will need to be replaced. The brackets that hold them rot through and are unable to hold the panels.All of these are replaceable but take your constant attention and additional dollars. However, the high heat actually burns holes in the grill body itself and this cannot be fixed.I am now searching for a new grill and will most likely pay more for one that I know will endure multiple seasons of grilling.Too bad since I liked this grills setup.
reviews.author: GBNT

reviews.title: "Chargriller Side-By-Side Gas/Charcoal Grill"
reviews.text: Gas or Charcoal? Charcoal or Gas? How about both! Get this grill and settle the debate once and for all. I bought this grill just days before the 4th of July. For my cookout, some of my guests showed up early. The charcoal had yet to set up properly, so I fired up the gas side, and everyone was happy. And don't worry: there's plenty of space for all the foods you want to cook. This is one rugged, sturdy, convenient grill. Buy the additional smoker unit (sold separately) for the complete grilling experience.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Loving my 5050"
reviews.text: I got this for my birthday seven years ago. It is an awesome unit. I even added the smoker onto the end of it and a rotisserie for doing whole chickens and roasts. But parts are wearing out. The igniter quit after the first grilling season and now the right end control valve locked up in the on position and I had to shut it off at the tank. I am looking for a manifold/control valve assembly for it but am having a hard time locating one for the 5050. I don't to have to buy a new grill just because of that.
reviews.author: Alan

reviews.title: "A+"
reviews.text: Best grill ive ever had, 7-8 years later and zero problems, grates are like brand new and igniters still work and overall apperance is an 8 out 10 not bad considering the first 3 years it sat out in the rain and snow without a cover. I grill out 4-5 days a week in summer and 3 days in winter. buying another incase they stop making this model but wont need it anytime soon.. also this grill was produced 3 first place and 1 second place in rib cookoffs using the optional smoke box that bolts on the side......
reviews.author: freezerbeef

reviews.title: "Rusted unsafe junk"
reviews.text: I would never have bought this grill, had I known that it would have rusted so badly and is now a piece of rusted junk. I followed all the instructions to prevent it from rusting and bought the cover for it. It performed great for two years and then it just declined to a piece of rusted junk. I was told that I should have bought the warranty and they would replace it every two years. I thought I did, however, could not find the warranty. They should have just went ahead and include the cost of the warranty in the price and be prepared to stand by their product. Sales pitch did not live up to the product longevity. Do not buy or be prepared to buy an extended warranty and exchange every two years or it will be a piece of rusted junk after and very unsafe to use. Very disappointed.
reviews.author: Mr Rob

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Duo"
reviews.text: My wife and kids gave me the "Duo" for an early Father's Day gift. She even asked "Lowes" to put it together for me to even make more special. I couldn't believe how easy it was to you both sides of it. I would like to thank both "Lowes" as well as my wife for the "Duo".
reviews.author: UncleBen

reviews.title: "Great Purchase"
reviews.text: Bought this grill on Father's Day. This replaced a gas grill I had for over 10 years. Good unit, solid steel construction. Heat stayed consistent in the gas or charcoal area. I am pleased with this purchase.
reviews.author: DEB

reviews.title: "Best grill I ahve ever had."
reviews.text: I absolutely love this grill. I have many grills in my 43 years but this grill is by far the best. It was free delivery and set up. I put a grill canopy over it and it was a wrap. If I had to say one thing bad about it, I would say it could be a little easier to clean.
reviews.author: D-WEST

reviews.title: "Year's of great cooking"
reviews.text: I have had this dual griller for almost three years. I love it! I also have the side smoke box and use both sides often. The only issue I have with this is the auto light button did not work for long. Great ribs , burgers, dogs, smoke Turkey for Thanksgiving etc...
reviews.author: Miguel

reviews.title: "I Love This Grill!!!!!"
reviews.text: Having 2 grills on the same cart allows one to adapt to different styles of cooking and to make more than one course at a time especially if they require different cooking temps or grill space.This is my second one...I bought my first 5050 in 2011 and I used it all year around since. I've grilled, BBQ'd, smoked all different sizes and cuts at all different food temps and outside temps and cook times, etc.When it was time for a new grill I had no hesitation in choosing this one even though it only lasted me a few years, but at this price, Im ok with that.My only con is that some parts will eventually start to rust and the grill grates will deteriorate. I've experienced this with my previous Chargriller grills but this time I bought the Lowes protection as others have suggested.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "I woulde with reservations"
reviews.text: i really like the concept of this grill, the charcoal side is great, I put the smoke box on it and I have really smoked some good pork and turkeys in it. I am disappointed in the gas part. If the wind is blowing at any speed it is hard to stay lit, and the inside has rusted out, not through but the hoods over the burners will not stay on because the brackets that hold the on have rusted away, the igniters went out early as well as the igniter button. All in all I love this and will continue to use it.
reviews.author: Kenny

reviews.title: "Love it!"
reviews.text: Great grill!  It gets hot, really hot!  I generally hate gas grill because they typically dont get as hot as i like but this one gets up to 700 degrees.  I bought this specifically for it's BTU/volume ratio and i'm very happy with it.definitely a great buy.
reviews.author: DaveR

reviews.title: "Great Grillin'!"
reviews.text: This grill is great! I've used both the gas side and the charcoal side. Both cooked quickly and perfectly. This grill is well built and very sturdy. It is also easy to clean. Love using it!
reviews.author: backyard bliss

reviews.title: "Stay away - buyers be aware"
reviews.text: After reading the mixed reviews, like a fool, I decided to purchase it. What a $400 mistake (price includes grill, side smoker and cover). I was careful to read the directions in regards to seasoning in an effort to prevent premature rust and fatigue (based on the instructions and reviews). It sat in my garage for a month (unused) before I moved it to the deck and I was extremely careful to make sure it was covered every day/night when not in use. And by the way, I fired it up for a week straight just to season it. Installed the side smoke box and fired it up for the first time to cook some ribs. After I assembled the separately purchased the side smoker box, I noticed the ash drawer would not “seat” appropriately. I decided to keep it anyway as I had ribs on my mind for the next day. It was December so it was chilly outside (Western NC). I decided to enjoy a cup of scotch and a cigar in the meantime. Within the first hour, I realized the purchase was a HUGE mistake. The paint on the lid for the side smoker box was peeling right in front of my eyes. The crate for the charcoal in the smoker box deformed. I contacted the manufacturer and their response was more or less “deal with it. That is the unit. Read the fine print”. That was over 3 years ago and I still can't find the fine print. It was only a matter of months before the unit started to rust even more, regardless with the amount of seasoning and keeping it covered. And as for the charcoal usage, 4 hours of smoking/cooking easily consumes half of a large bag of Kingsford charcoal while marinating a temperature of 225-250°F (which is a pain to maintain) whereas charcoal in Weber Kettle would last forever, and is much, much easier to maintain. The moral of the story, stick to Weber for charcoal grills and any other brand but this one for gas grills.The only good thing about this grill is that it looks good, when new and the side burner (which didn't last long due to the heat from the charcoal chimney). You have been warned!
reviews.author: Kamal922

reviews.title: "Great grill but Hard to get parts"
reviews.text: I've had this grill for 4 years now and I've really enjoyed the convenience of dual fuel. The only issue is now I need to make some repairs and some of the replacement parts cannot be found. I even tried the web site but they don't have the parts I need
reviews.author: Dianne

reviews.title: "Great grill, very easy to use"
reviews.text: Nice feature having charcoal and gas, however very poorly made. We knew after putting it together that it wasn't going to last a long time...very cheaply made. And sure enough, a year and a half later the bottom has rusted out and fell apart. The grill is kept outdoors all year but it's protected from the rain...not sure how it rusted so quickly.
reviews.author: Cathy

reviews.title: "Great grill for the money!"
reviews.text: I was surprised with the overall quality of the grill. For the money you can't beat it. I am very happy with the purchase. I have used side burner, gas and charcoal. The adjustable grate on the charcoal side is great and I had no idea it was there until I assembled it! Assembly was easy using simple power tools, I used an impact with a phillips. Nothing else is really necessary just some time.Only dislike I had while assembly was the coating they used for some of the parts. The vegatable based oil to prevent from rusting are sticky and they are everywhere. However, they are safe and you need to do nothing before using the grill.Someone else mentioned the grill leaking when you open the top, when you open the top the rack sort of moves back. Some stuff can leak onto the cover then the floor. Get a grilling mat or some napkins!If you have your doubts dont. It took us a while before deciding on which grill to purchase that had charcoal and gas. I also purchase the grill cover to help us maintain and keep this grill for a long time.
reviews.author: Fernando

reviews.title: "best grill ive ever owned"
reviews.text: Have used this grill for last 3 yrs and is by far the best I have ever used. Fire up the propane side after a hard days work and on the weekend prepare the charcoal or smoker for an afternoon of slow cooking. (purchase of side box is a must)
reviews.author: jewliifith

reviews.title: "Best of both worlds!"
reviews.text: Do you like the flavor that comes from grilling over charcoal, but don't always have the time to warm up coals and so you're thinking of getting a gas grill instead? Before you do, consider this unit instead. It really does give you the best of both worlds.Now to be fair, I have only had the grill for around a month. I cannot testify to how well it holds up over time. I followed the instructions to 'season' it with vegetable oil prior to using it, which helps prevent rust, but since this thing ain't made of stainless steel, I'm sure a little rust is in my future no matter how much I take care of it. That being said, taking good care of it should minimize those issues. Be sure to buy the cover for it.I've grilled several times on each side now, and the results are excellent! For the charcoal side, it is possible to get very consistent and hot heat that can be regulated well with the damper. Just remember, a little charcoal goes a long way. If you fill it with too much, the grill will get too hot even if you close the damper all the way. I use a charcoal chimney which helps me regulate the amount well, and also assists in getting the coals started without any lighter fluid. The results are amazing, and even from the first burgers I grilled, that "char-grilled" taste came through nicely!Over on the gas side, we decided to put a couple ribeye's down for the inaugural grilling. Got the grill extremely hot first (up to about 650º), and then laid down the steaks after they'd been rubbed in olive oil, salt, and pepper, and grilled with the top open for about 5 minutes on each side. I did have to deal with several flare-ups from the burners, but that's partially just the nature of gas grilling. It didn't seem to affect the steaks negatively in any way. The results for the meat were perfect! A nicely charred crust on the edge, and medium on the inside.We have also done lots of hamburgers and hot dogs, and a few other things on the grill now too, and so far, I'm absolutely loving it. Would I recommend it? Heck yes. However, just keep in mind that it is not made of stainless steel, so, protect it from the weather as best you can by keeping it covered when not in use, and be sure to follow the instructions for seasoning it before first use.
reviews.author: fyreous

reviews.title: "Another Quality Product"
reviews.text: I've been using a Char-Griller for around 5-6 yrs and have only had to replace the charcoal basket just this year, the grill is used year round and have never had any problems (including smoking chickens, ribs, briskets or anything else). I just purchased this grill for our camp and the only complaint is the difference in the grates (ceramic coated as compared to the cast iron) and the temp. of the gas side (it quickly reaches 450+, but better than not getting hot enough); but other than that, a very well made product. I have found that if you properly season the grill (using vegetable oil) the grill holds up pretty well. I do prefer the cast iron grates as when they are seasoned properly, nothing sticks. Anyways, just added the smoker box recently and smoked 4 chickens simultaneously without a problem (removed the warming rack). Definately another quality product.
reviews.author: JDeere1

reviews.title: "good for two years"
reviews.text: Wife bought mine 6 years ago. After two years Propane was rusted and no good. Replacement parts costs around $120. A new one costs $299. Did not buy the parts using them charcoal side only. Will buy a Webber gas grill next.
reviews.author: JDmongo

reviews.title: "Fantastic"
reviews.text: This grill is awesome! The grill is sturdy (weighs almost 200 lbs with the side fire box) and retains heat very well. I have used very little propane on the gas side of the grill.Would recommend this to a friend in a heart beat!
reviews.author: Ed

reviews.title: "50/50, Just like the Model Number"
reviews.text: I bought this grill in early May to replace my super expensive stainless steel gas grill that rotted out. The price was $199 ONLINE, with pick up in the store. The store price was $299. It was already assembled so I thought this was a pretty good deal for the money.The gas features are average. It gets good and hot to broil steaks and the gas is controllable enough to do BBQ chicken. Keep a water bottle handy though for flare-ups. The charcoal side is adequate. I used both for a large gathering for 4th of July and it did a decent job for hamburgers, hot dogs and BBQ chicken for about 60 people.I bought the cover specifically for this model and have kept it covered when not in use. I have sprayed this grill with oil, as suggested for a rust inhibitor but it still has rusted on the outside cover on the side. Right now it's only surface rust, but in 2 years, I would say this grill will be junk.I would give it a D in sturdiness. It seems to be a bit wobbly so I wouldn't buy this if you'll need to move it often. The grates are average coated grates and they too have begun to rust despite my efforts to coats then with oil after use. I will also agree with a previous poster that the gas flame does tend to get blown out with the slightest of breezes unless it's set to high heat.As a result, like the model number suggests, this is a 50/50 item. It'll go either way. The price was right for me. And if I can get 2 years out of it, I guess it'll be worth it. But if you're looking for high quality and solid durability, you'll probably be disappointed.
reviews.author: Wojo

reviews.title: "Perfect for any grilling and smoking"
reviews.text: I got mine a little over a year ago and have loved it since day one. I purchased the side fire box to add to it to be able to do some smoking if I wanted to. I recommend doing this. Over all, I can do gas on stuff I want the ease of cooking if I don't want to prime coals. I have pretty much grilled or smoked just about everything on this grill. My only complaint is i wish the grilling surface on each side was a little bigger for when I have get togethers, otherwise great grill at a great price!
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Temperature issues from day one"
reviews.text: The build and quality of this grill is pretty good. Cant really say much more about that. But from the moment I first fired it up, i jave had issues with the propane temps. Ive replaced all the parts trying to get it to cook at a lower temperature. With all three burners going on the lowest setting, it will not be any cooler than 400 degrees. Sure, I can cut  2 burners off. But that defeats the purpose of having a large grill. The factory was of little help. I wont ever buy another Char-Griller
reviews.author: Beedeeare

reviews.title: "get this grill !! and save your money."
reviews.text: putting it together was tricky in the beginning but once you ger the legs up it gets easier.  I assembled it myself with a scew gun, plyers, screw driver. It looks awesome and love that you can use charcoal too. Grill space is not huge but how many times are you really going to have a party. Plus if you are having a party then fire up the charcoal side and youll have extra space for buns, corn, skewers, etc. def heavy and feels sturdy. The grills are easy to clean. The wheels make it easy to move.  I did buy the same company cover to go with it and it looks 100%.  It should last me  at least 10 years if i take care of it properely which i plan on. If your looking for a grill and dont want to spend all your money on a shiny stainless steel grill and want to look like a pit boss then get this.
reviews.author: bob-saget

reviews.title: "50-50 combo grill"
reviews.text: This is a top notch grill. I love the features and design. Many backyard gathering with great food to come. I only wish it came with the appropriate cover, instead of having to order one from the company on the internet.
reviews.author: JohnT

reviews.title: "Great duo grill"
reviews.text: For the money this grill is great! I bought the grill cover but not the add on smoker box. This grill has a little more maintenance for rust prevention but it is great to be able to use gas or charcoal in the same spot.
reviews.author: jonnyboyff

reviews.title: "New 50/50 Grill"
reviews.text: Bough this one and so far have loved it. Lowe's put it together and managed to fit it in the back of my Explorer!No problems with the gas or charcoal sides. Haven't used the burner top yet!. Worth the money!
reviews.author: JiminLakeWales

reviews.title: "what a grill for the price"
reviews.text: this grill is unbelievable quality for the price i love it..the charcoal side is great i used it first and it worked perfect you can raise or lower the coals for a hotter fire and the clean out is a breeze ..
reviews.author: love lowes

reviews.title: "Love it"
reviews.text:
Have had it since I moved to Canada in 2009 and other than dodgy wheels (I don't move it so who cares) I love the flexibity to be able to use coals as my preference but have the gas as a backup if I'm in a hurry or for overflow.
It's been left out in Canadian weather with the cover the whole time and has lasted incredibly well.
I'm at the point of going to order parts to refresh it but with the sale price I'm going to buy a new one and use this one as further overflow.
Incredible value.
reviews.author: SoreHead

reviews.title: "Super Fun Grill"
reviews.text: This grill is everything it claims to be. I wasn't expecting the best quality, but the grill offers amazing flexibility at this price. I use the side burner to light a charcoal chimney, and the coals are ready in 5-10 minutes. I generally use the propane to sear meat, or to cook on weekdays. The charcoal grill is great for the weekend, and I look forward to adding the firebox soon.Be sure to follow the curing instructions (coat with vegetable oil spray and cook at 250 for 2 hours). Other reviews talked about inevitable rust, so I bought the 4 year protection plan.I bought the grill online with an in-store pick up so I could use an online coupon code. I went to the store immediately and they were ready to load the pre-assembled grill for no charge. You'll need a truck though, this thing is big.
reviews.author: Fridawg

reviews.title: "Definitely would buy again."
reviews.text: Your best friend for this grill is cooking spray or a rag with oil. You will get SURFACE rust on the inside, clean it with a wire brush (fiber on cold grates). If you're in the southern states use more oil and get the cover. Take the time to learn how to use it. I have done alot on it, from dogs and burgers to rotisserie chicken and pork roasts. I've cooked full meals including vegetables. Every time I use it I'm not disappointed. Eventually I will add the smoker and another rotisserie.
reviews.author: Dogboy

reviews.title: "WOW"
reviews.text: Well I've only had the grill for a day, but so far sooooo goooddddd.It started literally right away after hooking up the propane. The design and build is very sturdy and it feels heavy. The adjustable charcoal rack is awesome too, and great for getting the heat right where you need it, whether using the gas side, or the charcoal side.I'm an AVID cook, griller, and most of all I love to smoke meats in a nice pit. I'm looking forward to getting the smoker box attachment. So I can begin that journey. I've been around a lot of cheaply made grills, flemzy, thin metal, holes and gaps losing precious heat, etc..... THIS grill has NONE. I went over it with a fine tooth comb, and only found a few MINOR flaws I dont like.The minor flaws i'm referring to is 1) The grease pan faces the back. Essentially this is only a problem if you have your grill backed up to something, in which case, the lids won't open anyways. 2) The side burner, is kinda weak in design, and cant keep a low flame in windy conditions.Like I said, the above paragraph are the ONLY 2 MINOR details I personally found going over the WHOLE grill.The only thing I didn't rate as 5 stars, is the features. Just because you can only get SO many features for this price. BELIEVE ME, this grill is NOT missing anything the average cook would need. WIth a minor understanding of grilling you can make a VAST variety of things with this amazing grillBUY IT!!!!!!
reviews.author: MTSLAMMER

reviews.title: "Char-Broil model 5050"
reviews.text: The unit is very nice for the value, but it probably will not last over 4 years. No big deal even the best units do not last much longer. For the value you cannot beat it. The unit is heavy and well worth the money. I had two smaller char-grill charcoal grillers and they were great. Just be smart and purchase the replacement warranty from Lowes. I do recommend this best value for the dollar. I would have it put together by Lowes even if they charge you. Very big unit and LOTS of bolts.
reviews.author: Tsheetz

reviews.title: "Fun for awhile but didn't last"
reviews.text:
I had this grill for several years and here are my observations.

#1 - Very versatile especially when you add the side fire box. Smoking ribs is fun and addicting thing to do on this. It's nice having the side burner to use to light the charcoal using a chimney. Then after they get hot you can easily drop the hot coals into the firebox. 

#2 - The gas grill flares up too easily. It's extremely hard to get the gas grill to cook evenly and you have to monitor it at all times with a water gun/cup at the ready.

#3 - Rust, rust rust. The flavorizer will last about one to two season before they are shot. The firebox will rust on you every year and you'll just have to brush it and spray fireproof paint each year. 

#4 - Durability - The igniters are shot after the third season. The grates were pretty much ruined after four seasons. The bottom of the charcoal grill was rusted completely out after four years despite rarely using it for direct cooking. Oddly enough the side firebox never rusted through despite years of smoking meats. Two of the gas control valves were frozen solid after four years.
reviews.author: SoutheasternLumbee

reviews.title: "great buy"
reviews.text: excellent product easy to use and fast too I used every 2 to 3 days I have the smoker to, the only thing I didn't like is that it get to dirty during uses I have to clean it every 2 to 3 uses because of the fat that it doesn't go to the pan
reviews.author: yogi

reviews.title: "Best Grill on the Market"
reviews.text: This grill is the best I have owned.It is made from heavy guage steel and quality parts.The ability to have both gas and charcoal grills in the same unit sets it apart from the others.I plan on enjoying this grill for many years to come.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Junkman was happy"
reviews.text: After 3 years it was worthless. the scrap metal man was glad to take it. Was not cheap but was cheap junk
reviews.author: NT

reviews.title: "Lasted 9 years"
reviews.text: My wife finally convinced me to buy a new Duo after 9 years of use sitting on an open patio.  Yes, there is some rust, but the food still tastes great. Only this past year has the rust become a real issue on the bottom of the legs. New one arrived today and my yardman was thrilled to get the old one. Can't say enough about the grill. It has done more than I could have asked for $249 (price years ago).
reviews.author: JIMR

reviews.title: "Pretty nice having gas & charcoal"
reviews.text: Love having gas and charcoal grills as well as a side burner. The optional smoker box should be included. The handles for the charcoal tray should be attached. Overall a great grill.
reviews.author: Dr. Mike

reviews.title: "Love it, but..."
reviews.text: Wifey gave me this grill for father's day about 10 years ago.  Needless to say there are some issues but overall it is still going strong. I didnt get the side smoker box, as I said I would get around to, but I did get the outdoor cover.  It SUCKS.  The first was dry and pealing after backing in the NC sun after two seasons.  The second one did the same even when I stored it under a temporary car port.  Don't waste your money on them.  The cooker itself is sturdy, can handle a large cook, and holds a good temp.  I even cooked in the rain and in the winter.  The gas/coal combo is a definite plus.  The bottom tray has since rusted away, but again.  The cooking area is amazing even till this day and guess what...Aside from dumping coal dust and cleaning the grates I have NEVER cleaned the smoking area!  If I had maintained this meticulously, like some very serious "Grill Sergeants" in my old units..well just imagine.  I am buying another and I promise to treat it better now that I am retired and have more time.  Not getting rid of my old one, just getting another.  With the side smoker box.  LoL  Cheers!!
reviews.author: PeteNice2k

reviews.title: "Great product for the price!"
reviews.text: I grill about 4 times a week, it has performed great everytime! I did exactly like the directions said and did the preburn before I cooked anything on it. The only issue is the flame covers on the gas side is that they do rust but every gas grill I've had has done the same thing. but in all fairness I left it open a few times during the rain. All and all it is good grill and looks great on my deck. I did buy new flame covers to replace the ones that rusted which is very inexpensive.
reviews.author: The griller

reviews.title: "Best grill ever"
reviews.text: I bought this grill two years ago it has been great from pork chops,chicken, ribbs, steak, you name it. This is the best grill I have ever had. I need to buy the smoker. Overall worth the money.
reviews.author: Big D

reviews.title: "Husband's Dream Grill"
reviews.text: If you can only have one grill, this is the one to have. Best of both worlds... or best of all 4 worlds in my husband's case with the gas side burner (we only have an electric range inside) and the add-on smoker box, he is a happy camper. Be prepared, though, it does take 2 people about 2 hours to assemble, but none of the steps were hard. We've only had it for 2 nights, so I can't speak to durability yet. However, it seems to be better constructed than our last grill so I have high hopes for it. My only complaint would be that it has to sit so far away from the wall for the large lids (with their tall chimney stacks) to be able to open properly. There is about 12-18" of dead space behind the grill which looks a little odd, but it's probably safer that way anyway. Overall, I have one very happy husband!
reviews.author: AP7

reviews.title: "Bad product"
reviews.text: The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because it looks like a great grill. I've had mine now for 3 years and always kept it covered when not in use. The outside still looks great but the whole inside is deteriorating. Metal flakes from the top grill ended up in my food one day which led to me looking at the whole grill. I took really good care of the is grill. The bottom grates don't last long as well. Stainless steel would work better. For the money this grill just wasn't worth it.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Free assembly doesn't work"
reviews.text: Can't judge the manufacturer yet as I haven't witnessed the grill working. I ordered this from the Local Lowe's with free assembly and picked it up today. Got home excited and hooked up the propane tank but it won't ignite. Tried multiple propane tanks and turned the knobs on and off multiple times and nothing. Such a disappointment.
reviews.author: jbaustin05

reviews.title: "Excellent grill"
reviews.text: Love having both worlds gas for the quicker nights and charcoal for the slower days. The is well built could use stronger wheels and axle, but then most grills could.
reviews.author: Pete

reviews.title: "Will rust out in less than 2 years"
reviews.text: We bought this grill two years ago. We have kept it covered except when it was in use. Our gas side is completely rusted out and unusable, I don't recommend at all!!
reviews.author: mannperkins

reviews.title: "Michele"
reviews.text: I've used this often and I only have a few complaints. I agree with the others who complain about the rust as I have the same issue. There was a small leak in the rubber tubing, which had to be repaired, but I've had this for 4 years and I use it often. It is spacious and heats quickly. Always ready to use, especially when you run out of gas and/or coals. The grates are easy to clean, as well as the ash collectors. I would buy this grill again, but use some kind of rust protector.
reviews.author: Michele

reviews.title: "Junkman was happy"
reviews.text: After 3 years it was worthless. the scrap metal man was glad to take it. Was not cheap but was cheap junk
reviews.author: NT

reviews.title: "Duo S-5050 Black Gas and Charcoal Grill"
reviews.text: Good grill for the value and build. Prep to cure grill tonight. The gas control knobs split in the control shaft real easy thus not allowing control of gas flow.
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "Duo S-5050 Black Gas and Charcoal Grill"
reviews.text: Good grill for the value and build. Prep to cure grill tonight. The gas control knobs split in the control shaft real easy thus not allowing control of gas flow.
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "LOVE THE CONCEPT"
reviews.text: This grill was bought as a gift and unfortunately the grill grates ceramic coating peels off. Also, it is cheaply made burners and on/off buttons malfunction.
reviews.author: Roz

reviews.title: "Terrific Grill I've Worn Out"
reviews.text: Can't wait to buy my replacement, just a terrific product
reviews.author: Daddy0My

reviews.title: "Affordable outdoor kitchen!"
reviews.text: Now have the options of using gas or charcoal and intend on purchasing the smoker attachment. This grill allows for year round use all under one roof.
reviews.author: Nannette

reviews.title: "Don't wast your money!"
reviews.text: Poor design, small side burner, set back too close to lid! Has punch outs for rotisserie, but Chargriller doesn't recommend using one! Cooks too hot for sixe of cooking area! Won't convert ot natural gas without voiding warranty! Lastly, customer service, at Chargriller is the worst! Avoid answering questions, and confusing at best when they do!
reviews.author: Barnfield

reviews.title: "Owned for 6 years & I would buy again"
reviews.text: I received this grill as a gift in May 2010. I use both sides frequently. Over the years I've replaced the grates & flame shields only once. The electric igniter needs replacing, but I manage with an extended lighter. After 6 years in the humidity of south Louisiana, its finally starting to show signs of rust along the bottom shelf. The custom cover has worked great to keep the moisture and brutal sun at bay. Also, starting to see interior wear after lots of use over the years. The side burner is a perfect size to light coals with the chimney starter. I will definitely buy another when its time to replace. People are often surprised to hear how old this grill is considering its great condition and frequency of use. I'm not sure if the gas side is compatible with natural gas, but it would be great if it were.
reviews.author: Jake

reviews.text: Grill little shaky. Needs more than one screw in each leg. Should be braced a little better. Cooks great smokes real goproof charcoal side.
reviews.author: TM

reviews.title: "Great"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill in 2012.  I must say 5 years later my grill is still excellent.  Only complaint I have is that it doesnt come with food.
reviews.author: Chuck

reviews.text: This is a great grill, I got it on sale for $199 worth a lot more for those who like to BBQ and Smoke foods.
reviews.author: Perkdaddy1

reviews.title: "We like it!"
reviews.text: We had two griils in our back yard, gas and charcoal. After they both went bad we started looking for a new one. When I saw this one online I called my husband about it, two in one was a great deal for us as it would save us some space. We bought it yesterday on the great sale with a 100$ discount!!!!! My husband put it together, it comes in the box and you have to assamble it. Grill looks great. We have not tested it yeat, but I hope it works as good as it looks.
reviews.author: Kseniia

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Dud!"
reviews.text: I recieved this grill as a gift and I was excited to use it. I had only used the gas grill a few times when it flared up and damaged the lid. After that it never worked the same. I cleaned the grill and grease trap after every use including the time of the flare up. Since then the only hotspot was in the back of the grill and it has rusted badly. I now have to replace it. I'm sure Char-Griller is a good brand, but this grill was a dud.
reviews.author: Rob

reviews.title: "Amazing Grill"
reviews.text: I am absolutely stunned at fast this heats, on both sides.  I had to totally adjust my cooking times, but that's a good thing.
reviews.author: Homer

reviews.title: "Purchased yesterday, junk today"
reviews.text: I purchased the grill on July 4th. I followed the preparation instructions as noted...additional oil inside, let charcoal burn for two hours to adjust grill, not exceed 450 degree then cook. I write technical manuals for weapon usage. I think I am very detailed about instructions and following them. Nevertheless following those instructions did not guarantee success. I am standing at the grill cooking the meat. I looked towards the ground and see black fragments. At first thought, I thought it was ash from charcoal. Second thoughts, I never seen big ash flakes. I look underneath the grill, it is the paint peeling. I called Lowes shortly after to inform them about the issue. I do not want a replacement, I want my money returned. So, I will be returning today. Now I questioned why no recent reviews on the grill. The reviews are 2013 and older. Hopefully, I have no issues with Lowes to return and get refund.
reviews.author: BurnedInMichigan

reviews.title: "Half the Price of a Weber!"
reviews.text:
Unfortunately it is also much less than half the quality.

You see, I'm hesitant to give it low marks because this grill is a fantastic concept. Side by side gas and charcoal grilling? Who wouldn't love that! No time or inclination during a weekday to light up charcoal and wait? Use the gas side. Feel like taking your time for a nice slow cooked pork roast or beef brisket on a weekend? The charcoal side is there. Additionally there is a side burner to cook beans or whatever other side dishes you desire. So why 2 stars?

Because it is extremely poor quality. This thing WILL rust no matter what you do. You can season it religiously. You can keep it covered. You could even bring it indoors and it wouldn't matter. It rusts. Worst of all, the replacement parts are expensive and of equally poor quality as the originals. You can easily spend as much as what it'd cost to buy a mid-range Weber in the first place but you can bet dollars to donuts the Weber will last you 10 times as long. And that's no exaggeration. My neighbor has a Weber he bought 20 years ago and guess what, it looks better than this one which I bought 6 years ago. In fact, mine is falling apart and there is no way I'll be able to fix it at any price. Compared to my neighbor's, my grill is a wobbly, sorry sight. The side burner has all but disintegrated, the grates and flame shields are following shortly, and the ash pan is totally gone, not to mention the electronic ignition stopped working 2 years ago.

Not to say that I didn't have a good time with it. I cooked many delicious meats and vegetables on it, and as a smoker it does a somewhat decent job. But in hindsight, I should've steered clear. The features are just not enough to justify the purchase. If you must get this grill for the features then wait for the sale price and do what some other reviewer does and get the Lowes extended warranty, because you are going to need it. 
As for me, better to use that money towards a high quality grill that will last. Going forward I'll stick to the name brand I knew I should've trusted.
reviews.author: MrM3000

reviews.title: "GREAT grill"
reviews.text: I have had 1 for 7 years and it has lasted sitting outside those 7 years uncovered. I am getting ready to buy a second 1.
reviews.author: ksjdhf

reviews.title: "very good grill, this is my 2nd one"
reviews.text: Very good grill. Recommend the smoker attachment if you are into that.  This is my second one.  1st one lasted 7 years.
reviews.author: Luke

reviews.title: "Great purchase"
reviews.text: We really love this grill, i wish we would of had them to put it together it took my husband 3 hrs. to put it together.
reviews.author: honeybear

reviews.title: "Best Grill Ever!"
reviews.text: This is a great grill. I looked a long time for a combo grill and this is by far the best. There are some things like hot dogs that I just like over charcoal and then other times the gas side is great when I want to quickly light up and grill a steak after a long day at work. I have had mine for 2 years now and it is well worth the money. I paid $299 for it and so the sale price now makes it an even better deal. I keep mine under a grill cover and have had no problems with it being outside all year. It is spacious-you can cook a lot of food at one time on both the gas and the charcoal side. The gas side is easy to light and adjust the flame. And the side burner is a great added convenience-keeps the hot dog chile warm. It has nice storage too under the grill and is easy to clean up. You won't regret the purchase!
reviews.author: GoodCook

reviews.title: "great grille"
reviews.text: had a party with 40 people and lots of stuff to try out both sides of the grill . did a great job and held everything
reviews.author: cheri

reviews.title: "Grill is best of both worlds"
reviews.text: Just cooked 2 cowboy stk that melted in my mouth . Great to havePropane and charcoal to cook on. Love the grill :)
reviews.author: Buzzell

reviews.title: "Love Duo 5050"
reviews.text: At 59 I've had my share of grills. The 5050 is absolutely the best one I've ever had. I added the fire box and bought the oem grill cover. Gas, charcoal or smoking, it is the best grill ever. I've had mine for 3 years now. I read several complaining about rust. I read the instructions on purchase. How to protect the grill from rust is clearly spelled out in the owners manual. Bottom line, I would buy another one if this one ever needs replacing. Great job Char Grillers!
reviews.author: Charles

reviews.title: "Best Grill I Ever Owned !"
reviews.text: I have had my grill about 3 months now and it is the very best ! Love it love it love it !!!!!!
reviews.author: KJ

reviews.title: "Best Purchase Ever"
reviews.text: Best Purchase Ever!!! I've never owed a Grill that is so HEAVY and well made as this one :)
reviews.author: tntscarby

reviews.title: "review"
reviews.text: great barbecue pit.  This is the second one we have bought.  The other lasted 10 years.
reviews.author: Frankie

reviews.title: "Rusts too easily"
reviews.text: I've made some really good food on this smoker/grill, so I wish I could give it a better review. I have the side firebox and a cover for my grill. I've kept it on a covered patio, but despite that propane side is rusting out. Customer service says that's due to the propane and it's not covered by the warranty. Char-Griller needs to apply rust resistant, high-temp paint to the inside of the propane side to make this grill worth the price. Then it would be a 5* grill.
reviews.author: Smokin' Steve

reviews.title: "Awesome propane & Charcoal Grill!!"
reviews.text: I had my eye on this grill for a while and once it went on sale I got a great price.
reviews.author: riverratbrat

reviews.title: "Summer Fun!"
reviews.text: Love the versatility of having Gas and Charcoal with the optional smoker feature!
reviews.author: LuluT

reviews.title: "forgot how good charcoal cooking was"
reviews.text: We have really enjoyed our grill. We have used the charcoal part more than propane. A totally different taste to all of the food done on charcoal. Just having problems with the knobs on the propane side.
reviews.author: thegriller

reviews.title: "Excellent, Easy to use grill"
reviews.text: We have had this grill for 3 weeks and it is wonderful. It did take 2 people to assemble it. The instructions were not exactly simple but it was still relatively easy to put together with 2 people. However, make sure you allow yourself enough time to assemble it because its time consuming. Once we got the grill together, it was easy to use. However, we did discover that there is not a lot of room to spread out if you are using the side burner. Because, at the time, we were not using the charcoal side, we used that as table top to put the things we were using on and it was sufficient. The only other complaint I have is that there is not quite enough room underneath for the tank, so turning the gas on/off is a little difficult to do. Beyond that, the grill is heavy and sturdy. The fact that it came with hooks for the utensils is awesome. We keep it in the garage until we are ready to use it (preventing the rust that every review we read warned about). We don't have to worry about the kids knocking it over or someone trying to steal it while it is cooling off. Its too heavy to just run off with. Yet, there's a handle to make it easy enough to move out of the garage. Would I buy this grill all over again? YES!
reviews.author: garner4

reviews.title: "char-griller duo gas/charcoal grill"
reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but I am replacing another exactly like it that I have had for 5 years. This is an awesome buy for the price and the grill makes excellent food. I also like the fact that you can order replacement parts. I love this grill which is why I bought a second one. The only con is the grill cover which only lasts about six months. I bought 2 with the previous grill, but will not by one for the new purchase. I am looking for a universal quality one.
reviews.author: Kidd1212

reviews.title: "replacement part impossible to find"
reviews.text: I purchased this grill for my husband for his 48th Birthday (May 2012). We used it regularly as weather permitted in the Northeast, CT. I have to say I've used it and it cooks more evenly than most other grills we've had. The only issue we've run into is that the regulator after two years (his 50th Birthday) Died. We had to replace the regulator for the gas as it stopped working last fall, 1.5 years of use with an average summer use of two to three times a week. The covers that are porcelain covered steel that protect the the burners completely rusted out at the same time. We had to toss them. I can see if we were using heavy marinades or BBQ sauce it might have added to the corrosive effects that lead to their short life span but we don't use them often. My husband calls it a knuckle buster experience replacing the propane tank. He's an engineer and doesn't think the person who designed this unit had the end users knuckles in mind when designing the frame supports that hinder easy access to the area to replace an empty tank with a full tank. I will commend them again on the even cooking and accurate temperature controls of this grill. They just have the send the designers back to school for end user comfort.
reviews.author: Lori

reviews.title: "Awesome!!!"
reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Father's Day! Worth every penny!!!!
reviews.author: redrobin

reviews.title: "FANTASTIC GRILL"
reviews.text: WE JUST LOVE THIS GRILL - IT WAS ALOT OF PARTS TO PUT TOGETHER, BUT WELL WORTH. COOKS INTENSLEY THRU AND THRU EVENLY ON ALL MEATS. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS GRILL TO ANYONE WANTING TO COOK ON CHARCOAL GRILL SOMETIMES AND GAS ANOTHER TIME.! love it!
reviews.author: Nanabeee

reviews.title: "LOVE!!"
reviews.text: I bought this grill at lowes a year ago. Best grill ever!!!!
reviews.author: CeCe

reviews.title: "Wouldn't buy again"
reviews.text: Under a roof with cover it rusted all over in 6 months, can't see burner settings, burners gone after 6-8 uses will turn the gas side into charcoal also.
reviews.author: bsmith

reviews.title: "Outstanding!!"
reviews.text: I purchased the Duo S-5050 from Lowes @ $199.99. Best Grill purchase I've ever made. I grill almost every night all year round and the S-5050 has met every challenge. I have no complaints. After reading the owner's manual, I seasoned (veg. oil) the entire grill per recommendations. Every two weeks I break the grill down for a good cleaning. (Very easy) The S-5050 is very sturdy. It's a beast. I like the storage area underneath, storing my cooking utensils and charcoal chimney.Having both gas and charcoal capability is awesome. Through the week I use propane gas, and on weekends I use charcoal. The temperature on gas side will reach 400+ on high with cover down. I use high to low heat, and yes I do get flare up occasionally. (I got flare up on all my “OTHER” past grills) The S-5050 shows plenty of grilling room on the grates.The S-5050 stands outdoors all year round in the N.Y. weather. I have no complaints about the cover. Its great taking off the cover and having the S-5050 look great. If the cover wears out I'll buy a new one.Overall, the S-5050 grilled (charcoal) the best Beer Can Chickens. The side burner works great for steaming lobsters in a big boiling pan. I will recommend this product to anyone out there. Definitely a winner!!
reviews.author: jegofferjr77

reviews.title: "BBQ Workhorse"
reviews.text: I purchased my Duo 5050 back in 2009, and to date, I have only replaced the heat shields, the burner knobs, and the push button ignition switch. I tricked mine out and added the side fire box, duel rotisserie bar, and a few other toys both from Char Griller. To date, this has been the best BBQ investment I have made to date. Yes - it will rust if not properly cared for. These units are not stainless steel or maintenance free. I brush mine inside and out with peanut oil about three times a year, or as needed and I keep it under a cover when not in use. The only real rust I need to contend with regularly is on my fire box, as the higher sustained heat tends to burn off the paint quicker. Again, I brush it down with peanut oil as needed. Is it maintenance free? Not a chance. Would I recommend this grill to others? In a heartbeat!
reviews.author: Lars

reviews.text: I purchased this grill as a Black Friday gift to myself. Within a few days I purchased the optional smoker to increase it's potential. It was well worth it! This grill has and does it all! I cooked two slabs of ribs, two pork loins, and five pounds of chicken breasts one night using oak wood only. It was amazing. BUY THIS GRILL!!!
reviews.author: TJOHN

reviews.title: "best grill I've ever had"
reviews.text: I've had the grill for 5 years. I had a major grease fire on year 2, due to lack of cleaning.  everything still works great,I'm going to go buy another one tomorrow,because they are on sale.   Love smoking meat on this grill,the side box is awesome, smoke in the box indirect heat on your meat PERFECT 250 degree cooking if you know what your doing. Can't wait to enjoy this new grill for another 5 years at least, giving my old ,still great grill to a buddy.
reviews.author: me

reviews.title: "char-Griller-smoker"
reviews.text: bought this grill about  1 year ago (added the smoker on it )  ( did not get extra warranty ) love it ,worked very well ,did everything that i wanted,smoked ,grilled for the family almost every weekend , after 1 year the grill (back) has already rusted out to the point that it will not hold the grates in it anymore  thought it would last longer  i guess not ,time to look for a better grill, summer is on the way
reviews.author: ken

reviews.title: "dream grill"
reviews.text: My wife bought this for me along with the side firebox attatchment, replacing my old gas grill, so I could smoke our Thanksgiving turducken. First off, assembly was a breeze with the assistance of my 7 & 10 years old daughters, minimal tools and know how required. For the cookery, I was able using the side firebox, to grill sweet potatoes, maintain a consistent temp and replenish fuel quite easily. The propane burner was useful for lighting the charcoal.
reviews.author: bigugly

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: christiebott069

reviews.title: "duo"
reviews.text: I cooked for the first time on my new grill New Years Eve.It was awesome !! the fire control on the charcoal was second to none !! I am extremely pleased with this product ! I Look forward to many years of use . Danny (Crosy,Texas)
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Burnt dogs"
reviews.text: We already had this same grill from almost 10 years ago, but it started to rust out due to it being exposed to the elements and I surprised my honey with a new one this past Labor Day. We had bought the smoker last year so it is nice just to remove it from the old grill and replace it on the new grill. We love the charcoal side and mainly use this section more than the propane, but when there's inclement weather or not much time after work it is nice to have the propane side to cook on. We add flavored wood to the smoker after soaking it in water to get more of a smoke flavor and this grill does everything we want it too, including burning my hotdogs on purpose while everyone else takes there's off too soon.
