The shelf is perfect for baking potatoes, warming buns and throwing corn on while cooking other meats on the lower section. The 3 removable grates make things a lot easier to keep food on when needing to add more wood or charcoal when the smoker isn't being utilized. You only have to remove one grate instead of the whole thing interrupting your cook time.  We just scoot it over to one side if we are using all of the grates and then replace and scoot the food back over. I would recommend getting this and am looking into one for my son-in-law for their new home purchase surprise gift. :)
reviews.author: DragonflyLove

reviews.title: "best bbq ever"
reviews.text: This bbq is great. I bought it , assembled it ( which took alot longer then 45 min the directions stated) cured it and cooked some steaks. Awesome , even heat transfer. Adding the firebox today , and smoking tri tip this weekend.
reviews.author: towman661

reviews.title: "From day one"
reviews.text: After assembly, which was pretty easy, I discovered the gas tank would not fit into the spot provided because it was too small! The rep said blue flame cans don't fit. I pointed out that the product is heavy with advertisement proclaiming is "engineered in America!". Why is it not able to use an American made gas can? Great charcoal side. Love it!Gas side has problem with having too much heat. So hot the coated grates cracked and caused the grates to rust beyond useable status by second season, I replaced them with stainless steel,($60), does cook good though. Also the bun rack is completely rusted and cannot be used at all, now the rusty flake occasionally drop on our food so I will either remove and replace or just remember. I did cut four slices in t he tank port and was able to bend the opening to accommodate holding all of my cans.
reviews.author: MikeMikeMike

reviews.title: "Best Birthday Present Ever"
reviews.text: I bought the grill for my husbands 27th birthday. Upon leaving the store there were about 4 men googling over it( i knew it was a man's gift then) It was essembled in store for free!!! We bungied the grill down inthe back of my husbands pick up truck. on our way home we were cut off and the grill flipped. IT DID NOT HAVE A SCRATCH!!!!! still in PERFECT condition.
reviews.author: KPearce

reviews.title: "Good for 3 years tops"
reviews.text: I was excited about purchasing this grill. While it did bring me a good amount of grilling joy, I was disappointed that the burner completely rusted out after 2 years and the rest of the grill practically is turning into rust dust after 3 years. I'd like to emphasize that I kept it under a covered patio and had a cover for it as well. It never just sat in the rain or anything. Overall, I regret the purchase. Should have bought the Green Egg.
reviews.author: Pitmaster D.

reviews.title: "Great combo grill for even a dummy to use easily"
reviews.text: The only down falls I found in this grill is the price was too high, and it had to be burned(seasoned) lots of times before use for food.Instructions were very expalinatory for as many pieces that it had to put together. I purchase it straight out of the box to assembly completely myself to avoid assembling cost and because I didn't won't to pay for it to be delivery.
reviews.author: Flipper68

reviews.title: "Good Starter Grill, If On Sale"
reviews.text: When I decided on this grill, I did so assuming it would probably begin rusting before fall arrived.  After all, it is made entirely of regular steel and only covered with a thin layer of paint.  I didn't mind too much because I knew with some sanding and repainting I could manage it for a while.  For the sale price I was getting it at, it would serve it's purpose as a first grill and help me learn the advantages and downfalls of each cooking method.  For what was contained in this unit, the price couldn't be beat.  I've so far only used the charcoal portion, but I found being able to adjust the height of the embers was incredibly useful and absent on some other grills in the price range.  Assembly was straightforward, as long as you pay attention to each little detail in the sometimes undersized drawings to ensure everything is oriented correctly. Upon assembly, I was surprised to see significant rust had already began to appear in some of the main support tubes that had begun to bubble and flake paint.  I anticipated repairs, but right out of the box was an extreme disappointment and also not covered by the warranty. I'd only recommend a grill like this to someone who like me has never grilled before and wanted to see which method he or she preferred, and also wasn't afraid of repeated maintenance to maybe only squeeze another year out of the grill before moving on.
reviews.author: McName

reviews.title: "Char-Griller Dual function grill - delivers"
reviews.text: This delivers as advertised, gas grill on one side charcoal on the other and it works very well.  It is heavy to move and took quite a bit of time to assemble.In the over all it works well and has a lot of great features: small tray for cooking tools in front of charcoal grill, storage rack underneath, vent controls, a warmer tray, wheels are thick hard plastic.  Igniter works well.  This can handle the big party, but also the small.
reviews.author: Papa

reviews.title: "Good Starter Grill, If On Sale"
reviews.text: When I decided on this grill, I did so assuming it would probably begin rusting before fall arrived.  After all, it is made entirely of regular steel and only covered with a thin layer of paint.  I didn't mind too much because I knew with some sanding and repainting I could manage it for a while.  For the sale price I was getting it at, it would serve it's purpose as a first grill and help me learn the advantages and downfalls of each cooking method.  For what was contained in this unit, the price couldn't be beat.  I've so far only used the charcoal portion, but I found being able to adjust the height of the embers was incredibly useful and absent on some other grills in the price range.  Assembly was straightforward, as long as you pay attention to each little detail in the sometimes undersized drawings to ensure everything is oriented correctly. Upon assembly, I was surprised to see significant rust had already began to appear in some of the main support tubes that had begun to bubble and flake paint.  I anticipated repairs, but right out of the box was an extreme disappointment and also not covered by the warranty. I'd only recommend a grill like this to someone who like me has never grilled before and wanted to see which method he or she preferred, and also wasn't afraid of repeated maintenance to maybe only squeeze another year out of the grill before moving on.
reviews.author: McName

reviews.title: "A Good Purchase"
reviews.text: I love the grill, have been using it all the time. The grill is not stainless steel, I highly suggest to use a cover especially whenever not in use to prolong its life. I found that the standard cover is more durable, thicker, and intact than the custom cover.My whole family is enjoying it, and that's what counts.
reviews.author: Camy

reviews.title: "3-burner grill with side grill and charcoal grill"
reviews.text: Product is laid out nicely. The sheet metal fit is good and snug. As far as durability, the bolts supporting the upper grill are too weak, bent easily with some weight on them. Sheet metal is not going to last very long-- suspect bottom and ends will burn out quickly. Pans for grease collection are rather flimsy mounted. Would like to have seen exhaust stack on charcoal side to have an adjustment. Support frame and lower shelf is nice.
reviews.author: g-pa

reviews.title: "Love it, Spring, Summer, Fall and Winter!"
reviews.text: I've read the complaints about rust, the rust I have is in the ash tray of the charcoal grill and side fire box for smoking, which their is little of. I wash the out side when needed, and spray it with cooking oil (PAM canola) then light it up. The directions I have say to season it inside and OUT, plus I cover it from rain and fall leaves. It's a beast I've had for seven years now, rust free, and will continue to enjoy for many more!
reviews.author: Gene

reviews.title: "Great gift I received"
reviews.text: My daughter bought this grill for me she also picked up the protection plan. I admit when it comes to propane grills I am a newbie. At 52 years of age this is the first time I have one I've always used charcoal for grilling before. I love how I can start on the charcoal then finish on the propane that is how I usually cook on this grill. When I'm pressed for time I'll just go with the propane. I assembled it myself so I know how to break it down for cleaning. I got this grill in April it is holding up well even with heavy usage. Rust is and won't be a problem because of the dry desert air I also bought a cover for it plus I store it in a covered patio. I most definitely recommend this grill for anyone who likes the versatility of using charcoal , propane or both like I do. The Fourth of July is this Saturday and you can be sure I'll be grilling on it .
reviews.author: Kupchoi

reviews.title: "Good grill to buy"
reviews.text: I've owned this grill over a year now and I have no rusting issues as others have indicated. I used it almost every weekend and it works like charm.
reviews.author: lex

reviews.title: "Smoke and grilling"
reviews.text: I prefer real wood smokers over the pellet or electric types as I feel I get a much better smoke flavor because your actually burning wood. Just don't be a rookie and over-smoke your food. It takes a little practice to get to know the right amount of coals and correct opening of the air vents to get the temp right, but it's usually not too hard to get it to 225F and hold. You'll have to add more coals about every hour or 2. The only thing you need to be careful about is the heat that comes in from the offset smoke box will over-cook the food that is closest to that side. I was able to use the coal tray, which i turned upside down and placed directly under the cooking grates. This dissipated the heat more evenly so that the food nearest the smoke box doesn't cook too fast. Other than that I love this thing for brisket, ribs, turkey tri-tip, and pulled pork...
reviews.author: Smokey Joe

reviews.title: "Awesome"
reviews.text: I have used both the charcoal and gas and they both work great. I would recommend this grill to anyone who loves to grill. Can't wait til the weather warms up to use it more.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Rust bucket."
reviews.text: We bought ours about 5 years ago.  By the end of the second year of being on our uncovered deck, it was un usable, despite always spraying it with cooking oil and using a cover. The water will still splash from the surface underneath it, and it will rust from the bottom out. By the 4th year, (we couldn't stand to throw our expensive grill away just yet, even though it was replaced by a stainless char broil) it had nearly completely desentigrated. Bottoms completely gone, frame tubing collapsed. It went to the garbage man this week. Rust, rust rust, and more rust. Cheap steel. For what it's worth, our stainless char broil has been on the same deck for 4 seasons in the same spot. It's holding up perfectly. The only thing that rusted on it was the grease catch can. We live in a costal environment. About 10 miles inland. If rust is a concern, run away at top speed.
reviews.author: MT

reviews.title: "Whole grill catches fire"
reviews.text: After 6 uses, each one had different fire issues.  If there is anything on top rack that produces grease, as soon as you open the lid the grease drops on the back inside of the lid and the back of the grill, to include the gas line, is in flames.  As soon as grease drips on the deflectors the flames are uncontrollable.  Total piece of crap.
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "unhappy"
reviews.text: we were sold a damaged grill, but we did not see it until we used it. also missing a bolt
reviews.author: nothappy

reviews.title: "Rust is a problem"
reviews.text: Bought this product about 3 years ago and like evryone else RUST RUST RUST. I keep it covered and live in NC so a lot of rain isn't an issue. It's mainly the has side that has rusted. Also be careful of the grease shelf on the gas side. Mine doesn't detach and is VERY hard to clean. I love the grill bit those 2 areas are major problems. If I had to buy this again I would look at other brands first to truly compare.
reviews.author: An old cook

reviews.title: "A Good Buy But Poor Packaging"
reviews.text: The concept of the product is great...having both charcoal and gas. This is the second unit I have purchased. However, two items are a problem. First, there is little replacement parts available for this product. If you review Char-Griller's web page, there are very few parts for replacement. After 5 years, even on a good product, things will have normal wear/tear. The company needs to work on their spare parts replacements. Second is their packaging. With such a large and heavy product, the packaging they spend on it seems to be on the cheap side. Thin walls and little form inserts makes for the product to be damaged if you buy it to take home to put together. Also, I received a unit that was missing the charcoal top that apparently was damaged during shipment. The missing top was a Lowe's mistake upon receiving the unit, but could have been avoided by better packaging.
reviews.author: TheRealHambone

reviews.title: "great grill"
reviews.text: I received this from my wife for early father s day planning to get the smoker add to it .Then we will be set .I also got the grill cover also fits perfect .Thanks to the Sikeston store manger was so nice and polite very nice dress proper attire to fit his title to his work job very professional just what this store needed in a bad way . We will shop there more often now just because of him . Mr. &Mrs. McKinney
reviews.author: Bruce

reviews.title: ""Easy Set Up"?"
reviews.text: This took several hours to put together: opt for letting Lowe's do it! Otherwise, this is a great grill that my husband really likes. Having the "quick cook" propane option is great. Utensil hangers, lower shelving and plenty of racks inside make this a versatile, functional, manly looking addition to any backyard or deck.
reviews.author: Bella232

reviews.title: "Great Deal"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for 300 last year for labor day.still works great. I over tightend the temp gauge on the grill and had to order another one.I had recieved the wrong gauge but just when i was about to call and complain i recieved the correct one . Great customer service. I'm going to buy a second one for 200. Can't beat that deal.Strongly recommend buying a cover if you are planning on keeping it outside.
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Awesome"
reviews.text: Waited till I have used this grill for awhile. Take care of it and it will take care of you. This grill is awesome. Would buy again in heart beat. I cannot stand when people review a product but they are really reviewing other stuff like delivery or customer service. The grill does not control customer service! This grill is a buy. We are avid grillers. We grill a lot. Yes get it. Get the cover that fits it.
reviews.author: Brew72

reviews.title: "I love this grill."
reviews.text: Takes about an hour to put this grill together, then the fun begins. I love having a gas and charcoal all in one.The Grill is a little on the heavy side but I never move it so no big deal. I also like the smoke stacks, makes the grill look cool.
reviews.author: wolfgang

reviews.title: "It's not worth the trouble...."
reviews.text: I searched High and Low for a DUO Charcoal and Propane gas grill for my husband's gift. Unfortunately Lowe's "appeared" to be the only big box store with a few available (1st lie.# I went to two different stores and they only had the floor models available, both damaged. One was less damaged #scratches, nicks# than the other, so I drove back to the original store to purchase. The floor model was difficult to disassemble, plus I had to buy my own screw driver to break it down. #you really have to love the customer service.) I spoke to a "customer service representative" to discuss assistance, warranties, etc. The very educated and helpful response received was " It's a Saturday & we're too busy. You'll have to do it yourself.So we DID.I'm already so disappointed in this product and I haven't even started grilling.It was too much effort, true lack of customer service, and too many challenges to start with. Save your money & buy another grill.
reviews.author: MRSM

reviews.title: "Best Grill I have ever Owned or Used"
reviews.text: I just bought this grill and used it twice already. It is heavy but transportable, sturdy and rugged while well designed to have the grilling tools at the ready. The quality is great and it is easy to clean for future use, it takes mere minutes to get it set-up for a weekend barbeque. I haven't used the propane side yet but the grilling space for each side is great, best grill I have ever owned or used.
reviews.author: Abelm626

reviews.title: "Early Father's Day"
reviews.text: My old grill was about 4-5 years old. My wife asked me if I wanted my Father's Day gift early. She took me to get this grill. I like it so well... that I am going to get my son one as well. It has plenty of room on the gas side, and I think the design of the charcoal side is awesome. This is a great value and lots of fun to cook on. We got it on Memorial Day Weekend, and really gave it a good work out.
reviews.author: Glen

reviews.title: "Great Grill Terrible Quality BUY THE EXTENDED PLAN"
reviews.text: I agree both with all the other reviewers that say how much they love this grill, but I also agree with everyone that complains about the rusting issues. I am no stranger to cast iron and as a matter of precaution I not only purchased the cover, but also oiled this grill down inside and out after every use. Unfortunately, after the first year of owning this grill it still had a significant amount of rust on it. Fortunately though, I purchased the extra protection plan for $39. Without any hassle at all I called the protection plan number, they issued a gift card for the grill and I am going this week to buy the same grill again. Needless to say, I will also be purchasing the protection plan again. The quality of the food produced makes it worth the hassle, and even if the next grill produces the same rusting result, you can't complain about getting a new grill every year for only $39!
reviews.author: Griller86

reviews.title: "Nice grill, but they rust rather quickly."
reviews.text: I use both sides. Gas for a quick meal, charcoal for when I have the time. Cooks fairly even. I do wish it were made of better steel, as they tend to rust rather quickly and replacement parts are pricey. The warming racks and bottom tubs are the worst culprits. Not certain I will buy another after this ones lifespan has run its course. They're simply too rusty. But they work well while they last.
reviews.author: Kyle

reviews.title: "I purchased the Char-Grill 5050"
reviews.text: Excellent product, much better than the price would suggest. We have used it often, and after six month, I am still amazed at how well it functions. Just remember to pick up the cover when you buy the grill, well worth the cost.

reviews.title: "I purchased this last September...,wow"
reviews.text: I don't understand how .....I've used this grill less than 10 times since I've bought it last September.....and the first time I fire it up this season......boom the igniters are dead.....seriously HOW?.....very disappointed.

reviews.title: "A little disappointed"
reviews.text: I've had the grill for about two and a half years. I bought the manufacturer's specific cover to help protect the grill. Starting last year the grill started rotting on the bottom of the grill on the propane side. Not sure how or why that would happen but it did and I'm basically expecting to be throwing this grill out next spring. I get it was only a few hundred dollars but I expected better.

reviews.title: "Gives you options"
reviews.text: The overall setup is a great idea. Side burner is great to start char-coal and large room for cooking on both gas or char-coal. But when you put the side smoker on you have to remove the handle and the metal is not that thick that hold it together so adds strain to the side of the char-coal part. Would have been nice to have some way to put handle higher so you could still use it for moving.

reviews.title: "Great grill/smoker. Hope it lasts"
reviews.text: My service was great by a young man at the store who helped me. I am greatful. The younger man whi helped me with moving this large duo bbq'er to the checkout & to my truck was being humiliated by his older more expierence male co-worker. I felt he needed a special thank you due to his aweful upper manager. Sorry I didnt get their names but I am sure I wouldn't be hard to figure out.sheila.
reviews.author: Sheila

reviews.title: "Junk!"
reviews.text: I've been using this grille for over a year now. It won't stay lit EVER. 5 MINUTES max... I relight it 20 times every time I use it. Customer service just gives me bs on how to reset it or there's a spider web in there... what a joke. I replaced the tank 5 times. Replaced the whole propane system twice. Same problem. Complete junk! The charcoal side works fine. Hard to mess up a box I guess
reviews.author: Zac

reviews.title: "Best Grille we have ever had - period !"
reviews.text: After reading the other reviews I felt I should add my experience with this "Char Griller" unit. We have had this grille for 3 or 4 years now and it sits covered ( factory vinyl cover that obviously helps preserve the finish all year long in the NE ) on our outside open deck.  NO rust at all, no failures, and built like a brick s--t house.  Quite heavy as an assembled unit.  I feel the quality is heavier gauge and built better than most since this steel Grille has held up better so far than any of the other stainless steel units, of which we have had four or five over the years.  They literally burned out and/or fell apart in not so long of a time.  I replaced the gas tube burners in a couple grilles and the last one three different times as the perforated lines burn out after a while.  We don't use the gas burner often although it works fine.  Also worth mentioning is the fact that the ignition system for the gas side has NEVER failed and works flawlessly still EVERY time for EVERY burner.  I had to resort to a long end lighter for most of the burners in the past grilles.  The Char Griller gas side heats within 500° to 600° in 5 to 6 minutes with only three burner tubes.  We often use the charcoal side for steaks, ribs, and burgers when time permits.  Obviously the gas side heats quicker and gets used about the same amount of time for burgers, hot dogs, and whatever else when time is more limited.  Everything is still in great condition with absolutely no issues ever.  As far as we are concerned, this is the best Grille we have ever had and will buy another if and when the time comes.  There are good stainless steel units with guarantees, but the prices are two to three times the cost of the Char Griller ( ours was on sale for a good bit less than they are now back when we bought ours off season ).  I stick with what works best for us and this unit is it- hands down.  I love our Griller.
reviews.author: DenHum

reviews.title: "Duo 3-Burner (40800 BTU) Liquid Porpane Gas Grill"
reviews.text: Nice looking Gas Grill, but poor quality of the product... For the last year had swapped two of those with the same issue. Over all, not good... There are some better products for the same price.

reviews.title: "GREAT GRILL FOR MEN AN WOMEN"
reviews.text: BOUGHT MY DUO 5050 3 YEARS AGO AND LIKE IT ALOT. USE IT AS MUCH AS I CAN ! HOLDING UP WELL,SEASONING IS THE KEY FOR SURE. ONLY 2 COMPLAINTS. WARMING RACK ON COAL SIDE RUSTING TOO SOON AND COVER THAT I GOT AT TIME OF PURCHASE IS FADEING BADLY. OH 1 MORE THE THERMOMETER QUIT ON COAL SIDE! WORKS WELL FOR THE WIFE SHE DOES NOT LIKE TO MESS WITH CHARCOAL SO THE GAS SIDE WORKS WELL FOR HER
reviews.author: LUKE

reviews.title: "Love the grill....but!"
reviews.text: I love using this grill for all of the outings we have, I only have one complaint about it! Two of the grates that I cook my food on, do not fit properly! Other than that, it is awesome!!
reviews.author: Jcopp

reviews.title: "the best of both grilling worlds"
reviews.text: this is my second purchase of the same grill, I bought one as a birthday present for my son a year ago

reviews.title: "Best of both worlds"
reviews.text: To me this is an out door kitchen on wheels. I needed something to roast , smoke and grill on and this is it. The fire box add on is a must and works very well. The cover fits great too.

reviews.title: "Overalll a great grill!"
reviews.text: We've had this grill for several months and use it quite often. So far, it has been a great grill with no problems. We also attached the smoker to the right side and the combination works well. For the price, I think you will be hard-pressed to find a better deal. Don't forget the cover which fits perfectly over the three smoke stacks and the smoker--if you add it to the side.

It's absolutely inspired me to get into grilling. I would recommend this grill to anyone and everyone. Looking forward to adding the smoker soon, which will open up even more options. Stoked!

Called about issue and was sent a new gas regulator Didn't help still runs Hot 280. wrote in to complain was told Going much below 280 wasn't possible its not intended to slow cook.

reviews.text: This is the perfect grill. It's got the best of both worlds. Quick no mess cooking of gas and the unique flavor of charcoal grilling.

reviews.title: "Fit and finish is terrible"
reviews.text: Just bought this grill and assembled it. I have not even used it but see the fit and finish is poor. There are many points where I can see failure happening. I also purchased the side firebox and that's a whole other story of fail. I'll need sealing tape if I ever plan to use this for smoking (hint...I do) and I'll need to seal the seams as they look poorly welded.
reviews.author: WillH

reviews.title: "Char Griller Duo Grill"
reviews.text: I love this grill! Bought new in April 2010 and still going strong in January 2016 however starting to show its age; primarily from use and old age. It is starting to rust out, mostly on the gas side (See Below) but that is to be expected. I originally assumed it would last maybe 3 or 4 years and that was all I expected and yet I'm still using it almost 6 years in. I did rub it down with vegetable oil and fired it up prior to 1st use to season it and I attribute that to its long life. I'm guessing the reviewers whom are having rust problems after only a year or two did not perform this critical step, if you buy one of these, DO THIS STEP FIRST! I do have a cover but I seldom use it. This grill is stored outside in Sacramento CA and I have used it year round at least 1 to 3 times a week since new. It is located under a 10x10 pop up canopy. I also have two other friends with the same grill that are going strong after 5 years whom also did the same seasoning process. You need to understand that this is a metal unit painted with high heat paint and not enameled like a Weber Kettle or similar unit so some routine maintenance & upkeep is to be expected and required; if it starts to rust; sand and paint it with high heat BBQ paint. Two years ago I did have to replace the gas side heat shields. I made new ones from stainless steel about a $7 fix. At the same time I converted it to natural gas and plumbed it into my home gas line. No kit available so I drilled the jets out and purchased gas lines from Lowes. Works Great, burns hotter than propane which it great for searing and grilling steaks etc. I can now get over 700 degrees for a great sear if and when desired. I also replaced the thermometers with some better ones I purchased from Lowes, about $7 each. The electric starters and side burner died shortly after conversion that but no big deal, I light it with a long nose lighter, again they were 4+ years old. I'm planning on buying another one of these plus the smoker box attachment this spring, However I will hang on to this unit as a backup as the charcoal side is still very usable. One can never have enough grills! My only complaint is that Char Griller does not offer any kind of natural gas conversion kit or even offer just the replacement gas jets; you have to purchase the entire propane hose/regulator setup to get new jets. I highly recommend this grill to any one and have been more than satisfied.
reviews.author: rfdonner

reviews.title: "Love my DUO"
reviews.text: I started with a standard Charcoal CharGriller, added the side firebox for smoking, and then later upgraded to the DUO. I brought my side firebox over from the previous grill so that I can continue with my Smoking. While I gave up about 1/4" of the space in the charcoal side coming from the Pro to the DUO, it's been well worth it to have the flexibility of using the propane for a quicker grilling when I don't have time to wait for the Charcoal to heat up. I also love the fact that pretty much every part on the Chargrillers are replaceable from the manufacturer. My previous Pro CharGriller lasted me for 8 years, and was still going strong when I upgraded to the DUO. I replaced a few parts over the years as things rusted out, etc. If you really want these to last a long time plan on buying a new cover for the grill every year, and make sure you clean it out after using and put the cover on it to protect it from the elements.

reviews.text: This is our second dual function grill. Our first lasted 8 years. This one is much more heavy duty than our last. We expect it will last much longer. The option of having charcoal to use in colder weather is a great option. Easy enough to put together, but the time frame in the instructions is way off. Took about 4 hours total.

reviews.title: "Grill number two"

reviews.title: "My dream grill on a budget!"

I can hardly wait to buy the fire-box and custom smoke some meats, maybe even invest in a rotisserie!
reviews.author: Bj-gonnaBBQ

reviews.title: "Extremely happy with the grill so far."
reviews.text: I love this grill. It has everything I need and more. I purchased it at full price after waiting for months to go on sale. I don't regret it a bit, as it is worth every penny. I also bought the cover and side firebox at the same time because I figured I'd like to do it right the first time. I put separate reviews on those items and would encourage you to look those up if you're seriously interested in this set up.The eventual home for this guy is under a covered patio. That should help some with the weather concerns and rusting out as fast as some of the other reviews. I built it slightly different from the directions, as I want to use it as a built in rather than have it freestanding on the legs and wheels. If you choose this option, be warned, it is really heavy and a bit tricky to assemble, especially with the firebox installed. Basically you just don't put the legs on, and bolt everything else up but you use the crossbar supports as feet and let the firebox hang off the counter top or whatever you are using for your built in. In this configuration, the drip pans just barely clear the counter. I had assembled it completely in the garage on a workbench and then carried it with help to its final home. This way I was assured of getting everything tight and square.Features: Gas SideThe gas side is a 3-burner that seems to heat evenly. Be cautious as you can easily overheat this grill. Even with all 3 burners on low, the temperature rose quickly to over 400 degrees with no food on the grate. If you overheat it, you will void your warranty and peel the paint prematurely. To get lower temps, you only need to light 1 or 2 burners. The controls and lighter are great. Large easy to use smooth turning knobs and easy to light. Nice. the side burner is excellent with plenty of heat. On my last grill the side burner was practically useless. Not here. I can see boiling water quickly on this one. It cooks better than my last propane only, relatively expensive grill.The first meal I cooked on the gas side was BBQ chicken breasts. They came out fantastic, juicy and not burned around the edges, but still with delightful grill marks on the meat. Cleanup wasn't too bad and most of the sauce came off the grates pretty easily.Features: Charcoal SideI really like the adjustable venting to control the temperature and I was able to do so surprisingly well with the smoke box installed. It is just balancing the intake and exhaust. It would have been nice to have a removable ash pan without having to remove the cooking grates, but I'm not sure how this would have been possible. My charcoal grate was welded at the factory crooked on its pan. It bothers me a bit but doesn't affect the function at all. I think you'd have to wait for it to cool entirely before emptying the ash, as you need to remove the grates and the fingers to remove the pan and since it is all welded it isn't easy to get totally empty. The fingers to raise and lower the coals is really nice. I really like the condiment rack on the front too. Overall, very good.With the side firebox installed, I was able to cook baby-back ribs for 5 hours with little difficulty. It was easy to maintain the temperature and keep the fire going. I even used the firebox to cook some hot dogs for the family for lunch while smoking the ribs. Bonus double duty.Seasoning:I took the time to get some spray 100% olive oil and followed the instructions meticulously. I oiled it inside and out and made sure to cover all the seams and welds. Use a rag and work it into every space you can see and feel. Then it is time to season the grill which will take about 4 hours. If you skip this step, or to repeat the process occasionally you can be assured of a shorter life of this grill.I have owned several grills over the years, mostly propane gas stainless types. They have lasted years and needed little maintenance. After reading the reviews, and purchasing this one, I am convinced that this is not a grill for the amateur griller. It will need more time, care and maintenance than I ever gave my others. I fully understand that it will not last as long being cast iron, but at the price and with care I should be able to get many good seasons out of it. This grill will give professional results if you put the time and care into it.
reviews.author: RobH

reviews.title: "So many pieces"
reviews.text: I wish I had allowed Lowes to put it together for me. The delivery was fast. I was impatient and so I put it together myself. I have never had so many pieces on the other Lowes BBQ pits. I do have to admit, it is a grill, pit, and side burner. My others were grills. In the end it sure was some good south LA cooking!
reviews.author: Mareas

reviews.title: "All In One"
reviews.text: Now I can do it all from one source. Crab, shrimp and crawfish boil on the burner. The ease of gas bar-b-q on the gas grill and being able to use charcoal when I want in the charcoal grill. Am ordering the smoker attachment next so then I will even be able to smoke meat. Gonna be a great summer for outdoor cooking.
reviews.author: Rusty

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I moved to SC about a year ago and this grill was the first thing I bought when I got here. I use this grill 3 to 4 times a week and just love it. I prefer cooking with charcoal and I use the gas side as a warmer. It's a quality grill and is built to last. I would recomend this grill to anyone that loves to grill.
reviews.author: Catfish

reviews.title: "Great grill, good construction!"
reviews.text: Just purchased this grill as a gift for my husband. It seems to be pretty sturdy but I did take the advice of others and buy the extended warranty. I had great customer service at the Lowe's store in Brevard, NC! Judy went above and beyond to meet the online price and to make sure I was satisfied with my purchase!
reviews.author: DebH

reviews.title: "This grill meets and exceeds my expected needs"
reviews.text: I bought this grill for the gas and charcoal capabilities, plus added the attachable smoker grill.So far I have used this grill as a gas grill and a charcoal grill. This grill has cooked for me as an exceptional grill beyond my original expectations.I am exited to be able to use the additional smoker box later.
reviews.author: cassman47

reviews.title: "Great Deal!!!"
reviews.text: My fiance has had his eye on this particular grill for about 2 years now. We finally made the purchase and used it for the first time this weekend and were astounded by how well the grill operated and how delicious the food came out. I would definitely recommend making this purchase as it is well worth the money.
reviews.author: Janine

reviews.title: "Worst Barbeque"
reviews.text: I DIDN'T USE PROPANE SIDE TIL YESTERDAY. I LOT THE GRILLS NEXT THING I KNEW THERE'S A FIRE BETWEEN TANK AND HOSE.HAD TO CALL FIRE DEPT. TO PUT OUT .NEW BARBEQUE DESTROYED. THE HOSE HAS A LARGE PLASTIC HANDLE TO TIGHTEN HOSE TO TANK.I TIGHTEN TIL I COULDN'T ANYMORE .MY LOSE NEVER TRUST THAT KIND OF HANDLE AGAIN.
reviews.author: DG

reviews.title: "Worst Barbeque"
reviews.text: I DIDN'T USE PROPANE SIDE TIL YESTERDAY. I LOT THE GRILLS NEXT THING I KNEW THERE'S A FIRE BETWEEN TANK AND HOSE.HAD TO CALL FIRE DEPT. TO PUT OUT .NEW BARBEQUE DESTROYED. THE HOSE HAS A LARGE PLASTIC HANDLE TO TIGHTEN HOSE TO TANK.I TIGHTEN TIL I COULDN'T ANYMORE .MY LOSE NEVER TRUST THAT KIND OF HANDLE AGAIN.
reviews.author: DG

reviews.title: "Already rusted!"
reviews.text: This grill was bought for me on Mother's Day 2014. I noticed within a few weeks rust on the inside of the grill under the burners on the bottom . It is kept under a cover, so my guess is that the moisture came from condensation. I have a grill that has sat outside covered for years and doesn't have rust on it.
reviews.author: TNTR

reviews.title: "Best grill I've used!!!"
reviews.text: The amount of options this grill offers makes it worth it. Gas for quick. Charcoal for old fashioned taste. Combined it equals a ton of surface area to cook on., I bought the smoker attachment and have smoked a lot on it. Just like anything it could be better. But for the price I don't think I've used better.
reviews.author: Aaron Livingston

reviews.title: "I've had various BBQ's over the years and I really like it"
reviews.text: I use this unit year round, I like the exhaust vents on top to help keep the heat regulated. I had a Kenmore that would get to 600 degrees with one burner. I want to get the full length rotisserie and the smoker box but can't visualize being able to use the side cooker, smoker and rotisserie at the same time.
reviews.author: Mikey, dad, pops

reviews.title: "Sturdy and convienent"
reviews.text: I recieved one of these BBQs in Aug 2012 and it's still going (It's Jun 2017), I've had to do some repainting of the inside and some of the grates and burner covers needed to be replaced but the burners are near mint cond still. I would not hesitate to buy another. BTW I use mine year round and fairly often.
reviews.author: JRoc987

reviews.title: "Great Grill and smoker"
reviews.text: We grill year round and this is our second Char grill combo with the smoker box. We enjoy using it weekly and year round. The other one lasted about five years which is good in Florida weather. Lowes does a grest job with assembling and delivery which I would highly recommend with the weight of the grill.
reviews.author: Sunny

reviews.title: "Good grill some issues"
reviews.text: Grill is decent, I added the firebox to the charcoal side and use it more as a smoker. The grill has A LOT of leaks and gaps that allow heat and smoke to escape. Most of my grill is covered with vent tape to seal up gaps. It works well now but looks like a redneck grill. Definitely rusting quickly as well.
reviews.author: SmokeKing

reviews.title: "Absolutely the best grill I've ever owned!"
reviews.text: I have had many grills through the years, and this one is my favorite. I mostly use the charcoal side, but the gas comes in handy when time is a factor. My next purchase will be the side fire box. I want to try smoking, and a simple modification to this grill is very economical vs buying a separate setup.
reviews.author: Don Goff

reviews.title: "Char-Griller GRill"
reviews.text: Just starting with it and so far so good. Enjoy having the choice of gas or coal/logs with the fire box attachment it is so go. When you get it together you need to make sure it is in place for the most part as it is heavy and awkward to move with the fire box on it. This should be a great summer for BBQ.
reviews.author: Bluesooner

reviews.title: "Awesome Grill!"
reviews.text: I have owned this grill for over 7 years now and it is just now starting to show signs of needing to be replaced! I have cooked on this thing A LOT! I put the smoker box on it so it is 3 grills in one. I do not have a cover and the thing just keeps on going!  My next grill.....Will be a new one of these!
reviews.author: Tooter

reviews.title: "High quality, low price"
reviews.text: Probably the best grill I've ever owned. Cooks evenly and has plenty of room for plenty of food. The gas and charcoal sides both work extremley well. I also have the side firebox but haven't used it yet. Don't spend $$$$ on Weber. This grill much nicer unit than the more expensive brands in my opinion
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Great product!"
reviews.text: I liave the simplicity of the gas and the flavor from the charcoal. I use the gas on those nights when we are in a hurry or just want a quick meal before a game. The charcoal is my weekend go to. Whether its smoking a nice rack of ribs or a pork butt, the flavor is amazing. This is a definite keeper.
reviews.author: Just dad

reviews.title: "You need a master degree to put it together"
reviews.text: Gas flames are to close to the food. the coal side is perfect!!!!! over all not to bad.
reviews.author: tntscarby

reviews.title: "good purchase"
reviews.text: just bought this today. Went in for the 3 burner gas, came out with the duo. Not bad putting together. Husband has his charcol grill, I have my gas, best of both worlds, used the charcol side tonight!
reviews.author: beeski

reviews.title: "C-Man"
reviews.text: This is a great grill. Several of the other reviews talk about rust. If they would have read the book that came with it , they would have saw that you have to season it with cooking spray once a month to avoid rust. Uses little charcoal or wood to maintain heat. Going on 6 years with mine.
reviews.author: C-Man

reviews.title: "excellent grill."
reviews.text: Best grill I have ever owned. Easy to put together, only a couple of tools needed. Very well constructed. I love this grill, I like the option of gas or charcoal. Plenty of grill surface on both sides. I waited a couple of years for the price to come down, glad I did, well worth the wait.
reviews.author: Bartman01

reviews.title: "Good grill for the money"
reviews.text: Perfect for larger get togethers and versitile. Lots of grill for the money. Holds heat well. Like the barrel look. Smoker attachment adds even more versatility. Will eventually start to rust out, however, a cover and good parts availability help with that. Would buy again for the price.
reviews.author: Bob the griller

reviews.title: "Will not dissapoint"
reviews.text: This is the end of the 5th summer that I've owned this grill and on the whole I'm very satisfied with it. During that time I've had to replace the 3 covers that sit over the top of the gas burners. That was after the 3rd season of cooking. Also the electric starter stopped working this year so we just manually light it, no big deal. Forgot to mention that we grill year round here in NC and use both sides about equally with my wife using the gas side when I'm not home. There was some significant rust where the supports for the burners covers rest on. I had to add a few modifications to keep the covers in place. But overall I got my money's worth. Just keep seasoning it every year and it will last. I'll probably get another one when the price drops back down to $250. Right now it's not an emergency so I can wait to save the 50 bucks. Also, don't waste your money on a cover, it will fall apart after1 + years and really might do more harm than good keeping the moisture trapped adding to the rust problem.
reviews.author: orion619

reviews.title: "Worst Grill Ever"
reviews.text: Wish I had listened to the reviews. This is the worst grill we have ever owned. Started rusting in a month - useless after 3. Actually buying a new grill today this thing is so bad.
reviews.author: Omillertime

reviews.title: "Purchased 3 burner gas/charcoal grill with side"
reviews.text: The gift was available very quickly. The grill was preassembled at the store in Houston.My son-in-law had to tighten all of the bolts since the grill was wobbly. I haven't seen it yet. I am hoping I didn't make a mistake with this grill.
reviews.author: Judy

reviews.title: "Ash pan welds cracking."
reviews.text: I am on my second Char Griller 5050. My only complaint is the ash pan welds are cracking. I want to buy a new ash pan but they are really expensive. I have fixed mine with some bolts and washers but I would prefer a new pan. I'll keep searching. Maybe the price will come down.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Best Grill Ever"
reviews.text: Bought this Grill 6 years ago. Though its not really portable, it have taken it on group camping trips half a dozen times- yes I had to retighten screws on the base when I got home. It has survived 2 moves- one across the country. I mostly grill on the charcoal side, and I light the charcoal with the side burner and chimney style holder. I have the rotisserie attachment, and while I would prefer it it was a bit higher, it works fine. Gas side is excellent for indirect heat cooking for beer can chickens, or salmon on a plank. BBQ is ready for its 3rd fabric cover, and I replaced the gas heat shields 2 years ago. I have the smoker attachment and used it only once. Nearly smoked out the neighbours. It worked well, but best if you live in the country. The adjust on the left burner broke, and now trying to decide if I should replace the manifold (Love that you can buy parts and repair the unit), or just buy a new unit and take this to my parents, where I grill occasionally. Easily the best grill I have ever owned.
reviews.author: Fred Girller

reviews.title: "RUST"
reviews.text: Got this for a gift on Fathers Day 2016, by the speing of 2018 the gas side has rusted away. contacted the company web site about replacement. and they will not do anything without sales receipe. As I got it as a gift I don't have a receipt. so I'm left with a rusted hunk.
reviews.author: Dodgeboy

reviews.title: "Great BBQ"
reviews.text:
The installation went very smooth and took approx 2 hours. 
Instructions were clear and no parts were missing.
We like to BBQ using both propane & charcoal briquettes so this particular unit fit the bill very well for us.
So far we're very satisfied with our purchase.
reviews.author: GolfScotchCigar

reviews.title: "Most AWESOME Grill"
reviews.text: I love the option of using charcoal, wood, or gas to cook. I put off buying one of these too long, it's the greatest. I can sear on the gas and slow cook on the charcoal or with small wood, or cook on the charcoal and finish up over gas. Its just the right grill for me.
reviews.author: peanutwhistle

reviews.title: "Gas/Charcoal Grill Combo"
reviews.text: Great grill. Easy to use and efficient. Love the cooking options.
reviews.author: Farmall

reviews.title: "coolest thing i've bought in a while"
reviews.text: well against my innermost thoughts, and to make everyone in the family(extended) happy i purchased this unit, loaded it up and came home with, little bit heavy but not too bad, figured out that if you come out wheels first to the ground it's no problem, if you want to move it far pick it up higher than you would think grab the legs and it balances out just fine. made my wife happy that she didnt have to help me out getting it out the truck,on to the grill/pit, igniator was full of water(didn't work), 1 knob inside broken, called very helpful lady at lowes and she said come on in and get some more, no problem i love lowes and am there alot.fired up gas side with a match and worked like a charm,all in all the pit/grill burn down worked great, tomorrow nite here come the ribeyes.....also directions for burn down a little unhelpful, 2 different things they said to do, but overcame thatcooked ribeyes on charcol side, came out if i do say so my self the best yet.not bad pit/pits for the price will see how it lasts>>>
reviews.author: fump 09

reviews.title: "Duel fuel & smoker"
reviews.text: After getting the grill, I added the firebox (Table top grill). I am now using it more as a smoker than a grill. With the smoker, I can smoke meats, fish, a turkey, and vegetables. The gas grill is fast, but if you have the time, the smoker is well worth the effort.
reviews.author: bobinoak

reviews.title: "rust"
reviews.text: 1 year later the backing plate that holds the grates rusted off on the propane side. I live in NC the weather was not the issue
reviews.author: craig

reviews.title: "Decent for the price"
reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this grill is that it is not sturdy. In that I mean its very flimsy and wobbly. Other than that, it is a real "man" grill. I recommend that if you purchase this grill that you also purchase the cover and the attachable smoker box.
reviews.author: Stryker1Actual

reviews.title: "Seems well built"
reviews.text: Wife bought it for my birthday, seems well built haven't used it yet but it's only been 4 days, I also did some reviews on the grill cover and 98% said worst product and would not recommend bc of cheap quality but for the grill I would def recommend the grill!!!!!
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Outstanding Grill"
reviews.text: I am in love with this grill, and have only used the gas side twice! The temp is quick to 500 degrees with one burner on. Makes for searing the meat easy. Holds temperature really well, and I cannot wait to use the smoker side with the added fire box. Well Done!
reviews.author: Marshall

reviews.title: "Do yourself a favor and get the Weber."
reviews.text: Kept the cover on it quite religiously, which is why it probably lasted 2 seasons for me as opposed to just one. Going into the 3rd year the pain on the inside is falling off into our grilled food. Flavorizer bars have pretty much disintegrated at this point.
reviews.author: dnabrice

reviews.title: "Rusty Legs"
reviews.text: I love my 5050. I take great care of it. I have a design flaw with the legs. Having the caps on the legs holds moisture inside. This causes the legs to rust from the inside out. I would recommend having a hole in the middle of the caps to let moisture out.
reviews.author: Indiana

reviews.title: "great but missing parts"
reviews.text: We ordered the grill assembled. Once we got it home realized one cooking grate is missing on the propane side and one cooking grate was broken on the charcoal side. Aside from that, no complaints!! Works fine, just need to call Lowe's and get those parts!
reviews.author: sabgjd

reviews.title: "overall this is a good buy"
reviews.text: The store put this together and left off the wire shelf. I still don't have this item nor do I have the manual detailing how to season and generally take care of this grill.as for the pros and cons I cannot make any statement for I cannot use the grill.
reviews.author: Felton

reviews.title: "Only grill you will ever want to buy again!"
reviews.text: Great for any occasion and can grill or smoke anything on it. The perfect all all around grill. I have had mine a little over. Year and I use mine at least 3 days a week! Very well constructed. I highly recommend adding the side fire box for smoking
reviews.author: ChrisSD

reviews.title: "it was great when I first got it. BUT"
reviews.text: It's was very nice when I first got it. but the Gas side it just fell apart after a year It rusted away so fast Now I can not use it and it is not wroth to get a replacement parts. I could buy a hole new one. we still use the charcoal side for now.
reviews.author: peb

reviews.title: "Does the Job!"
reviews.text: Purchased this about a month ago now and have no issues so far.  A lot of people complaining about it not lasting for more than 3 years....seems unrealistic for the price of the unit which if you're willing to wait a bit, goes on sale all the time!
reviews.author: Robtash

reviews.title: "Good grill for price"
reviews.text: Really like the charcoal/gas/side burner features. The main drawback is it's very wobbly even after tightening up the screws - stripped one without too much effort. The actual grilling sections are very heavy, so the base needs extra cross support.
reviews.author: Blondie

reviews.title: "Awesome Grill"
reviews.text: I just love this grill. My wife bought this on Black Friday along with the side smoker attachment and custom cover. Cover lasted for two years but as far as the grill I highly recommend this. I have grilled and smoked so much meat with this setup.
reviews.author: JJ Smoker

reviews.title: "Rust pit"
reviews.text: The features of the grill are great. However most of the grill parts rust very easily. Piece of junk. DONT BUY THIS GRILL, if you want it to last more than 2 years without having to replace burner covers, and grill racks, ( which are very costly.
reviews.author: dissapointed

reviews.title: "Great BBQ"
reviews.text: This BBQ is great because you can use gas or charcole. The gas grill works great and is alot higher quality than the last gas BBQ I had. Very easy to clean. The charcoal side can be used simular to a smoker with the stack thet can be closed off.
reviews.author: Aaron

reviews.title: "Just learning how to BBQ / Best 1st Time Grill"
reviews.text: I bought this grill 4 years ago and it has been great. I already knew how to do the BBQ basics in regards to steaks, chicken breast, pork chops etc. I figured this grill would be the perfect grill to take my BBQ cooking to the next level. I did purchase the side firebox to start smoking food and test the capabilities of this grill. Since buying this grill I have learned how to do pork shoulders, whole chicken, ribs and brisket. This grill is great for anyone wanting to do the occasional BBQ or to do more advanced cooks. It has held up very well through the years being that I live close to the Gulf of Mexico. I cook on it at least 1-2 times a week. I don't have any holes or major rust spots on the grill due to keeping it covered under a patio and also under a grill cover. I just purchased the Char Griller Kamado Ceramic Grill due to reliability and overall satisfaction I have experienced with this grill. I would recommend this grill to anyone and in fact I bought my cousin one when he bought his first house. I hope this review helps. Cheers.
reviews.author: Brad Moore

reviews.title: "All seem ok... for now"
reviews.text: Well after one use the paint under the charcoal part pealed.  The assembly instruction are not every clear.  I also had one grill that in 2 pieced.  That said it looks and works great for now... not sure what it will look like in a year or so.
reviews.author: Pierre51

reviews.title: "I love this grill"
reviews.text: I have had mine for 5 or 6 yrs. now, I have had to replace the regulator and grill racks but other than that it has held up great! I love the dual option and bought the smoker box to add on. We have had some great success with smoking as well.
reviews.author: Smokin Joe

reviews.title: "great grill"
reviews.text: We bought the combo gas/charcoal grill approx 1.5 months ago, it has worked great and when you use both the grills at one time you can really put some food on the table. Very nice to streamline and do away with the multiple grills on the deck.
reviews.author: scott

reviews.title: "Versatile and Capable"
reviews.text: This is a solid and effective piece of equipment.  I enjoy having the option of cooking with propane or charcoal.  My only concern (common for most grills) if flare up due to no substantial buffer/barrier between cooking grates and burners.
reviews.author: eegates

reviews.title: "We bought our second one after almost 4 years"
reviews.text: Gas side for after work nights, charcoal for the weekends. We first purchased this grill in 2015. My husband loves the commodity of having 1 grill and having it all so when it came time to purchase a new grill he wanted the same one he had.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Very durable!"
reviews.text: I've had this model for about 5 years and it is used year round. Even in harsh northern michigan winters! Previous BBQs would rot out in a couple years. The only parts that I'm going replace next year are the grease covers and the igniter.
reviews.author: Nanook of the Nort

reviews.title: "Best grill I've owned"
reviews.text: I haven't found anything that I can't cook on this grill. You can prepare an entire meal or have the biggest backyard bar-b-q ever. The price was reasonable compared to the big name grills.I would definitely recommend this grill to anyone.
reviews.author: Way711

reviews.title: "Duo"
reviews.text: I've been looking for a long time for a combo gas/charcoal grill. already used the smoker to do up some pork. Turned out great. I put it together myself and it took about 2 hrs. , no hurrying. I would recommend this combo grill to anyone.
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "GREAT cooking FUN FUN Grill!"
reviews.text: I recently replaced a not too old, top line grill. It was well made, with great customer support. You know the one I'm referring to...starts with a letter near end of alphabet. It's a great grill, but this one is simply more fun to cook on. The gas section gets extremely hot, nearly "pegging" the thermometer at 700 degrees. Not sure about the accuracy, but the grill is extremely hot, letting out considerable heat when opened and allowing a really loud sizzle. When you factor in the charcoal section, allowing you to use both cooking methods at once...it's a party. Andf...as we all know, NOTHING is better than natural lump charcoal seasoned with a bit of hickory chunk wood. It simply cooks great and is fun to use. The downside, this grill will last two years, maybe three, if stored in the garage over the winter. It's simply not made to stand the test of time, but at 299.00 I'll be buying another when this erodes to rust. I have not used a grill that is a much fun or cooks as well. Was not the easiest to assemble...Hope this helps with your decision.
reviews.author: gtny

reviews.title: "use year round"
reviews.text: I use it to cook everything. I'am a guy, if it can be cooked on the grill I will find a way. I even cook pot roast with all the fixins rite there on on grill. I was thinking there was a smoker attatchment but i can't seem to find it.
reviews.author: Bobby

reviews.title: "Much better them my national brand purchased"
reviews.text: The only issue: No prep or tray holding station.Quick fix- is to use one side or the other when not in use.This is a solid piece of equipment.I give it 5 beers out of 6 :)Would of rated 6 beers but for the time to construct it.
reviews.author: Charles

reviews.title: "Much better them my national brand purchased"
reviews.text: The only issue: No prep or tray holding station.Quick fix- is to use one side or the other when not in use.This is a solid piece of equipment.I give it 5 beers out of 6 :)Would of rated 6 beers but for the time to construct it.
reviews.author: Charles

reviews.title: "Great Grill"
reviews.text: I use this grill 3 to 4 times a week, year round. The key to this grill is to keep a layer of cooking oil on the inside and out. Do this every time you use it. This is the second one I have owned, and my first one lasted 10 years.
reviews.author: Jimmy the great

reviews.title: "Great grill! Dual fuel is so convenient!"
reviews.text: I highly recommend getting the side fire box also. The only reason this review isn't five stars is because the side fire box must be mounted permanently and cannot be taken off for convenience. Otherwise, it is a fantastic grill.
reviews.author: Tonym1226

reviews.title: "Love it, Love it, Love it!!!!!"
reviews.text: I use this grill for everything, I grill stakes,chops,veggies just about everything on both sides of the grill but I love the charcoal side for grilling pork ribs. I like to grill them really slow so just melt right off the bone.
reviews.author: Saba

reviews.title: "Good option for those who can't afford both"
reviews.text: Pros: Both charcoal and gas in one unit. Side burner works good for heating sauces and lighting charcoal in a chimney starter. Gas side gets fairly hot with lid closed. Cons: Bottom of gas rusted out after several years. Smoker side is difficult to control with heat. Front and back of bottom halves on both sides tend to bend when using grill brush causing grates to fall into in. When the optional side smoker box is added this unit becomes pretty long and awkward to move (but not impossible). I use this product for a variety of grilling and smoking. I have made a couple of modifications including replacing the vents on the gas side with vents designed for the charcoal side so I can control the heat better. I also bought some high temp silicone and gasket material to make the smoker more efficient. I found that if I close the vents on the gas side and take off the grate on over one of the end grates I can put aluminum foil packs of wood chips directly on the flame guard and smoke meats between 180-225°F for more than 12 hours at a time and use less than a 1/2 a tank of propane.
reviews.author: Kenn

reviews.title: "Great Idea But No Thanks!"
reviews.text: Used grille 3 times then failed to work, I called customer service and they wanted the receipt in order to do anything. Any other manufacture would of gladly fixed the problem guess you get what you pay for!

reviews.title: "Char-Griller amazing grill"
reviews.text: I bought this from Lowe's spring 2017 and this is the best grill I've ever had. I have tried a lot of different grills and this hands-down wins. Dual fuel - when it's a weeknight, I'm cooking steaks quickly on the gas side. Heat is excellent and even throughout - no crazy hot spot in one section.  On the weekends, I take my time and fire up the coals. The grate adjusts in multiple positions for searing or thorough cooking. There are two vents - and air draw at the pan and adjustable flue on the chimney. I can control heat temperature and also smoke with this. Smoking - it's not a full bore smoker as is (you can buy the attachment), but I've had great success using coals on the sides of the grill grate and at the lowest setting. A note - add new coals after about 1.5 hrs. Don't believe the “it rusts quickly” comments. Get some Pam and spray down inside, use the cover and if it gets wet, dry it. And by the way, this is a $300 grill and will last as long as a $1000 grill with proper care. Built sturdier than other brand name grills I've had and simple to assemble (1 person). Enjoy!

reviews.title: "Rust bucket"
reviews.text: Concept is great. Went against bad reviews because I wanted it so badly. First year started to show signs of rust. I know how to properly season a grill and it's components. Second season in and gas won't even flow through tubes, grates and mounting points for grates rotted out beyond repair and falling apart. Gas side is completely unusable now. Even after clearing out the tubes still won't flow and it doesn't matter because the rest of it fell apart. As for the charcoal side, well I'm glad it's still there, at least I could still use it. I'm afraid to look at the bottom of it because I hear they rot out too. I don't use water to put out flames or flame ups so I'm hoping the bottom will be ok. Nuts and bolts keeping loosening up and initial set up was not the easiest. That is not a complaint just a fact. Through reading all of the bad reviews over the past days I wish I would have listened to them. Company doesn't seem to back product and they always seem to have an excuse putting the customer at fault. If you want a grill that is super fun to use but only last 1-2 years then go for it. I myself enjoyed it but feel like I wasted money on a pile of rust. Very disappointed.

reviews.title: "Great considering cost"
reviews.text: During the summer months, I grill almost 5 times a week. Having both gas and charcoal on one grill makes this a really versatile grill. I've had mine for 3 years now and have only had to replace the grates and cover. Regular cleaning and seasoning properly are the key to longevity, as is keeping it covered (which means going out after the grill cools to cover it). I do have to say that the side burner rusts far too easily. After about 3 or so uses I find I have to grind and re-paint it with hi-temp spray paint. I only used it once for potatoes- it left a ton of carbon all over the bottom of my pot (which might be user error). The occasions where I do use it have been with my charcoal chimney. A few mods are necessary to make it seal properly, and they are easily found on YouTube. They can make this grill (with the side firebox attached) into a near-Pro smoker. So for the cost and a little effort, you'll have a great setup. Don't trust the temp gages- use your own. Grate level is the way to go. Support was really good. When I ordered new grates, one arrived cracked. Customer service shipped out a replacement no questions asked. I'd buy another, and when it's time I definitely will.
reviews.author: Glenn

reviews.title: "This is a WSar Horse of a Grill"
reviews.text: I had purchased the 50/50 about 10years ago, got a solid 8 years of useage. Did a few modifications to it, heavy duty wheels and axle (for ease of movement) on back, HD casters up front, smoke / air hose (on the charcoal side), fabricated baffles for indirect cooking. Needless to say, I did use the charcoal side more than the gas side. Gas is good for quick flames and smaller meal preparations. Side burner was great for using for my chimney, even being on the far end of the grill so lighting was always tricky and as a sauce warmer/beans and other items. I did have to put the grill down out in the back forty due to years of usage, despite multiple covers and part replacements, rust caught up with her and the front legs finally gave out. I recently got one of the Kettle Grill/Smoker from Char-Griller and am looking forward to many years of grilling happiness just as I had enjoyed with my Duo. I recommend Char-Grillers as I have been happy with most of my purchases from them, easy to mod things if needed, but the Main Thing to assure long use, CLEAN out your grill after each use (after coals have cooled sufficiently of course) but get those used ashes out.... Enjoy yours, KillerGriller

reviews.title: "Awesome abilities"
reviews.text: I bought this grill from Lowe's 3 years ago.  I bought a cover with it as well.  I have had no trouble with it since I bought it.  I cook outside a lot.  I even cook in the winter.  I wore out the first set of burner plates but I expect 3 years is pretty good for those.  My wife had a "small" fire on the gas side one night while I was away and it cooked the thermostat.   Ordered a new one and popped it in in seconds, not minutes.  I love the durability of this grill.  I cook on one side or the other and I cook one side at a time, depends on my mood and what I want to cook.  I bought the burner box for the end of the charcoal side too. Drop in some wood or wood and charcoal both (in the firebox) and I make the neighbors crazy on a Saturday or Sunday.  The smoke from ribs or pork loin or even a whole chicken usually brings them out and has them nosing around.  Only down side I have found is if you are truly into long hours of smoking, it's a bit hard to regulate the temperature but this is a grill first off not a true smoker.  I enjoy this grill very much and I think you will too.  You don't have to spend a thousand dollars or more to make you food taste like a million bucks!  Bon Apetit!

reviews.title: "Sad about my purchase"
reviews.text:
There looks to be a good number of reviews on here already. I probably should have read them before we bought the grill, but we had seen this and all the supposed benefits got us excited. I haven't had it long enough to experience the rust, so I'm going to try to protect against that but what I'm more disappointed in is the performance. The first night I had it, it cooked great. The weather was nice and I fired up both sides of the grill to clean the manufacturing junk off of everything. I was thoroughly impressed with how fast it heated up.
Well, I tried again tonight - we had a pretty good cold snap for North Carolina and I tried to fire up the gas side (second night I've ever used it) and I couldn't get the temperature up past 300 degrees. I finally took an old t-shirt and wrapped it around the two stacks to stop the heat from escaping and I was able to get it up to 330 degrees and it finally cooked the chicken. That is really lame. Every other grill that I've ever had was able to cook through the winter with no issues (and that was in northern Washington and New England) but this is weak at best. I like the fact that I can do both, but I think that given another chance, I'd buy a gas grill that worked and I'd buy a ceramic grill for the charcoal.
reviews.author: xrayman

reviews.title: "Great value"
reviews.text: I've had my duo 5050 for over a year. I also have the side fire box with it. We grill a LOT- normally 5 or more times per week. It's incredibly versatile. I can do stuff on the gas side when time is crunched, grill over charcoal when there is more time (my preferred method), and smoke a ham or ribs on a weekend. Or all both gas & charcoal if we are having a lot of company. The side firebox can double as additional charcoal space if needed. A few things to be wary/mindful of: Do the maintenance. Clean it regularly. As you would expect from anything else, improper maintenance will lead to problems such as rust, etc. The charcoal side and firebox do NOT hold smoke well. It's actually pretty poor as far as that goes. A little furnace-grade wrapping is needed if you really want to use this as a smoker on a serious basis. Not a fan of the charcoal basket adjustment- changing heights during a cook is not recommended, even with gloves on (I burnt my self pretty good while wearing grilling gloves). The side burner does fit a charcoal chimney, but rusts easily due to the finish coming off. Be sure to grind it down and re-coat with hi-temp spray paint on a regular basis. If you are prepared to do the work, this is a great grill. But it requires a good bit of TLC.
